loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia J. is currently in the business of making alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Lucia is 28 years old and is widowed. She has one child, who is in school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana Francisca García vive en el departamento de Soyapango, en la zona central del país. Desde hace ya varios años atrás, Ana Francisca es madre soltera y vive con su hija la cual es empleada en un hospital de la capital. A pesar de contar solo con un nivel de educación primario, Ana ha mantenido a su hija, montando su propio negocio en casa, una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevos insumos y poder renovar su mercadería, a fin de 
impulsar el crecimiento de su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Francisca García lives in the Soyapango area, in the central zone of the country. For many years, Ana Francisca has been a single mother living with her daughter, who is an employee of a hospital in the capital.

Although she only has completed a primary level of education, Ana has supported her daughter and launched her own business at home, a store for everyday products.

Ana seeks this loan to buy new ingredients and to be able to renew her merchandise, to drive growth in her business and the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for her store

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
Narzullo A. applied first to the MicroInvest loan programme in 2009 but he recommends himself already as a reliable client. He was born in 1981 in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Narzullo is married and has 2 children. He has no special education but he is a hard-working young man. He is as an odd-job worker but the general family income comes from their livestock business. He is experienced in livestock so he started the livestock business when he was still very young and helped his father to take care of domestic animals.

Narzullo has one cow and 4 rams. He dreams of having a big farm and a good flock. He is ready to work hard to ensure a good future for his family and to realize his dreams. Now Narzullo is applying to KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for purchasing one milk cow. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best to all lenders.

loans.use: purchasing one milk cow

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị K., 53 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó có 3 con đang đi học.  . Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003, với việc làm ăn có hiệu quả, thu nhập của gia đình đã được cải thiện đáng kể, đã giúp anh chị có điều kiện nuôi con cái ăn học tốt hơn. Thu nhập bình quân hiện nay của gia đình chị gồm có dệt chiếu 25000/ngày, chồng làm công nhân lương  2000 000/tháng, ngoài ra gia đình còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con.. Vòng vốn tới anh chị muốn vay thêm 8.000.000 để mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị K., is 53 years old. She has six children, three of which are still in school. She became a member of the TYM Fund in 2003, and thanks to the effective use of her loans the family’s income has increased significantly since then. This has allowed Mrs. K. and her husband to better provide for their children’s lives and education. Currently, the income of the family consists of an average of 25,000 VND (1.50 USD) per day from weaving straw mats and her husband’s monthly earnings as a laborer of 2,000,000 VND (119 USD). In addition, they receive some support from their grown children. In the next round of lending, she and her husband hope to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to buy pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Battsagaan

texts.en: Battsagaan G. lives with his family in Arhangay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Battsagaan has three teenage children who go to the local high school. In 2003, Battsagaan and his wife started their own business as wholesale meat vendors. They visit herders in the countryside with their truck and purchase livestock at a discount when they can. Once they bring the livestock home, they slaughter them and prepare them for sale. Once the meat is ready for the market, they sell it to wholesale middlemen from their town and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In the future, they would like to create their own channel to bring livestock to the town without visiting each herder in the countryside. They request a loan to purchase livestock from herders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock from herders

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is the mother of two children. She is currently head of the family because her husband has gone abroad for several years, so she has to care for her children. Elena lives in the town of Cahul.

On the territory where she lives she has a garden with an area of 10 hectares (about 25 acres), enough to work in agriculture: namely to grow fruit and vegetables. Victoria wants to grow vegetables and fruit all year around. For this she needs to build three greenhouses. The harvest she will collect, Elena will sell at the wholesale market for the district.

Elena is a loyal customer of Microinvest since she asked for two other loans last year. Now she requires a loan of 30,000 lei to buy building materials needed for construction of the greenhouses. In the future Victoria plans to deal with plant breeding, but only after she has finished the greenhouse construction.

loans.use: To buy building materials for her greenhouses

loans.name: Elsa Del Carmen

texts.es: Elsa del Carmen O. vive en Cuscatancingo departamento de San Salvador, Elsa es madre soltera de dos hijos ya mayores de edad que le ayudan económicamente, tiene una hija en Estados Unidos que le ayuda con 200$ y también Elsa cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hijo;  pero  Elsa siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora que lucho por sacar a su familia adelante ella sola hace muchos años y piensa que aun no es momento de detenerse,  y para de trabajar;  es por ello que ya, hace 5 años empezó con la comercialización de perfumes , cremas de cuerpo, cosméticos entre otros tiendo éxito en su ventas  Elsa solicita un crédito para comprar más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Elsa del Carmen O. lives in Cuscatancingo, in the department of San Salvador. She is a single mother with two grown-up children who help her out financially. Her daughter, who lives in the United States, helps her out with $200.00. She also gets financial support from her son. However, Elsa has always been a very hardworking woman who struggled to help her family get ahead on her own for many years, and she is not thinking about stopping now. For this reason, she started selling perfume, body lotions, and other cosmetics 5 years ago, and she has had success in sales. Elsa is requesting a loan in order to purchase a wider selection of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
"Our last harvest has given us plenty of food for our family. Now, we are busy preparing the land for our next planting. Our farm is the only thing that sustains our family. We dream to buy another farm and be able to send our children to college", says Arlene A., 38-year-old mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and insecticides. The loan will really help her achieve a better harvest and increased income for the whole family.

CEVI helps small business grow. It provides financial services as well as training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Leonor Paulo

texts.pt:
Leonor Paulo M. de 41 anos nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, província de Gaza, estudou até sétima. Casada e mãe de cinco filhos com idades compreendidas entre 22 – 10 anos de idade, para além do marido e filhos vive com um neto.

Leonor saiu de Manjacaze com os pais para cidade de Maputo quando era criança, tendo se formado como professora primária, ela trabalha 8hrs por dia e tem como salário mensal 6,300.00MT e vive na casa própria, embora ainda em obras.

A situação de acomodação na família não é das melhores, os cinco filhos compartilham dois quartos, sendo desafio construir mais dois quartos para proporcionar mínimas condições aos filhos.
 
Com o empréstimo de 15,000.00MT, pretende comprar cimento e outros materiais de construção para dar seguimento com os trabalhos de construção e no futuro sonha terminar com as obras e mobilar a residência.
texts.en:
Leonor Paulo M., 41 years old, was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza province. She studied until seventh grade. She is married and has five children aged 10 to 22 years, and lives with a grandchild as well as her husband and children. When she was a child, Leonor left Manjacaze with her parents for Maputo city. She graduated as an elementary school teacher. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly salary of 6,300 MT. She lives in her own house, although it is still under construction. Accommodations for her family are not the best. The five children share two rooms, and they feel the need to build two more rooms to allow minimal living conditions for them. With the loan of 15,000 MT, she plans to buy cement and other construction materials to allow for the continuation of construction work on her house. In the future, she dreams of finishing construction and furnishing her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home.

loans.name: Juvy Mar

texts.en:
Juvy Mar R. is married to Lyndon and is residing in Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. They have three children: one attending college and the others attending secondary school. Her husband is a gardener of vegetables and fruits while R. manages their sari-sari (variety) store. Their customers are their neighbors and passers-by.

As of now R.’s sari-sari store is improved because of the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is able to obtain loans as additional capital for her business and she enjoys, also, the other benefits like the insurance for her whole family and savings deposits.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Liloy-Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Zablon Nandwa

texts.en:
Zablon M. is a 45year old businessman who is married with three children.  He owns a plot of land on which he has built rental houses for low-income earners.  From this, he gets a monthly profit of about 10,000 Kenyan shillings ($125 U.S.).  He wishes to use this loan to add more rental houses.

Zablon has never borrowed from another microfinance institution other than KADET. This will be his third loan from KADET, where he has been faithful in repaying all his earlier loans. He hopes to buy more land in the future and build even more rental houses.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To build more rental houses.

loans.name: Sonim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonim S., 29 (pictured with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Socheat Yum, 28, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 20 kilometers away. They were married in 2001 and have three young daughters.
 
Sonim has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. Her husband has been a teacher for five years. His motorbike is old and he wants to replace it with a new one, so Sonim is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to make the replacement.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is 34 years old and married. She sells phone rechangable card and accessories. She has been in the business since 2004. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more phone rechangable card and  accessories to sell. She say thank you to all KIVA lenders

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a mother full of hopes and dreams for her children.  She aims to give her two children a complete education for them to become successful in the future.  She is now 41 years old and very determined to work hard for her family while she is still strong and capable of doing a business.  She is married to Noel and they live in the village of Arcon Tumauini, Isabela. Their children are: Christine and Clifford Darryl, they are both in the high school level.  

Tita sells ice candy flavored buko (coconut) in their village.  She can produce 800 -1,000 pieces of ice candy and sell it for PHP5.00 each. With her business, she can also help other residents by helping her to sell her products and they can earn PHP1.00 for every piece ice candy that they can sell.  She hopes to produce more ice candy to increase daily income of PHP500 and able to provide the educational needs of their children. By having additional capital, she believes that her business will further expand and will be more profitable. That is why she is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Barikissou

texts.fr: Barikissou est mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Barikissou vit avec sa famille et supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Barikissou vend des glacières, ustensiles de cuisine, bassines et sacs de sortie pour femme. C’est au Nigeria, État voisin du Bénin que Barikissou va faire ses achats et revient au Bénin pour les livrer à ses clients qui ont fait la demande. C’est depuis huit ans que Barikissou est dans cette activité et elle a déjà eu deux prêts d’ALIDé pour cette activité. Dans l’optique de mieux développer son activité, Barikissou sollicite encore un troisième crédit d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Barikissou is married and the mother of four children, all in school. Barikissou lives with her family, she and her husband provide for the family expenses. Barikissou sells ice coolers, kitchen utensils, basins and women purses.

Barikissou makes her purchases in Nigeria, a neighboring state of Bénin. She makes deliveries to customers who request it . Barikissou has been in this business for eight years, she has already received two loans from Alidé for this activity. In order to better develop her business, she is asking for a third loan from Alidé.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ice coolers, shoes and purses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Guluzar

texts.en: Guluzar was born in 1956 and is the mother of six children. She lives in Fuzuli region. 20 years ago she started a dairy business. She now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows to improve her dairy business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира Курбонова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж работает в местной налоговой инспекции. Сама Мохира более 15 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота, закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mohira K. lives in the Rumy region. She's forty years old, married and has six children. Her husband works in the local tax office. For the past fifteen years Mohira has sold clothes on the market. She is asking for a loan in order to buy new products and increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Aïssatou Demba

texts.fr: Aïssatou Demba D., est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de BIDIANKOTO depuis deux ans et demi. Elle développe un petit commerce en vendant sur table divers produits tels que du riz, de l'huile, du thé, du sucre etc. Avec ses bénéfices elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille en prenant en charge la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Demba D., a 33-year-old wife and mother of 3, has been a member of Village Bank of BIDIANKOTO for 2 1/2 years. She has a small business selling miscellaneous products from a small table, including rice, oil, tea, and sugar. With her income, she helps improve her family's circumstances by paying for her children's health care.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
JamA. is a 32-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon. JamA. has been installing aluminum since 2002. He installs on doors, windows, and kitchen, etc… JamA. is speciA. in his work because he is known for his good work and quality of work. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This van allows him to transport his merchandise to his clients. JamA. has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always repaid on time.

When JamA. first started his business, he passed through some financiA. issues in order to purchase the required tools. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work, and he had experience in aluminum installation. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: to do some maintenance work on his van

loans.name: Gladys Olanda

texts.es:
Gladys M. de 49 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña no cuenta con servicios básicos, esta separada de su esposo con el  tiene 3 hijos uno de 29 años, 24 años y 23 años todos están trabajan.

Gladys comenzó hace 3 años atrás con el servicio de costura para poderse ayudar con sus gastos, ahora ella no tiene horario de trabajo por lo que trabaja en su casa sola, una de las dificultades de su trabajo es la competencia que hay en su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ladrillos, cemento para arreglar mejor su casa, en el futuro quiere arreglar mejor su vivienda para poder tener espacio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys M. is 49 years old and lives in the semi-urban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her house is made of reeds and does not receive basic services. Gladys is separated from her husband and has three children (ages 29, 24, and 23) who are working.

She started providing sewing services three years ago in order to help with her expenses. Gladys does not have a set work schedule because she works alone at home. One of the difficulties she faces is the amount of competition in this line of work.

With this loan, Gladys will buy bricks and cement for remodeling her house. In the future, she wants to make additional improvements to her home so that she can have a better space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks & cement for remodeling her house

loans.name: Jeremías Azarias

texts.es: Jeremías Azarías T. P. de 35 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 y 16 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Desde hace 10 años que Jeremías posee  una panadería, en la que junto a su esposa se dedican a elaborar el pan que posteriormente Jeremías sale a vender de manera ambulante por las calles de Cojutepeque, así mismo su esposa se encarga de atender las ventas por unidad o al por mayor que se hacen en la panadería. Jeremías solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, levadura y otro horno para poder hacer más pan. Tanto para él como para su esposa contar con la panadería es una gran bendición debido a que es a través de esta como obtienen el dinero para pagar todos los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeremías Azarías T. P. is 35 years old, and lives in Cojutepeque, in the Cuscatlán region of El Salvador. He lives together with his family, including his wife and his two sons, ages 6 and 16, both of whom are enrolled in school. For 10 years Jeremías has owned a bakery, in which, together with his wife, he bakes the same bread that, in years past, he went out on foot to sell in the streets of Cojutepeque. Now, his wife manages the bakery's sales, both of individual units and of wholesale orders. Jeremías requests a loan through which he would be able to purchase flour, lard, yeast, and another oven so that he may produce greater quantities of bread. For his wife as much as for himself, Jeremías looks to his bakery as a great blessing for his family, as it provides them with a means to earn the money they need to pay for all the expenses of their home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de harina, manteca, levadura y un horno.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Flor Imelda

texts.es: Imelda tiene 27 anos y vive con su esposo y su hijo de 8 meses, son originarios de Sumpango Sacatepequez, ellos son propietarios de una tienda de ropa tipica, asi como tambien de un bus que transporta a personas dentro de la misma comunidad, todos los dias Imelda confecciona blusas tipicas para venderlas en su negocio, ella desea contribuir con su familia para tener una mejor calidad de vida, esta es la primera vez que adquiere un prestamo para lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, el dinero que ahora solicita sera invertido en la compra de mas blusas a si como tambien se dedicara a vender sueteres que le serviran para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Imelda, 27, lives with her husband and her 8-month-old son in Sumpango Sacatepequez. They own a store where they sell typical clothing as well as a bus that provides transportation for people within the same community. Imelda manufactures typical blouses every day to sell in her store. She hopes to contribute to seeing that her family has a better quality of life. This is her first loan and she pledges to be punctual with her payments. The money she is asking for will be used to buy more blouses and she will also sell sweaters that will serve to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vitolio

texts.en:
Vitolio M. is 26 and married with 2 children (ages 1 and 3).  She owns a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Vitolio has many years of experience in this business.  Vitolio needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Vitolio joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vitolio's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vitolio M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yusabia

texts.en:
Yusabia O., 37, is married and has two children aged 10 and 5. Her business is located at AA-Njenga, Nairobi. She has been running a printing, photocopying and typesetting business. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is accessing funds for expansion. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy a printer and a photocopier to expand her business. In the future she hopes to open her own computer training school. She is a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy a printer and photocopier

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B., who received junior high education, sells secondhand clothes in Elmina.  A married mother of  four children, Ama helps her husband, a trader, by paying school fees and other expenses that may arise. Her loan will be used to buy bales of secondhand clothes for sale, and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy bales of secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Akoeba

texts.fr:
Cette  dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de tissus pour la confection de pantalon et chemise, elle expose ses marchandises au bord de la route, ainsi elle attire plus le regard des passants. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’adawlato, faisant face en ce moment à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’une demi-balle de tissu pantalon et d’un quart de balle de tissu chemise.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady generates income by reselling clothing fabric for shirts and pants. She offers her wares from the roadside, to attract more attention. She gets her supplies from the Adawlato market. As she is currently confronted with a reduced stock of supplies, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy half a bale of cloth for pants and one fourth bale of cloth for shirts. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth

loans.name: Yev

texts.en: Yev S., 62, is a widow who lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She sells groceries from home for an income of about USD 10 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries

loans.name: Khamisa

texts.en:
Khamisa S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Khamisa is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Balitwegomba Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Ten years ago, 30-year-old M. Juliet was like any other naïve business upstart. Being in two minds did not help either, as she was on the one hand being dissuaded from trying her hand at any other business, whilst her close consorts were constantly prevailing upon her to start a retail shop.

With huge reserves of courage and conviction in tow, Juliet, in the midst of all this, made up her mind to start a retail shop in Buwenge, Jinja. She decided to dispense with the soft drink business she had all along banked on as her main source of livelihood.

Juliet’s hard work ethic spawned an unprecedented growth in her business profits. As her niche grew, so did the profits accruing to her business. In a week, she reveals her business generates 500,000 Ugandan shillings. With this income, this married lady has gotten into a steady stride in terms of fully providing for all her four children. Juliet has also been eking out supplementary profits from her poultry and commercial motorcycle businesses.

With this loan, Juliet wants to rejuvenate her retail shop with more merchandise like sugar, soap, bags of rice, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items for her store like sugar, salt, rice and soap

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr.Alberto;   él es natural de Sicuani,  tiene 55 años de edad, el socio es casado, El socio realiza como principal actividad la pasamanería, venta de (candados, romanas, tijeras, balanzas,) pero también él se dedica a otras actividades porque nuestro socio es todo un personaje, él está metido en todos los negocios que le generen dinero y lo mantengan ocupado, este socio peculiar los meses de enero, febrero y agosto prepara sahumerios, el en estas fechas los vende para las diferentes actividades religiosas de la zona; Él socio también es fotógrafo en ocasiones, él trabaja con el municipio de Huancarani chico en los diferentes eventos, ferias, desfiles, aniversarios y otros y se dedica a filmar, y sacar fotografías para luego venderlos; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la pasamanería.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member is Alberto. He is a native of Sicuani, 55 years old and married. He main activity is making decorations and selling items like padlocks, scissors and scales, but he also does other activities because he is an important person. He is involved in all of the businesses that make money for him and keep him busy. During the months of January, February and August this member makes insense, which he sells during those months for different religious activities in the region. He is also sometimes a photographer. He works for the municipality of Huancarani at different events: fairs, parades, anniversaries and others, which he films and takes photos that are later sold. He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for making decorations. This member is grateful for and appreciates the support given to him and is committed to fulfil the repayment of his debt within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Betty Consuelo

texts.es:
Betty es una madre D. familia D. 55 años D. edad que vive junto al ultimo D. sus tres hijos, es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya independizados. ResiD. en el distrito D. Chepén, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia del mismo nommbre, ubicado en la región La Libertad, a una hora D. distancia D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. diez años a la venta D. carne D. pollo en un puesto ubicado en el interior del mercado D. su distrito, ella trabaja diariamente para atender la demanda D. sus clientes y para sacar adelante a su familia. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro se ha hecho muy conocida y tiene un grupo D. clientes fijos.

Betty desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas carne D. pollo para venderla a sus clientes y D. esa manera aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer luchadora, ha sabido salir adelante a pesar D. haberse quedado sola. Sus vecinos y compañeros D. trabajo le tienen mucha confianza y respeto.
texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and a mother of three children. Betty is widowed and lives with her oldest child. Her other children are now independent. She lives in the district of Chepen, an agricultural area in the region of La Libertad, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years Betty has worked selling chickens from a stand insiD. the central market of the district. She works every day to meet the demands of her customers and help her family's quality of life. Thanks to the many years she's been working in this place, she has become well known and has a steady group of customers.

Betty would like to grow her business by purchasing more chickens and increasing her sales, so she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative to help her reach her goal. Betty is a fighter, and she learned how to get by and take care of her family after being left on her own. Her neighbors and co workers have a lot of confidence and respect for Betty.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase more chickens to continue growing her business

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mrs. Kang A. is a 40-year-old married woman and local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She and her husband use this land to grow different kinds of crops, including potatoes and rice. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. Kang A. doesn’t have capital to use on her field during this coming rainy season. So she is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds to begin growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva L. is from the village of New Visayas, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old and married.  Eva owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community.  Eva has been engaged in business for over three years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional inventory.  Eva is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to renovate her business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI.  Eva plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

-----------------------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Liloba Plus Group

texts.en:
Liloba Plus is a group of 15 owners of small businesses chaired by Maguy Y.. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Maguy Y. sells smoked fish. She has been in business since 1987. She has acquired solid experience selling smoked fish. Since she joined one of Hope’s groups called “Liloba Plus” meaning “Word” in English, her business has been significantly reinforced through seven loans she has received from MFI HOPE DRC and repaid them properly. 

Through her sales, Maguy makes about US$ 100 per week. She plans to use the next loan to purchase some more bags of smoked fish and sell them at a profit in order to increase her income. She dreams one day of opening a food shop. Maguy is 58 years old, married and a mother of six children between the ages of 22 and 35; only two of them attend school. The rest of the children are independent. In spite of her age, Maguy likes selling because it gives her the opportunity to make contact with many different people, and once they become permanent customers she is able to offer them quality products at a better price.

loans.use: purchasing some more bags of smoked fish to resell at a profit

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 71 years old and married. To make a living, Crescencia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Crescencia also raises chickens, and she also makes vinegar out of coconuts. She sells her vinegar at her small sari-sari store.

Crescencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crescencia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Crescencia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Lazaro Eddy

texts.es: El señor Lázaro Eddy posee un negocio, que es la venta de fajas de cuero de manera ambulante y sus alrededores. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio y la familia las compras las realiza a diferentes proveedores los cuales le ofrecen el producto más favorable. el está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que le están ofreciendo unas fajas a precios más favorables por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar su negocio, para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
Lázaro Eddy works as a street vendor selling leather belts locally. This is not Lázaro Eddy's first loan; loan proceeds have already been a great help to him and his family, allowing him to make purchases from providers offering the best product. He is requesting a new loan to make additional improvements in his business so that he can provide his family with necessary income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bùi Thị Thường's Group

texts.en:
Bùi Thị T. is a 40-year-old married woman who has two school-aged children. She lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh B. Ninh. Bùi is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Nguyệt Cầu 1 - nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Bùi raises cattle to sell. She has been in business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,800,000 VND a month.

In 2008 Bùi joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She is now requesting a new loan, her third from SEDA, of 7,392,000 VND that will be used to invest in expanding the business. Bùi plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Kiều Thị Huề is a 64-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 3. Lê Thị B. is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. **************************************************************** T. Bùi Thị (20209040001) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh B. Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cụm Nguyệt Cầu 1 - nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 9 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND. Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Kiều Thị Huề (0) là 64 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. Lê Thị B. (0) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her cattle business

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita B. is from the village of Miaray, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old, married, and has six adult children. To make a living, Julita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Julita has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Julita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to expand the business. Julita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Julita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Melessa Regis

texts.es:
Melessa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Clavelinas”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene18 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y sin hijos, tiene  grado de instrucción de secundaria completa.
Melessa  va empezar a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, La señorita solicitará un primer préstamo de de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que le servirá para empezar y tener su propio negocio de compra y venta de animales menores (cerdo).
 Su sueño es lograr que crezca su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es que tiene funcionamiento en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Melessa is a member of the “Mujeres Clavelinas” community bank which is in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 18 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She has completed her secondary education.

Melessa began working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting her first loan of 500 nuevos soles to set up and have her own business buying and selling young animals (pigs).

Her dream is to succeed in growing her business.

What she likes about her community bank is that it works in her community.

loans.use: To invest in her business of buying and selling young animals (pigs)

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and instant noodles, in the local community. She is also buying and selling electronic loads from several networks like SMART and GLOBE. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI.  The previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. This loan will be Elvira's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia is a resident of Kamoki, Pakistan, famous for its rice production. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for over five years. Fouzia is a supportive lady. She supports her husband financially by sewing clothes. She sews clothes for her nearby area clients and gets good by completing the sewing orders on time. The earned income helps her to pay the utilities expenses. 

She is the mother of a son and two daughters. Her daughters also help in her business by sewing clothes. Her son is 15 years old and works in a factory for a low income. Fouzia couldn’t educate them due to limited financial resources. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will use the loan to purchase a buffalo. He is involved in a profession of selling animals. He buys young animals, raises them and then sells then for a good profit. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further by investing the loan money into it and it will result in better financial conditions for her family. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fouzia.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her husband's animal sales business

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony, age 29, is married to Rhoda and together they have one child who is two years. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells foodstuffs  like cooking oil, flour, etc. Antony was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was already a member. Antony has been running this business for three years. With this loan, he intends to buy more stock for his shop. 

He hopes to be a self-reliant businessman and support his family better.

loans.use: to buy cereals, flour, maize, detergent, and other products for the shop.

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Selling pieces of wood is the most important part of 26 year old Seab S.’s daily work. Her husband can earn a profit by driving a boat to pick up people who need to cross the river. Seab S. and her husband support their two children who are studying in public school. This family can make an average income of $8 per day for spending on the whole family.

Currently, Seab S. wishes to expand her sales business, but she lacks the funds to make it possible. So, she would like a loan to purchase additional pieces of wood to sell in order to make extra revenue.

loans.use: To purchase additional pieces of wood for selling.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina O. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 61 years old. Marina is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tailoring business, providing both general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Marina has been engaged in her business for over thirty-three years and earns approximately $80 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. 

Marina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and sewing materials. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and sewing materials

loans.name: Nancy Sianoi

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Naivasha for the last four years.  She is 53 years old, married to Joseph K. and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to prepare the land and buy seed and fertilizer in readiness for planting.

In the future, she plans to buy her own farming equipment and save on having to rent.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy seed and fertilizer in readiness for planting.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
Don José, de 43 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de ropa y medicina, vive con su esposa y 4 hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad, solamente él trabaja para sostener la familia. El negocio lo inicio hace varios años, unos amigos comerciantes le ayudaron para que entrara al negocio, no tiene un horario fijo y actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertir en ropa y medicinas para vender.
La compra le permitirá incrementar la mercadería y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, logrando crecer como vendedor y en futuro lograr su meta de ser mayorista y ofrecer a su esposa y sus hijos un futuro diferente.
texts.en:
José, 43, lives in San Rafael Orient, San Miguel department.  He sells clothes and medicine.  He lives with his wife and four children who are 10, 8, 6 and 4 years of age.  He’s the only one who works to support the family.

He started the business several years ago.  Some merchant friends helped him get into the business.  He does not have a fixed work schedule and needs a loan to invest in clothes and medicine to sell.

The purchase will allow him to increase merchandise and meet customer demand leading to growth as a salesman and in the future be able to reach his goal of becoming a wholesaler and offering his wife and children a different future.

loans.use: To buy clothes and medicine.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 29 años es una mujer amable y cariñosa. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Omar de 35 años y sus dos hijos. Maribel trabaja en un colegio particular, en el cargo de auxiliar del colegio cerca de su casa. Por lo tanto, es la encargada de la formación y la disciplina de los alumnos de ese colegio en épocas escolares. Le gusta su trabajo, a pesar de que los alumnos son inquietos y rebeldes, ama su labor, ya que con este ingreso ayuda a su esposo que es panadero, a cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, además que poco a poco puede terminar de construir su casa. En adelante desea acondicionar un local e instalar su propia panadería, donde pueda trabajar su esposo y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una asidua  trabajadora mujer, por ello dice “que con confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente”. Por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento y arena, para mandar a construir las columnas de la pared de su casa, y con el resto pagará la mano de obra de su albañil.
texts.en:
Maribel, 29 years old, is a friendly and affectionate woman.  She lives in her own home in the company of her husband Omar, 35, and their two children.  Maribel works in a special school, under the charge of the assistant administrator of the school close to her home.  As such, she is in charge of the formation and discipline of the students during the school year.  She likes her work. In spite of the restless and rebellious students, she loves her job because with her income she can help her husband, a baker, to cover the costs of living and educating their children, in addition to finishing the construction of their house, little by little.   

In the future she would like to add a space for a store and have her own bakery, where her husband can work and improve the quality of life of the whole family.  This is her second loan with MFP, where she is a hardworking woman, for which reason they say "that the trust her and are sure that she make all of her payments punctually".  With the loan that she has requested, she will buy cement and sand, in order to construct columns on the wall of her house, and with the rest she will pay the mason for his labor.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand, and to hire a mason

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara Maria R. P., vive en  Cartagena, ciudad ubicada en el departamento de Bolívar, allí tiene un negocio de servicios  de internet, telecomunicaciones  y dulcería en general;  Clara es una mujer muy dedicada a su vida familiar que siempre ha logrado apoyar a sus  3 hijos que ahora están en  las edades de 20 a 26 años. cona llamadas locales, nacionales e internacionales y finalmente adicionó el internet, como una herramienta para que todos en su comunidad estuvieran comunicados, mientras ella recibía un ingreso por ofrecer servicios necesaioros a sus clientes. Clara es una mujer que reconoce el gran apoyo institucional por eso expresa que “gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, nuestro negocio ha crecido brindándole un mejor servicio a sus clientes.” Su sueño es convertirlo en un centro de comunicaciones muy competitivo que cada día este actualizado con  los avances tecnológicos y es que esto es justamente lo que ella llama un gran desafío.
Su credikiva que es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación lo invertirá en tres partes: con la primera   comprará equipos de computo, con la segunda  invertirá en el arreglo de los equipos en mal estado  y con la tercera parte del crédito hará mantenimiento locativo, para  continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Clara Maria R. P. lives in Cartagena, a city located in the departament of Bolíva. She has a business there offering internet service, telecommunications and general sweets. Clara is a woman who is very dedicated to her family life. She has always been able to support her 3 children who are 20 and 26 years old. She offered local, national and international calls, and then finally she added internet as tools for everyone in her community to stay in touch, while she received income for offering these necessary services to her customers. Clara is a woman who acknowledges the great institutional support she has received and for that she says "thanks to the support from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, our business has grown, offering a better service to the customers." Her dream is to convert it into a very competitive communication center that is always up to date with technological advances and that it just what she calls a big challenge. 

Her Kiva loan, which is her third loan from the Fundación, will be invested in three things:  first, she will buy computers. Second, she will invest in repairing the computers that are in porr condition and third, she will invest in maintenance of the locale, in order to keep offering an excellent service in hr community.

loans.use: to invest in three things. First she will buy computers. Second, she will invest in repairs, and third, she will do maintenance on the locale.

loans.name: Lanh's Group

texts.en:
There are five people who formed a group loan. Mrs. Lanh was born in 1968 and is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. The members of this group will use their money to help support their different purposes. 

Lanh's husband is a wedding chef who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He also earns a living as a motorcycle taxi driver. This couple has five children: two are wedding chefs who support their father carriers and the others three are students and also help their parents businesses. 

Mrs. Lanh earns her living by selling baby shell. Because her house is getting old for those living in it, Mrs. Lanh wants to fix it up. Thus, Lanh would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings for fixing her house up for better family living.

loans.use: To fix her house up for better family living.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 41-year-old married woman, living in Saida with her husband and three children. Bassima owns a shop where she has sold gifts and souvenirs in addition to decorating lamps, since 2009. 

Bassima is a hard worker. She used to be a tutor, but her courage and strong will to improve herself led her to start her own business. She started saving a small capital to open her shop, and in fact she made it. 

Bassima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to add new products to increase her income and expand her collections of products such as silver and crystals and starting to sell bed sheets and blankets.

Bassima wants to expand her shop and to introduce new products continuously to her customers. She helps her husband in raising their children and providing them secure and healthy living with the necessary education they must get. She hopes to see her kids reach high levels.

loans.use: To increase her collection through adding silver, crystals and blankets.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 31 years old and is married with one child. Her child is 1 year and 11 months old. 

Gina is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for six years. She earns about 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Gina hopes to put up another business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sulaina

texts.en:
Sulaina N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). Sulaina has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She also generates additional income through selling Bitengi (African attire). She sells her products in the shop, by means of retail.    

Sulaina has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves.  

The main business challenges for Sulaina include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to own a bridal salon. She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids.

loans.name: Narsiza

texts.es:
Narsiza tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y vive en una comunidad rural con muchos deseos de desarrollo, ubicada en el distrito de Túcume en Lambayeque. 

Narsiza se dedica desde hace 8 años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (patos, pavos y gallinas) en su domicilio. Los pobladores de su zona se han convertido en clientela ya establecida para Narsiza. Ellos saben de la buena crianza que Narsiza les da a sus animales es por eso que la prefieren a ella antes que a otros.

Narsiza solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de más aves, de alimento balanceado para estas y de mejoras en el corral donde las cría.

Narsiza es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, es un cliente antiguo para nuestra entidad que canceló adecuadamente sus pagos.
texts.en:
Narsiza is 49 years of age, married and lives in a developing rural community located in the district of Túcume in Lambayeque. 

Narsiza has raised and sold poultry such as ducks, turkeys and chickens in her home for the last eight years. Her community have become an established customer base for Narsiza, as they know that she treats her animals well and this is why they prefer to buy from her than anyone else. 

Narsiza is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to purchase more birds, provide them with a balanced diet and improve their pen.

Narsiza is hardworking, responsible, and a long standing client with Edpyme Alternative who has paid for her previous loan installments in full.

loans.use: to purchase birds, provide them with a balanced diet and improve their pen.

loans.name: Doris Gabriela

texts.es:
Doris GAbriela tiene 20 años, vive en Union Libre, vive con la compañera y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Doris se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es seguir adelante.

Le gusta salir los domingos con la familia.
texts.en:
Doris Gabriela is 20 years old.  She is in a relationship and lives her partner and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “La Unión” (Unity) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Medellín which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Doris is a corn and rice farmer.  She does her purchases in Ventanas and sells at daily farmers markets, especially Sunday’s.

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are competition and weather variations.

Her dream is to continue making progress.  She enjoys going out Sundays with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. He has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing from NATASHA & AVON. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON.

Ruel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON.

loans.name: Yeghishe

texts.en: Yeghishe keeps livestock and cultivates land. Yeghishe would like to start growing cabbage, as it is in great demand. Cabbage farming requires much work, so Yeghishe plans to hire workers to help. With the requested loan he plans to purchase cabbage seeds and pay the salaries of the workers. Yeghishe will increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions. He lives with his wife, who is a school teacher.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage seeds and pay workers' salaries

loans.name: Josefa Alegria

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Josefa, tiene 50 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tienen  dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero aún viven en su casa. Ella es licenciada en enfermería y trabaja en el IESS (Instituto Ecuatoriano de Bienestar Social).

Además de trabajar de enfermera también se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días tanto en su  trabajo como en sus ventas, nos cuenta que una vez que ella sale de su trabajo se va a visitar a sus clientes y también  vende en su lugar de trabajo. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lleva  4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido  muy bien, nos dice que le encantan las ventas y además gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.  Este es el quinto ciclo en el banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño  seguir adelante en su trabajo y en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Amor Y Felicidad” (Love and Happiness) meet every 15 days. Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Josefa. She is 50 years old, divorced, and has two grown children who still live with her at home. Josefa is a licensed nurse and works for IESS (Ecuadorian Institute of Social Welfare).

In addition to her job as a nurse, Josefa also works as a merchant. She sells products made by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Josefa works every day, both at her job and in her sales business. She says that as soon as she leaves for work, she visits with her customers and also sells products where she works as a nurse. Josefa offers her products on credit and collects payment every 15 days. She has been in business for four years and has done very well. Josefa says that she enjoys selling and earning extra money.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and accessories. She is receiving her fifth loan from the Communal Bank and enjoys the services provided by Fundación ESPOIR. Her dream is to move forward in her job and in her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and accessories.

loans.name: José Roque

texts.es:
En santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas en el cantón Santo Domingo encontramos a José, un hombre de 56 años quien se dedica al rencauche de zapatas de vehículos. José está separado de su esposa y vive con sus dos hijos. Su hija menor tiene quince años y está cursando la secundaria mientras que Jonathan un joven de 28 años con capacidades especiales no trabaja. José es el único que lleva el sustento al hogar, dice que no recibe ayuda económica de nadie. En su tiempo él comparte con sus dos hijos.

José nos cuenta que a pesar de que su jornada de trabajo es larga nada se le hace difícil porque le gusta lo que hace y por ello entrega a sus clientes un trabajo de calidad.

Hace muchos años José trabajaba como operario aprendiz, pero desde hace quince años se independizó y puso su propio taller de reparación. Hoy en día necesita renovar algunas de sus máquinas, lo cual facilitaría su trabajo y para ello contactó a Fernando quien es asesor de Fundación Alternativa para poder sacar un crédito y así mejorar su negocio.

El sueño de José es poder tener su casa propia, y en un futuro cercano su carro propio. Todo esto para ver a sus hijos gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
We find José in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas in the Santo Domingo canton.  He is 56 years old, and he repairs brake shoes.  José is separated from his wife, and he lives with his two children.  His youngest child is 15 years old, and she is in high school.  Jonathan, age 28, has special needs and does not work.  José is the only one who supports his household.  He says that he does not receive financial support from anyone.  He shares his time with his two children.

José tells us that in spite of his long work day, nothing is difficult for him because he likes what he does.  Therefore, he delivers quality work to his customers.

A long time ago José worked as an apprentice operator.  However, he became independent 15 years ago, and he established his own repair shop.

He now needs to refurbish some of his machines.  This will facilitate his work.  In order to do so he contacted Fundación Alternativa’s adviser to be able to get a loan and improve his business.

Jose’s dream is to be able to have his own house.  He also dreams of having his own car in the near future.  All of this is to see his children enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his business.

loans.name: Nakato

texts.en: Nakato  lives in  Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a banana stall at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for many years. She has requested a loan of UGX 40,0000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her aspirations and goals are to educate her children through university, and also to build rental rooms. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Alberta has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
 
Alberta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
L a señora Karla  yesenia es casada  con el señor  Aricel  y con quien  procreo dos hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad, el  grupo se llama santo domingo  y se integra de tres señoras.

      Ella  es ama de casa y es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo  en fundación realidad, y es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos en donde lleva practicando  tres meses  y le está resultando.

      Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó  ya que  quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y tiene dos hijos que desean  darle lo más necesario.

       Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda ir incrementando más  sus ingresos para  solventar gastos pequeños de la casa.
  
     Las dos integrantes más que  conforman el grupo san la señora  Araley  quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de  ingredientes para la elaboración de  dulces de nuégado y por otro lado la señora Yolanda en la elaboración de tacos.
texts.en:
Karla Yesenia is married to Aricel, and they have 2 children for which they are responsible. This group is called "Santo Domingo", and it is made up of 3 women.

She is a housewife, and this is the first time that she has applied for a loan from Fundación Realidad.  The loan is needed to buy ingredients for making tacos.  She has been doing this work for 3 months, and it's going well.  Her inspiration for this business is her desire to support her husband by bringing in more family income. They want to provide their 2 children with the necessities.

What she most wants is to gradually increase her income, through her small business, in order to cover her household expenses.  The 2 other members of the group are Araley, who is using the loan to buy ingredients for making nuegados (fried yucca dumplings), and Yolanda, who is using it to make tacos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tacos.

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru: Джумагуль  48 лет, вдова, воспитывает дочь – школьницу. Джумагуль начала свой бизнес в 1991 году, использовав свой стартовый капитал в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS)на покупку коровы.  На сегодняшний день, Джумагуль  зарабатывает около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи мясных и молочных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Джумагуль запросила кредит в компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры»  в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота.  Доходы от кредита Джумагуль планирует вложить в обучение ее дочери.
texts.en: Djumagul is 48 years old, widowed and is raising a teenage daughter. Djumagul started her business in 1991, using 5000 som (KGS) as starting capital to purchase her first cow. Currently, Djumagul makes 7000 som (KGS) a month from meat and dairy sales. To further expand her business and purchase more cattle, Djumagul is asking for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and partners". Profits from this loan Djumagul is planning to spend on her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jose Alfi

texts.es: José Alfi, tiene la edad 59 de años, está soltero y vive solo actualmente. El con el crédito va compra los insumos para la asistencia de tomate. El cuenta con la siembra del cultivo ya establecida y necesita hacerle unas pequeñas  mejoras o aplicaciones de abonos por lo cual necesita compra estos insumos y así tenerlo en las mejores condiciones de cosecha. El quiere obtener de su plantación el máximo de cosecha tanto en calidad como cantidad apta para la venta al mercado local. El quiere generar la mayor de las ganancias para salir adelante con el crédito y ganancias para mejorar su calidad económica cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Alfi is 59 years old.  He is single and currently lives alone.  He will use his loan to buy supplies with which to care for his tomato plants.  His crops are already established and he needs to make some small improvements and apply some fertilizers.  For this reason, he needs to buy supplies and ensure his crops are in the best condition possible.  He would like to obtain the best harvest he can from his fields both in terms of quality and quantity so that he can sell his tomatoes in the local market.  He would like to make as much profit as possible so that he can move forward with his loan and improve his financial situation.

This is the first loan that José Alfi has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his tomato plants

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 51 años de edad y es casado fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Porfirio vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Porfirio trabaja en construcción civil y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en venta de productos de primera necesidad. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Porfirio requiere el préstamo para compra mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más.
