El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Porfirio was born in the city of Cusco (in Peru) and is 51 years old. He is married and has two children. Today, Porfirio lives in the same town where he was born. Porfirio works in civil construction and has a family business that sells foodstuffs. It's been two years already that he's been working in this business, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. 

At this time, Porfirio is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar and much more. The member is a responsible and hard-working man, and it is for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to join the "Chaska Nawi" community bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, for example rice, sugar, and much more.

loans.name: Medi Flavia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Medi Flavia; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, ella alquila un horno donde elabora diferentes tipos de panes y luego lo vende en la plaza de Oropesa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, leña, manteca y aceite para preparar pan.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Medi Flavia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. Medi Flavia divides her time between her daily activities and her bakery business. She rents an oven for making different types of bread and then sells her products at the plaza in Oropesa. Medi Flavia works from 8am to 5pm. Through her work she is able to help her children move forward. Medi Flavia wants to expand her bakery, so she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as flour, firewood, butter, and oil for preparing bread.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, butter, and oil.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, de 33 años, es una mujer muy amable, buena y sobre todo responsable. Es madre soltera de una hija de 13 años, vive en casa de su tía a quien ayuda en los gastos que se generan en el hogar. EL trabajo de Manuela consiste en la venta de lencería, tiene muchas amigas en el centro en donde labora, y es ahí en donde ella puede colocar las prendas exclusivas de diseños únicos y de calidad excelente, es por eso que sus clientes siempre le solicitan dicha mercadería. Lleva  ya más de tres años en este negocio y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Tiene dos lugares en donde vende, en su casa y en el colegio en donde labora como docente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder realizar ambos trabajos, además está contenta por que le va bien, ya que genera buenas ganancias. Sin embargo hay clientes que demoran en pagarle. Anhela tener una tienda de venta de rooa. Este será el sexto crédito con la institución MFP, esta contenta con el grupo al que pertenece, espera poder seguir siendo la socia responsable y puntual como lo ha sido hasta ahora. Agradece mucho por la oportunidad que le dan de poder tener mayor capital de trabajo y espera seguir trabajando juntos por mucho más tiempo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería de lencería para así seguir ofreciendo lo mejor a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en: Manuela, 33, is a woman who is very friendly, kind, and above all, responsible. She a single mother with a 13 year-old daughter.  She lives in her aunt's house, and she helps her with the household expenses.  Manuela has a business selling lingerie.  She has a lot of friends in the center where she works, and she sells a lot of her garments there.  She has exclusive garments of unique designs and excellent quality, which is why her customers always seek out her merchandise.  She has been working in this business for more than 3 years, and up until now she has done it alone.  She has 2 places where she sells: in her house and in the school where she works as a teacher.  What she likes about her work is that it gives her the time to carry out both jobs.  Also, she is very pleased because it is going very well and the business is generating good earnings.  However, she has some customers who are late with their payments.  Her desire is to have her own clothing store.  This will be her 6th loan with MFP, and she is content with her communal bank.  She hopes to be able to continue being a responsible member who is punctual with her payments, as she has been up until now.  She is grateful for the opportunity that that is being provided to her to have more working capital in her business, and she hopes to continue to work with Microfinanzas Prisma for a long time.  With the sum requested, she will buy more lingerie merchandise, so that she can continue to offer the best to her loyal customers.

loans.use: to buy more lingerie to sell

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en: Vuqar KH. is 39 years old and has been engaged in the cattle breeding business and milk sales. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is married and has two daughters. He has more than 10 years of experience in this field. His wife actively helps him run the business.  His monthly income is 250 AZN. Vuqar is successful because the product he sells is very popular and in the high demand. People in Azerbaijan use milk and meat in everyday cuisine. He would like to expand his business and for this purpose he has applied for a 1000 AZN loan. He will use the loan to purchase one milking cow and one calf.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 58-year-old farmer from the village Kumisi, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife Evgenia, 2 sons (28 and 22 years old), daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren.

The main source of the income for the family is agriculture. They own 4 milk cows and 8 calves. The family sells milk, yogurt and cheese in Tbilisi (the capital city of Georgia). The family also sells besom which they make. the total average monthly family income is 1000 Laris.

David requested credit to build a house roof. The family has constructed a new house which needs a roof. When it is finished, David’s elder son (married) will move into it with his family. They will have more space and better living conditions for the children and the whole family.

loans.use: to build a roof

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is a 48-year-old, married man with four children. He and his family live in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Emiliano operates a service-based business; specifically, he provides transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for ten years, and every month he earns approximately 10,800 PHP from this work.

Emiliano is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle so that he can provide better service to his customers. He has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Emiliano hopes to double his business income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to provide better service by repairing his existing vehicle

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business selling food stuffs in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase salt and sugar. In the future, she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Nesbit

texts.en: Nesbit is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a quiet and jovial man. He provides bicycle services to students and the staff of a nearby school. He has been in this business for five years. His business challenge is the lack of a permanent place during sunny days. He will be using the loan of Kes 5,000 to buy another bicycle to increase the mode of transportation. Nesbit's goal is to own several motorbikes in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy another bicycle.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y que ha sacado adelante sola y cuyas edades comprenden 23, 18, 14años, los cuales la ayudan en el negocio, Maria se esfuerza muy duro cada día porque quiere que sus hijos sean mejores que ella y que cuando ella les falte tengan la mejor herencia que les puede dejar, que son sus estudios.

Maria ha trabajado desde joven, ella se dedicaba al campo hace ya varios años, pero como siempre quiso mejorar cada día se esforzó mucho y fruto de ese esfuerzo puedo ahorrar para tener el negocio en el cual se dedica actualmente que son los carritos de paseo, por hoy Maria tiene 7 carritos y trabaja muy duro todos los días, ella trabaja en los parques y en las zonas turísticas de su ciudad ya que siempre hay niños y allí ella puede ofrecer su servicio de paseo, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que le gusta tratar bien a los niños y se alegra cuando ve la sonrisa en el rostro de los pequeñines.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar otro carrito de paseo para así tener más ingresos con lo que le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida y en especial la de sus hijos, asi como también ahorrar para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesion a sus hijos y Tener una feria para niños”.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, 48, has three children that she loves very much and has raised by herself; their ages are 23, 18 and 14 years.  They help her with her business.  María strives hard every day because she wants her children to be better than her and so that when she’s no longer here they can have the best possible inheritance she can leave them: an education.

María has worked since she was young.  Several years ago she worked in the fields but because she always wanted to improve herself she worked hard and thanks to her efforts was able to save up to have the business she now works at which is children’s toy riding cars.  María owns seven cars and works hard every day.  She works in parks and tourist areas in her city because there are always children there and she can offer her services.  She believes that she does well in her business because she likes to treat the children well and it makes her happy to see the smiles on the little ones’ faces.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she’ll be able to buy another little car to earn more income which will help her improve her and especially her children’s quality of life as well as to be able to save up in order to reach her greatest dream: “to provide her children with professions and to have a children’s funfair.”

loans.use: to buy children's riding toy cars.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Kaptumo in the Nandihills area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities. 

Consolata is happily married and the proud mother of seven children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. 


Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds. 

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Consolata to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Ablavi Séli

texts.en:
Single and mother of 2 children from different fathers, Miss A. is an unmarried mother who is very dynamic, but who has not had the chance to find a good husband. For a very long time, her older brother took care of her in Lomé and her children were living far away from her: one with her grandmother in the village and the second one was with her in-laws in very poor conditions.

Worried about taking care of herself and providing education for her children, Miss A. has started working as a house girl in order to get the working capital she needs to start small income generating activities.

Such a second hand Clothings trade allows her to do the following:

* Create her own job and to improve progressively her socio-economic living conditions

* Decrease the alienation she feels with her senior brother through her self sufficiency

* Contribute to her children\'s education and well-being.

The project exists to strengthen the second hand clothing trade which could be very profitable to Miss Seli Ablavi A. if she is successful buying the bales as a whole, instead of in retail. Buying the bales in retail requires having more consistent funds, and she does not have this luxury.

Furthermore, she forecasts expanding her activities to the cereals trade by buying and storing the agriculture products in abundance and reselling them for a profit. The project perfect implemention will allow her to improve her business\' profitability and grow her income enough to take care of her children\'s educational needs.

The credit of $800 will serve to rent a small shop and will allow her to have at her disposal suitable goodwill to strengthen her businesses. Currently, such a project deserves to be supported with the goal to help blossom businesses run by women in difficult economic situations. Français

Célibataire et mère de 2 enfants de différents pères, Mlle A. Abla Féli est une fille mère très dynamique mais n’a pas eu la chance de tomber sur un bon mari pour créer un foyer. Elle est restée très longtemps à la charge de son grand frère à Lomé et les enfants sont éparpillés chez les proches parents dans des conditions pitoyables. Soucieuse de se prendre en charge et de s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants, Mlle A. a exercé le job de domestique pour se faire un capital pour débuter une petite activité génératrice de revenus. Ce commerce exercé lui a permis, entre autres de : se créer un emploi et d’améliorer progressivement ses conditions de vie socio-économique - Réduire sa dépendance vis-à-vis de son grand frère par son auto prise en charge - Contribuer à la scolarisation et au mieux-être de ses enfants ; Le projet consiste à renforcer le commerce de friperies qui pouvait être très rentable à Mlle A. Ablavi Séli si elle arrivait à acheter elle-même en gros les balles au lieu du détail, ce qui nécessite des moyens financiers plus consistants qu’elle ne dispose pas actuellement. Par ailleurs, elle prévoit étendre ses activités au commerce de céréales en achetant et stockant les produits agricoles en période d’abondance pour les revendre en période de soudure. La parfaite réalisation de projet lui permettra d’améliorer la rentabilité de ses affaires et d’accroître ses revenus en vue de prendre entièrement en charge l’éducation de ses enfants et subvenir à ses besoins.

Le crédit de $ 800 sollicité servira à louer un petit magasin et lui permettra de disposer d’un fonds de commerce adéquat pour renforcer ses affaires. Aujourd’hui, un tel projet mérite d’être soutenu en vue de l’épanouissement de cette jeune femme en situation économique difficile.

loans.use: Warehouse renting and  Second hand clothing bales purchasing

loans.name: Avei

texts.en: Avei is one of the oldest members in the program, still doing well with her business. She’s 55 year old woman and is still strong with a bright mind.  Avei is now a grandmother of 26 grandchildren, and is looking after 9 of them. Avei started her shop from selling taro, bananas, coconuts and Samoan cocoa. Her shop is now one of the famous shops in the Falealii District about 35 kilometres from the town centre of Apia. But Avei still believes that she’s still strong and willing to expand and provide a much better service to her district. She’s requesting this loan to do maintenance to her shop and to set up a telephone centre to provide this service for people that don’t have phones.

loans.use: To renovate her shop, purchase additional stock and start a telephone rental business inside her shop

loans.name: Zamig

texts.en:
Zamig is a local resident of Beylagan town. He is 25 years old and not married.

He has been involved in spare parts sales since 2002. He has built a small shop for himself and sells spare parts for different types of vehicles.

He buys spare parts from the city of Baku or has them brought from Russia. He has permanent customers as he sells goods of high quality.

He has run this business for five years, but the volume of sales is not satisfactory for him yet. He wants more inventory in his shop and more sales.

He applied to Normicro's Beylagan branch this year for a loan. He needs $800 for the first-time loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela is married and has five children. She used to work for an insurance company, but she spent all day away from her home and away from her children. In order to spend more time with her family without stopping to make an income, Maricela opted for starting her own business.

Since three years ago she sells fruits and vegetables. She adapted a space in her house for her business and now she is helped by her children in her store. Together they have managed to improve the service they provide to their clients and increase sales.

Currently, Maricela is requesting a loan for $250 which she will use to purchase merchandise and cover the demand of her clientèle. She is committing to pay back this quantity in 3 months. Be an important part of Maricela's achievements! She and her family need of your support and are appreciative of the trust and help you provide them with.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maricela es casada y tiene cinco hijos, anteriormente ella trabajaba para una empresa aseguradora, pero todo el día la pasaba fuera de su hogar y lejos de sus hijos, para poder pasar más tiempo con su familia sin dejar de percibir un ingreso Maricela optó por iniciar su propio negocio, desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de frutería, adaptó un espacio de su hogar para su negocio y ahora recibe la ayudad de sus hijos en la atención de su tienda, juntos han logrado mejorar el servicio que ofrecen a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas.

En estos momentos, Maricela solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en los logros de Maricela, ella y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo y agradecen mucho la confianza y ayuda que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Yadira Esmeralda

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Yadira is originally from Monclova in the state of Coahuila, is married and has two small ones of 2 and 7 years of age. Her husband is working and receives a small, insufficient salary that can't fully provide for the sustenance of his family. Since they had a second son the expenses of the home were increased. To be able to help, Yadira undertook her own business with the footwear sale, began between her relatives and neighbors, and now already she has many clients.

Their ambition for sales and desire to leave better with their family motivates them to improve day with day. Now Yadira needs a loan $ 200 dollars that will use in the purchase of merchandise to cover the orders with its clients and to increase the variety of its products of the new season, she promises to return this amount in 3 months. This is so important in the development of this business and in the life of Yadira and the family, they you thank for it sincerely.



ORIGINAL SPANISH

Yadira es originaria de Monclova en el estado de Coahuila, es casada y tiene dos pequeños de 2 y 7 años de edad. Su esposo es obrero y recibe un ingreso mínimo, insuficiente para conseguir el sustento de su familia, desde que nació su segundo hijo los gastos del hogar se incrementaron y para poder ayudar a su esposo Yadira emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de calzado, comenzó entre sus familiares y vecinos, y ahora ya tiene muchos clientes. Su gusto por las ventas y el deseo de salir adelante con su familia la motivan a mejorar día con día.

Ahora Yadira necesita un crédito de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes e incrementar la variedad de sus productos de la nueva temporada, ella promete regresar está cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de Yadira y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili is the 38-year-old mother of 3, a resident of Vingunguti, a Dar Es Salaam city suburb. She owns a salon in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam's busiest trading area. Recently she bought modern equipment for the salon on loan, and has now expanded it to cater to more customers than before. She has also opened up a cosmetics shop alongside her saloon, to ensure maximum resources for her customers. She is in need of USD 1100 to help pay for equipment and expand her cosmetics shop.

loans.use: Expand salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
I was born in Gujranwala, a mid-size town in Pakistan but moved to a small town, Kasur, with my husband after my marriage. I have seven kids: two daughters and five sons. My husband is a daily wage laborer and I work as a maid in several houses. One of my sons drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) and now he needs to buy a new one because the old one is in very bad condition and needs to be replaced. Therefore, we require a loan.

My other group members who are in need of loans are: Zarina B. who needs a loan for their embroidery business; Sughran S. whose husband runs a bakery and needs to expand it; Salma B. whose husband has a food stall and needs a loan as capital to invest in it; and Asiah B. whose husband makes and supplies a local type of chips and needs a loan for this business.

All these women are my friends and are very responsible in their dealings. I assure you we all will return your loans on time without delays.

loans.use: Buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in scrap material business

loans.name: Linda Malengo Group

texts.en:
Linda Masawe, age 37, is married with two children (ages 11 and 5). She has a pharmacy which she began 3 years ago. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 349.

In the past, Linda has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more medicines and open a laboratory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses in selling sarongs, running a hotel, seling fish, running a beauty salon and working as market sellers.

In the picture Linda is in the middle, front row

loans.use: to buy more medicines and open a laboratory

loans.name: Marcela De

texts.es:
Marcela is 34 years old. She is dedicated to the commerce of potatoes that she produces and subsequently sells in CHAPISIRKA. Marcela has 5 children ages 1 year, 6 years, 8 years, 10 years and 12 years respectively. Her husband helps her in the activities of the cultivation of potatoes. Likewise, he collaborates with the care of the children. Marcela has been dedicated to this activity for a very long time along with her husband. She possesses 10 pack donkeys with which she transports the product. Also she owns the lands where she cultivates the potatoes. When there is no crop (for some reason), she purchases and then re-sells the product. Marcela has some competition, since the zone where she cultivates is traditional for the cultivation of potatoes. Nevertheless she has been capable of gaining a stable portion of the market for potatoes. With the credit she requests, she will buy potatoes (capital for operations) at the market price. Nevertheless as she has gained enough experience in this area, she has been able to obtain better prices for this activity. The present loan is her fifth. The previous loans were paid in a normal manner, although it should be mentioned that the client had some payments behind schedule due to problems related to the sowing of the potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcela de 34 años de edad se dedica al comercio por menor de papa CHAPISIRKA mima que produce y posteriormente vende. Marcela cuenta con 5 hijos de 1 año, 6 años, 8 años, 10 años y 12 años respectivamente. Su esposo es quien le ayuda en las actividades del cultivo de la papa. Asimismo, colabora con el cuidado de los niños. Marcela se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo junto a su esposo. Ella posee 10 burros de carga con los cuales transporta el producto. También es propietaria de los terrenos donde cultiva la papa. Cuando no existe produccion (por algun motivo), compra y luego re-vende el producto. Marcela cuenta con alguna competencia, ya que la zona donde ella cultiva es tradicional en el cultivo de la papa. Sin embargo ella ha sido capaz de establecer una porción estable del mercado de la papa. Con el credito obtenido, comprará papa (capital de operaciones) a los precios del mercado. Sin embargo como ella cuenta con bastante experiencia en este rubro, ha podido conseguir los mejores precios para esta actividad. La presente es su quinta secuencia. Los anteriores creditos los canceló con normalidad, cabe mencionar que la cliente tuvo algunos dias de retraso, esto debido a problemas relacionados con la siembra de la papa.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for sowing.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. N. Z. Rosario is 27 years old, she completed high school. She had one daughter who depends on her still. She lives in the City of God section in the district of The Future in the province of Trujilo in the city of La Libertad, Peru. After finishing high school she was studying a technical career but she couldn’t finish for personal reasons, because of this she decided to begin a business so that she could be useful and survive. Mrs. N. travels constantly to the city of Lima to buy presents like: stuffed animals, decorations, etc. Furthermore she has a grocery store in her house where she offers products that are useful for offices. She belongs to the Victor Raul Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles with this money she purchased a lot of things to better her store. With the loan of 2300 soles that she will repay in a period of 4 months she will travel to the city of Lima and purchase decorations, costume jewelry, etc. She will also be to purchase groceries in variety. Mrs. N. dreams of purchasing a stand in the center of Trujilo where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora N. Z. Rosario tiene 27 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene una sola hija que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector Ciudad de Dios en el distrito de El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad- Perú. Después que termino de estudiar la secundaria estuvo estudiando una carrera técnica pero no pudo culminarla por motivos personales, así que decidió poner un negocio en el que obtenga utilidades y de esa manera sobrevivir. La señora N. viaja constantemente a la ciudad de Lima para comprar regalos tales como: peluches, portarretratos, adornos y otros. Además tiene una bodega en su casa en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad así como también útiles de escritorio que aprovecha en vender por campaña escolar. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl”lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro de todo un poco para surtir su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/. 2300.00 el cual será pagado en un periodo de cuatro meses viajara a la ciudad de Lima para comprar adornos, joyas de fantasía, cuadros, etc.. Así también comprara abarrotes en variedad. La señora N. sueña con comprar un stand en el centro de Trujillo en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Yusufu's Group

texts.en:
Yusufu S., age 31, is married with two children (ages 7 and 4). He has a tailoring business that he started in 1999. He works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $65.

Yusufu has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start another business of making cement fences. He hopes for a new loan to buy materials for his tailoring business. Yusufu will share this loan with his loan group Mwinyi. In the picture, Yusufu is seated first from the left in a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy more materials for sewing

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca Z. is fifty-three years old. She lives with Mr. Simón Galeano Ortiz, who is sixty years old. They live in their own house in the city of Ybycuí. They own a well-stocked grocery that they established thanks to an inheritance that they had received from her father. 

A few years ago, Francisca closed her business because of a grave illness. After she received costly medical treatments, she had a complete recovery and returned to open her business. Because of this, she took out a loan, with which she bought merchandise that quickly gave her profits. 

At present, the business works well, but Francisca wants to continue expanding it. It is for this reason that she seeks a new loan that she will invest into the purchase of more merchandise for her grocery. 

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora  Francisca Z. tiene 53 años de edad vive en compañía del  señor Simón  Galeano Ortiz de 60 años de edad, viven en casa  propia en el centro  la ciudad de  Ybycuí,  son propietarios de una despensa bien surtida que dieron inicio gracias a una herencia que  habían  recibido de su padre.

Hace unos años Francisca cerró su negocio pues enfermo gravemente, luego de seguir costosos tratamientos médicos ella se recuperó totalmente y volvió a abrir su negocio para lo cual sacó en ese entonces un crédito. Con el crédito compro las mercaderías que pronto dieron sus frutos y beneficios.

Hoy día el negocio marcha muy bien, pero Francisca desea seguir expandiéndolo, para ello hoy solicita un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías para su despensa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, meat, canned goods, cleaning products, soaps, snacks, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Soutoura (La Protection) Group

texts.fr:
The majority of the women in the Soutoura group are married and are, on average, 48 years old with 6 children. They live in large, traditional, polygamous families in the Bagadadji area of the city of Ségou (Republic of Mali). They normally sell condiments, soap, firewood, clothing and shoes, and they also make clothing. The members of the Sountoura group were brought together by partnership, age and neighborly relations. Together they decided to request their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, they would like to purchase 30 meters of fabric, 30 children’s clothing items, 20 pairs of shoes, a large quantity of condiments, 1 box of cosmetic soap, 20 cartloads of firewood, etc. They buy the firewood from farmers who have permits to cut down trees in the villages around Ségou. They purchase the other items at the market in Ségou or in Bamako (the capital of Mali). They sell their products for cash, most often at the Ségou market or at the weekly markets in the villages around Ségou, generally at retail prices and for cash, to a primarily female clientele. They intend to earn an average monthly profit of 13,500 CFA francs, which they will use to repay the interest on the loan and reinvest the rest in their business. In the future, they would like to purchase an embroidery machine to improve the quality of their clothing.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les femmes du groupe Soutoura, à majorité mariées, ont un âge moyen de 48 ans et ont 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles polygamiques au quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (République du Mali). Elles font généralement le commerce de condiments, de savons, du bois de chauffe, d’habits, de chaussures et aussi la couture. Les membres du groupe Sountoura sont unis par des relations d’alliances, de groupe d’âge et de voisinage. Ensemble elles ont décidés de solliciter un prêt à Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur première expérience. Avec ce prêt elles achèteront 30 mètres de tissu à coudre, 30 habits pour enfants, 20 paires de chaussures, une grande quantité de condiments, 1 carton de savon de toilette, 20 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, etc. Elles s’approvisionnement en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans détenant un permis de coupe de bois aux villages environnants de la ville de Ségou. Pour les autres articles, les achats sont effectués au marché de Ségou ou à Bamako (la capitale du Mali). Les ventes sont effectuées à comptant le plus souvent au marché de Ségou et dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages aux alentours de Ségou généralement en détail et à comptant à une clientèle majoritairement féminine. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles souhaitent acheter dans le futur une machine à broder les tissus pour améliorer la qualité des habits.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio has had a carpentry workshop in his house for the past 35 years. He has his own machines and employs three people. He works with melamine and fine woods for homes. The loan that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of carpentry materials. Antonio would like to buy more machines that are specialized for modern carpentry.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 35 años, Antonio tiene su taller de carpintería en su casa. Él cuenta con máquinas propias y da trabajo a 3 personas más. Antonio hace trabajos de melaminas y maderas finas para residencias. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los invertirá en la compra de materiales de carpintería. Antonio quisiera comprarse máquinas más moderna y especializadas en carpintería.

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials that he needs for his workshop

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with a 4-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She owns a small kiosk where she offers a variety of seasonal clothing. Natalya has been a client of Nadiya Ukraine for several years. She acknowledges that loans have been an essential part of the growth of her business. Currently, Natalya's profit margin amounts to 50 percent, which helps create stable growth for her business.  

Natalya is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of clothing for retail sale. She is able to purchase merchandise in bulk for good prices at a wholesale market. Prompt loan repayment and self-discipline have characterized Natalya in the past. Financial assistance will continue to promote the growth of her business and help her provide for most basic needs of her family.  

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Amada inició el negocio porque deseaba apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos, ya que quería darles una mejor calidad de vida, además de que también ayuda a su mamá con los gastos. Comenzó el mes de Agosto de 2000, cuando la invitaron a vender cosméticos y le pareció buena idea ya que le permitía organizar su tiempo sin descuidar a la familia, fue así que empezó vendiendo entre sus vecinas y amistades, después casa por casa. En la actualidad cuenta con un diploma por altas ventas y es candidata a Directora.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses para cubrir las necesidades de productos de sus clientes y seguir conservándolos para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Amada started the business because she wanted to support her husband with the household and child-related expenses, since she wanted to provide a higher standard of living for them. In addition, she also helps her mother with her expenses. She started in August of 2000, when she was invited to sell cosmetics which seemed like a good idea to her as it would allow her to organize her time without neglecting the family. It was this how she started selling among her neighbors and friends, and later door-to-door. Currently, she counts on a diploma for high sales and is a candidate for Director.

She needs a loan of $925 USD, to be repaid in six months, to cover the necessary products for her customers and continue conserving them to increase her profits.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng  năm nay 41 tuổi, gia đình chị có hai con trong đó có 1 con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện nay chi đang làm công việc chăn nuôi lợn gà tại gia đình. chồng chị đi làm thuê còn con chị đi khoan cắt bê tông. Hàng  tháng tổng thu nhập của gia đình  chị đạt  4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Với nguồn thu nhập này việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình  chị rất thuận lợi, gia đình chị cũng có nhiều điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con đi học.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua máy móc khoan cắt bê tông và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 41 years old. She has two children, one of whom is of school age. Currently, her family raises pigs and chicken for a living. Her husband works has a hired hand, and her son works as a concrete cutter. Her family's income totals at 4,000,000 VND per month. At this income level, she is able to repay her loan comfortably. Her family also has the means to improve her living standard and the opportunity to send her children to school. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in machinery for cutting and drilling concrete and to invest in livestock raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira O. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. The loan sums have permanently increased and so have the business turnovers. Mrs. O. was born in 1980 in B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She does not have  special education, but she knows business features, so she has been engaged in business for six years. Mrs. O. trades food products, and she has her trade outlet in the local bazaar, Farovon. She trades meat products (sausages, salami), milk-sour products (curd, kefir, milk), juices, sweets and vegetable oil. She has repeat customers. She is very polite and a kind woman by nature. Mrs. O. applies to KIVA with the request of financial support through a business development loan of 4,000 TJS for six months for purchasing a new refrigerator. It permits her to increase the existing assortment and business turnover.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Idemudia

texts.en: Idemudia O. is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Idemudia sells foodstuffs such as yams, plantains, and gari (a popular food made from cassava tubers). She is requesting a loan of N40,000 (US $275) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Idemudia says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and plantains to sell

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Ana Patricia H. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de bebidas como gaseosas y también a la venta de caramelos siendo este su único sustento con el cual beneficia a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos en edad escolar.

Es importante destacar que ella ha sido una dama muy inteligente y antes de dedicarse a este negocio ella se dedicaba a estudiar pero por el deber de mantener a sus pequeños ingresó a esta actividad. Hoy en día la razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para que se le brinde un crédito el cual será utilizado en la compra de los productos para así continuar con su respectiva comercialización en el mercado donde ella se desmpeña.
texts.en:
In the market La Terminal in the city of León, Mrs. Ana Patricia H. dedicates herself to her business selling sodas and candy. This is her only means of support for her family, composed of her two school-aged children. It's important emphasize that she is a very intelligent lady and before she started this business, she was a dedicated student. Out of the need to provide for her little ones, she began this business. Nowadays, she puts her hope in Ceprodel to have a loan which will be used to buy products to continue growing her business in the market where she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sodas and candy

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.en:
Amina has owned a small shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. She is requesting her second loan from Kiva partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cement and a mattress for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Salama and Twalha. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more cement and mattress for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella L. is currently in the business of selling alcohol, and she is requesting a loan to expand her business. Stella is 30 years old and married; her husband is a clerk in UNDP . She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a house for rental purposes

loans.name: Gulafruz

texts.en:
S. Gulafruz is a woman who enjoys her work. She is in the animal-breeding business. Thanks to this business she can cover her family’s expenses and the educational expenses of her four children.

Gulafruz wishes to increase the number of animals she has in order to improve breeding. The sum that she needs is $600 USD which she guarantees will be properly invested. She is hoping for your support. Helping this woman achieve prosperity is in your hands.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the number of animals to improve breeding

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke A. is 30 years old and married with two children. She has a store where she sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira T. is from the town of Magsaysay, Saguday, Quirino. She is 54 years old. Elvira is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cosmetics and other AVON products in the local community. 

Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elvira from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy D. G. is managing a food vending business located in the public market of Cauayan City. She said that for an entrepreneur to become successful, one should work hard and be patient in everything. Married to Patricio, an ice vendor in the market, they have six children: Dexter, Patrick, Devine, Daniel, Diana and Rose, four of whom are already in high school and elementary school. Her children also assist her in the business, for they want to achieve their goal to become successful someday.

Daisy is now requesting a loan of PHP25, 000 that she will use as additional capital in her food vending business. She believes that this amount will play a great part in the development of her enterprise.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Apolo

texts.en:
Apolo J. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Apolo is 40 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (335991100) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Phúc Yên.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, V. owns & operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling internet connections & services in the local community.  V. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1999, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  V. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the ninth loan taken out V. from TYM Fund.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina had been raising livestock in her backyard for ten years now. She had an initial capital of Php 3,000 coming from her own savings. Catalina is so fortunate to have this kind of business because through the profit this business generated, all of her children have reached college and have have graduated from their chosen course. One, her youngest, is still in college. Her eldest who is a pharmacist works abroad and sometimes sends her money for the education of her youngest daughter. Three of her children have established their own families and Catalina has less to worry about, now that all of them have their own stable jobs.

Despite Catalina's age which is 62, the same as the age of her husband Raul, she doesn't want to let go of her business. Instead, she wishes that it would grow and can be inherited by her children. Believing in her capacity to run the business, she wantsto be independent from all of her children.

Catalina has already taken several steps towards the achievement of her dreams since she joined ASHI and has the opportunity of borrowing. She has performed well with ASHI in her past loans and therefore, ASHI qualifies her to borrow bigger amounts for additional business capital. With the profit she will be getting now with her business, she will no longer depend on her eldest daughter's remittances for her youngest daughter's education.

loans.use: buying three piglets, feed for pigs, medicines, chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Paul Mutie

texts.en:
Paul Mutie is 46 years old, and he is married with two children, a son and a daughter. He lives in Kangemi, Nairobi.

He was introduced to KADET by his friends and he has never borrowed from other sources. This will be his fourth loan with KADET.

Kangemi is a highly populated area but has few computer colleges, hence Paul stands a high chance of succeeding in this kind of business.

Paul intends to equip the school with new and up-to-date computers and printers as this will enable him to attract and admit more students thus giving him a cutting edge in the competitive market.

loans.use: Buying better computers and one printer for the school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Ma. Jesusa

texts.en:
Ma. Jesusa hails from the beautiful town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 28-year-old mother to two daughters. She is happily married to Ricky who is 32 years old.
Even her young age, she dreams of giving descent life to her family specially to her children. She needs to start a business that could bring her good income. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with hopes of having access to capital to start a business. When she recieved her previos loans, she invested those in the resale business. Now she is engaged in the resale business for more than a year already and she wants to invest more on it.
Now on her third loan, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for 3 sacks of rice, 3 sacks sugar, 5 gallons of cooking oil, and also to pay for transportation expenses. She will resale the goods in thier village. People will just come to her store and will by thier needs.
She is optimistic that her business will grow with the access to capital provided by ASHI and with the trust of KIVA. She dreams of sending her children to school until college and also to build a house of her own on her own lot.

loans.use: To pay for 3 sacks of rice, 3 sacks sugar, 5 gallons of cooking oil, and also to pay for transportation expanses.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul K. has been running his Agrovet business in Naivasha town for three years now. He attributes the success of his business to his local community, which consists of many farmers. Paul is 42 years old and married to Ruth Nyambura; they have a pair of twin sons who attend secondary school fifty miles from Naivasha town.

Paul was introduced to KADET by his friend. He is in repayment for his first loan and has applied for the education loan, which KADET offers to existing clients at zero percent interest. Paul plans to use the loans to pay academic fees for his sons' educations.

His future business plan is to grow his business and be a major supplier in Naivasha town, conducting both retail and bulk sales.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To pay for his sons' academic fees.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria G., 58 years old, is a successful businesswoman from Malaria, Tala, Caloocan City. She is married to Policarpo, also a businessman. They have five children.

Gliceria has a fairly large general store where she sells grocery items and rice. Her husband also manages their own clothing store. Both businesses have been in existence for ten years now. Gliceria is earning more than P30,000 a month.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004. The loans provided by the cooperative are quite helpful in sustaining her businesses. She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of P 24,000 as additional capital for her businesses. This will be her 14th loan cycle with CCT.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia O. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old and still single. She is a dealer of Avon products like perfume, lotion, beauty products and other cosmetics supplies. She sells to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for twelve years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC.

Delia is now requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be use to purchase more Avon products to sell. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more Avon products to sell

loans.name: Sorphea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorphea S. is a villager in Trapeang Saom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.1-hectare (.25-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Um Neara, is a construction worker who is able to make a small income to support the family. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

Since her husband’s work place is far from home, Mrs. Sorphea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

Mrs. Sorphea S. is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work

loans.name: Dominga Salome

texts.es: Doña Salo es originari de la comunidad de Chimente del municipio de Totonicapn  que se encuentra situado a 42 kilometros del municipio de Totonican a veinte kilometros del municipio de Chichicastenango Santa Cruz del Quiche doña Salome necesita un credito para la remodelacion de su vivienda, para aprovechar la época de verando para no tener consecuencias en la época de invierno su activida principal es ser amda de casa con los ingreso que obtiene los fines de semana ha podido darle educacion a sus tres hijos y alimentacion ell necesita de una vivienda digna para su familia por eso necesita de la ayuda de Asdir en un credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salo is from the town of Chimente in the municipality of Totonicapán which is 42 kilometers from the city of Totonicapan and twenty kilometers from the city of Chichicastenango, Santa Cruz del Quiche. Mrs. Salome needs a loan to remodel her house. She wants to take advantage of the summer season so as not to have consequences in the winter season. Her main job is as housewife. She has been able to educate and feed her three children with the income she gets on weekends. She needs a decent house for her family. That is why she needs help from Asdir for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Maurice Omondi

texts.en:
Maurice is married to Emmah, and they have two children, Nicole and Calele, who are 9 and 6 years old, respectively.

Maurice was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and he has no previous credit history. He intends to use this loan as working capital for his leather shoes manufacturing business. Maurice has been in the production of leather shoes for two years. 

His business is located within a parastatal institution (a government-run institution that provides services to the general population). He sells the shoes both locally and internationally. 

With the extra profits Maurice will invest in better machinery, as he hopes to own a factory in the near future. He believes that this will improve the living standards of his family and help his two children have a quality education. Maurice describes himself as a man who is very articulate.

loans.use: Working capital for his leather shoes manufacturing business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 36 años y recientemente se acaba de unir con su pareja en su propia casa y tienen el propósito de formar una familia. Es entonces que hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de comida, siendo ahora su fuente de ingreso que le ayudará en los gastos familiares, además de gustarle mucho cocinar eso le dio mucha ventaja ya que por tener una buena sazón le ha traído mucha demanda de sus platillos que prepara. Habiendo aprendido esta actividad desde muy pequeña ya que su madre le enseñó todos los secretos culinarios, se ha forjado un trabajo constante, levantándose a tempranas horas para dedicarse a la preparación de sus potajes y terminando luego por llevarlos a vender a uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona. Es así que su negocio le es muy rentable, por lo que espera seguir prosperando poco a poco, además de que disfruta mucho lo que hace. Carmen y su pareja tienen muchos planes en mente y esperan ponerlos en marcha y para ello necesitan del crédito para invertirlo en su negocio. Este es su dieciochoavo préstamo con MFP, además de pertenecer a un grupo muy sólido, eso le ayudará a cumplir con su meta, ya que todos los que pertenecen al grupo se caracterizan por ser muy cumplidos con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para preparar sus platillos, ya que le sale mas a cuenta comprar al por mayor.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old and just recently joined together with her partner in her own home; they intend to start a family. For 7 years she has sold food, which will now be her source of income that will help with the household expenses. In addition, she likes to cook very much and this gives her an advantage because she is a good cook; this has brought a lot of demand for the dishes that she prepares. Having learned this activity from the time she was very small, since her mother taught her all of her culinary secrets, she has built a steady job from this, rising early in the morning to prepare her stews and finishing later to take them to sell in the busiest markets in her area. In this way the business is very profitable, so she hopes to continue to thrive, little by little. In addition, she really enjoys the work. Carmen and her partner have many plans in mind, and hope to put them into action and for this reason they need a loan to invest in the business. This is her eighteenth loan with MFP; she belongs to a very solid group, which helps her to accomplish her goals since all of the members of the group are very good about making their payments. With the loan that she requests, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare her dishes, because she comes out ahead if she can buy at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Marvin German

texts.es: Marvin tiene 39 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que el realiza, por lo que ha sido una gran experiencia. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que todos los días sale cargando un bolso en donde lleva toda su mercadería para mostrárselas a sus diferentes clientes, a pesar del inmenso sol y cansancio sabe que tiene que seguir luchando para sus 3 hijos que están a su cargo el es un buen Padre a pesar de no tener la oportunidad de estudiar quiere que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser personas de bien. Actualmente el solicita un financiamiento que le ayude para la compra de calzado, pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior, trajes y además cosméticos. el siempre sueña con tener su propia vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marvin is 39. This is not his first loan, and it has been a great experience. He sells general merchandise. Everyday he leaves carrying a bag where he takes all of his merchandise to show to his different customers. In spite of the immense heat and the exhaustion, he knows that he needs to keep fighting for his three children that he is raising. He is a good father. In spite of not having the opportunity for an education, he wants his children to be able to have an education and be good people. He is currently asking for a loan to buy footwear, pants, t-shirts, underwear, suits, and cosmetics. He always dreams of having his own home for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gloria Amelia

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 46 años, es conviviente y tiene nueve hijos. Gloria se dedica a la venta de café, cacao y miel, ella trae sus productos de la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Gloria requiere el préstamo de S/. 500 soles para comprar miel. Gloria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Gloria, 46, is in a common law marriage and has nine children. Gloria sells coffee, cocoa, and honey. She gets her products in the city of Quillabamba in the Cusco department. She has been in this business for 15 years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Gloria needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy honey. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. Gloria belongs to the “Inti” Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. (Inti is a word from the Quechua language, which means “sun” when translated.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy honey

loans.name: Sareta

texts.en:
Sareta S. is 57 and married with 6 children (ages 16 - 28).  She owns a business venture, selling clay handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Sareta has many years of experience in this business.  Sareta needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Sareta joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sareta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sareta S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 25-year-old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon, with his wife. He has owned a grocery store since 2005. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, eggs, bread, etc. A feature of Mouhamad's work is that he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan. When he first started his business, he dealt with some financial issues, as well as having to face the competition. He decided on setting up his business because he wanted to have independent work, as well as gaining experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business by opening a second grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Eramudugoda Gamage

texts.en:
Eramudugoda is a 28-year-old single woman living in Yakabadda in southern Sri Lanka. She has never been married, and has a small general store business that she manages. Her brother also helps her run the store, and she uses her earnings to help manage daily expenses.

Eramudugoda started her shop about four years ago, and has developed a lot of experience running her general store. She considers herself a very honest business woman to which she attributes her success.

Eramudugoda is asking for a loan of 40,000 LKR from BRAC Sri Lanka to help expand her general store.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Iris Lourdes

texts.es: La Srta. Iris, vino a Emprender recomendada por su hermana  Norma quien es cliente antigua, ella se dedica al tejido de chambritas (chompas pequeñas de lana) y mantillas para bebé, en esta actividad se encuentra más de 6 años y en estos dos últimos años se dedica con mayor interés a la casa, ya que tienen a su madre enferma y a manera de atenderla en los cuidados que necesita, ella se dedica a la elaboración de esas prendas, tanto a mano como a máquina, cuando tiene muchos pedidos le ayudan sus hermanas, ella acomoda sus trabajos por las tiendas de la calle 21 de San Miguel, en especial en la tienda libreria que tiene su hermana, ella vive en la zona de Irpavi, donde generalmente viven familias de militares, es una zona calurosa y tranquila, ella no tiene aún familia propia, vive en la casa de los padres juntamente con sus tres hermanos,  pero todos tienen actividades propias e independientes, compartiendos los gastos familiares entre ellos; por último podemos decir que es una persona responsable y anteriormente fue tambien cliente Kiva y no tuvo contratiempos en sus pagos. Con el dinero del credito comprara lana para los tejidos que realiza, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ms. Iris came to Emprender, recommended by her sister Norma, who is a former client. She knits chambritas (small wool sweaters) and baby clothes. She has been in this work for more than 6 years. In these last two years, she has been occupied more at home, as she has an ill mother, and in this way attends to her with the care needed. Iris makes garments by hand and by machine. When she has many orders, her sisters help her. She puts her work in the stores on Calle 21 of San Miguel, in particular in the bookstore that her sister has. She lives in the area of Irpavi, where military families generally live. It is a warm and laid-back area. She does not yet have her own family. She lives in the home of her parents together with her three siblings. However, everyone has their own activities and independence, sharing the family expenses among themselves. Finally, we can say that she is a responsible person, previously was also a cliente of Kiva, and did not have setbacks in her payments. With the loan money, she will buy wool for the knitting she does. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust offered in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Bem

texts.en:
Bem S., 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells coconuts for an income of about USD 12 per day. Her husband works at the carnival, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase dishes, pans, and other materials for entertaining at the carnival. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy dishes, pans, and other materials for entertaining at the carnival

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Yassin

texts.en:
Yassin is a 55-year-old Lebanese entrepreneur and the father of five children. In 1985, he decided to open a grocery store in his town. He decided to open his shop because he saw a need for such services in the region, and also because he has experience in sales. His family has always supported him in developing and improving his work. He offers food products, dairy products, breads, cereals, drinks, canned food, candies, and more products to his customers.
 
Today, Yassin is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to stock his shop in the hopes that this will increase his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
The smiling face shown in the photo is Mrs. S., age 28. S. became a farmer and has been doing this activity with great success since she was single, but now she is married with two young kids. Both of the kids are enrolled in primary school and are dependent on her income. S. has a life partner in her husband, who helps solve the family’s financial crisis by working as a building laborer. 

S. is taking out her first loan which she is using to purchase many piglets to raise in a stall she has built behind her house. S. is hopeful that the loan will allow her to have extra income to ensure that her family has a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase many piglets to raise

loans.name: Jeoffrey

texts.en:
Jeoffrey G. is from the village of Valencia City. He is 46 years old. Jeoffrey is married and has 1 school-aged child. Jeoffrey owns & operates a specialized retail store where he sells seafood products such as fish, shrimp and dried fish. Jeoffrey has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jeoffrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeoffrey is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jeoffrey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheang Y. is a villager in Trapeang Chrey village, in Takeo province, and she was born in 1984. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She earns some money at this business to support her family while her husband, Mr. Yung Hing, is a construction worker who is also able to get low salary to support his family. Although both of them try to work hard, they earn too little money. So to improve their family's standard of living, Mrs. Sokheang Y. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This is her effort to start a new business to increase income this current year. She is a mother of two children whom are both too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza D. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Esperanza makes and sells a variety of breads and pastries in the local community. Esperanza has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI.  Esperanza plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

----------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
A. Salomat is 50-year-old lady. Salomat and her husband, who is in entrepreneur currently, have been married for about 25 years and raised three wonderful children. Salomat has been running her own small business for 11 years already, she has a trading place at the market for selling shampoos, detergents, tooth-paste and brushes and other items. Salomat is very friendly and polite which allows her to have the clientele. Now she is requesting  a loan of $1500 US dollars. Salomat is planning to use the loan for purchasing more goods for selling thus increasing the range of the products. She thanks everybody who decides to support her.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
