But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Maksudjon

texts.en:
Maksudjon S. is a farmer dedicated to the production of potatoes, carrots and turnips for more than 15 years. He is married with six children. His wife is the housekeeper and his business is the sole source of income for his family. His harvest is about to be dug up so he is requesting a loan of 13,000 Somoni to acquire agricultural products such as seed and mineral fertilizer to be applied to his crops. Maksudjon wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so from the income that his harvest will bring.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Rosario Q. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive por el sector de la Compañía en la ciudad de Cuenca. Esta ciudad se caracteriza por mantener aun su cultura y tradiciones, tiene su centro histórico que fue nombrado el 1 de diciembre  1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

La Señora Rosario tiene 70 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad  que viven de manera independiente con sus familias. Doña Rosario vive con su nieto quien trabaja. Su esposo es jubilado y con el trabajo de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Rosario se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar, también  cría cerdos, vacas, gallinas, cuyes y pollos a los que los vende en su propio sector.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y medio y los créditos le han ayudado para  comprar animales para incrementar su negocio. Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar cerdos y alimento para sus animales. Tiene una muy buena amistad con las socias de la banca comunal ya que son mujeres luchadoras que busca  un mejor porvenir.
 
Su sueño es  seguir conservando su salud.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosario Q. is a member of the "Damas Responsables" ["Responsible Women"] communal bank. She lives in the Compañía area of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for maintaining its culture and traditions, and its historic center was named a World Heritage Site on December 1, 1999. Ms. Rosario is 70 years old, married, and has six children who live independently with their own families. She lives with her grandson, who works. Her husband is retired and thanks to both of their work, they were able to build their own house. Ms. Rosario dedicates herself to household chores and she also raises pigs, cows, hens, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells in her area. She has been a member of her communal bank for six and a half years and the loans have helped her to buy animals to increase her business. She will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs and feed for her animals. She has a good friendship with the other members of her communal bank, as they are all spirited women looking for a better future. Her dream is to continue keeping up her health.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her animals

loans.name: Mehridin

texts.en:
Mehridin N. is 50 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Mehridin is hard-working and has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. He has great cattle breeding experience because he has observed it since he was a boy. Over time he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Mehridin has applied for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy young cattle. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them give their children a better quality of life. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina Nanjjuko is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children. All of her children are currently in school. Zaina has a business of selling drinks, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Zaina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks like soda. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zaina hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Zaina hopes to open another business like selling clothes. Zaina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save money.

loans.use: To buy more drinks like soda to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline M. is a 25-year-old hardworking single woman. She operates a retail shop at O.T.C in the town center along Ronald Ngala Street in Nairobi. This is a very busy location that attracts many customers. 

Caroline was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. She has no history with any other microfinance institution and is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET to buy more stock for her shop, especially dry goods such as sugar and wheat flour. Her heart’s desire is to expand her business and open another outlet in Nairobi so that she can have a stable source of income.

loans.use: To buy more stock such as sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Teddy has a stone quarrying business, which she has had for 1 year.  In addition she also sells vegetables.  

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase vegetables and stone materials.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Teddy hopes to own a retail shop.   

Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and stone materials for her business.

loans.name: Marvin Roberto

texts.es:
Marvín tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol, café y hortalizas, vive con su esposa y tres hijos estos estudian, la producción que obtiene la vende en el mercado de San Francisco Gotera, ellos residen en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazán.
Sus padres le enseñaron a realizar los cultivos, y trabaja con la ayuda de mozos, él tiene  experiencia y este trabajo es el que le da los ingresos para mantener a su familia, el único riesgo es el cambio de clima que le afecta la siembra.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frijol y sembrar, también comprara abono y manguera para regar, esta ayuda le será útil para realizar el cultivo y darle los cuidados necesarios para recibir una buena cosecha.
Sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan ir a la universidad y ser profesionales, por su parte seguirá trabajando para que a su hogar no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Marvín is 42 years old, and he works planting corn, beans, coffee and vegetables. He lives with his wife and his three children, who are in school. He sells the crops he produces at the market in San Francisco Gotera. He and his family live in Guatajiagua, in the department of Morazán.

His parents taught him how to farm, and he works with the help of laborers. He is an experienced farmer, and it is this work that provides the income to support his family. The only risk is the change in climate that affects his crops. 

He is requesting a loan to buy beans to plant; he will also buy fertilizer and a hose for irrigation. This help will be useful to him in growing his crops and providing the necessary care to obtain a good harvest. 

His dreams are that his children will be able to go to the university and become professionals; for his part, he will continue to work so that his household does not lack for anything.

loans.use: Buying beans to plant, fertilizer, and a hose for irrigation

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has ten children, two of whom are in school. Teddy also takes care of additional relatives. She lives in a home with electricity and running water. Teddy’s major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and medication. 

For the past twenty years, Teddy has operated a charcoal-selling business. She works seven days a week, selling her product from home. She also generates additional income from renting rooms. Teddy has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her business goals and aspirations include owning a delivery van and selling only wholesale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and she is married with six children. She has owned her small general store for about five years. The hours of her business are from 6 am until 8.30 pm every day.

Catherine has now requested a Kiva loan so that she can expand her shop by adding enough cosmetics and foodstuffs like sugar, rice and different types of flour, and some other goods which seem to be in high demand in her business area. Catherine plans to start saving as well as improve her family's situation with any profits that she earns.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John S. is 37 years old, married to Veronica Lepshoi and together they have two children.  His wife also contributes to bring in income to the family by keeping and selling poultry. They live in Ngenyilel in the outskirts of Eldoret town.

John sells milk in the area of his residence whereby he has good number of customers who buys milk on a daily basis from him. His monthly income is KES 9,000.

This will be John's second loan with KADET LTD, the first loan he repaid successfully, and he plans to use the loan he will get to support his business. In future John wants to be a milk wholesaler in Eldoret.

loans.use: To support his business by buying more milk for selling

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su pareja y sus dos hijos pequeños, juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de productos naturales de una reconocida marca en el mercado. Ella ofrece a sus amigos y conocidos, quienes le pagan a crédito a un poco mas del precio real de la mercadería natural. Esta muy satisfecha pues tiene regulares ganancias de las ventas y así puede ayudar a su pareja en los constantes gastos del hogar, de a pocos salen adelante con constante trabajo. Le gusta mucho su labor pues le permite criar a sus hijos sin problemas y no descuida las labores del hogar. Ya tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar una tienda de venta de productos naturales, para esto quiere habilitar una pieza de su casa y así piensa seguir adelante. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en su negocio. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios productos naturales, pues tiene pedidos y le falta capital, de esta manera espera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 37, lives in her own house, together with her husband and their two small children. Together they work daily to get ahead. This enterprising woman has been working for two years in sales of a well-known brand of natural products. She offers the products to friends and acquaintances, who can buy them on credit for slightly more than the market price. 

María is very satisfied with her business, as she has regular income and can help her husband with the household expenses. They are gradually getting ahead with constant work. She also likes that her business allows her to raise her children without problems, and to attend to the household chores.

María already has many plans for the future, such as building a natural products store in her home. This will require remodeling part of the house.

This is María’s seventh loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her payments, as she does not want to let down the people who have provided the support for her business. The loan will be used to purchase various natural products. She has outstanding orders, but lacks the capital to fill them. In this way, she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Purchase natural products for sale

loans.name: Fass Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité FASS DIOM est créé depuis 09 ans. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elle sont pratiquement de la même génération. Elle partagent le même centre d'intérêts qui est de soutenir leurs maris dans la prise en charge familiale

Madame AMINATA S. à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend de la banane. Elle achète en gros et revend au détail dans son quartier.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges
texts.en:
The Fass Diom solidarity group was created nine years ago. It is composed of six women who live in the same neighborhood and are nearly of the same generation. They share a common goal, which is supporting their husbands with family expenses.

Mrs Aminata S., standing right in the picture, chairs the group. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She runs a small store, where she sells bananas. She buys them wholesale and then retails them in her neighborhood. Her objective is to provide for her family and help her husband to pay the various household expenses.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana A. is from the village of Kibatang, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Marciana is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Marciana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & beverages, in the local community. Marciana has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marciana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods & junk foods

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.es:
El señor Apolunio H. tiene ya más de 10 años dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera.
A su negocio le está haciendo falta materia para realizar unos pedidos de muebles que tiene que entregar, es por eso que solicita un préstamo  y así poder comprar el material que necesita para terminar los muebles a tiempo y sus clientes queden satisfechos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en: Apolonio H. has more than 10 years experience in making wooden furniture.  Currently, his business is running low on supplies to fill outstanding furniture orders.  He is requesting a loan to buy the materials necessary to finish the requested items on time in order to keep his clients happy.  He plans to repay the loan with part of the earnings from the sales, as furniture sales are the family's source of income.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro D. is from the village of Canabuan Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 52 years old. Pedro is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Pedro plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP every harvest season (or after 5 months).

In 2011, Pedro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This is Pedro's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for his rice farm

loans.name: Everline Angango

texts.en:
Everline  is 32 years old from the Mamboleo area and is a single mother to three children aged between 13 and six years old.

Everline has a retail shop that she has been operating for the past 13 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend. Everline will use the money to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc. to add to her stock. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children and also expand her business.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. Everline also wants to buy land and be able to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, and cooking flour.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Christine has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for 3 years. She also has a second business selling food and fruits.

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase more food and charcoal for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Christine hopes to go back to school and complete her studies.  

Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future with instruction on how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more food and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos,  tiene casa propia con servicio sólode luz, ubicada en el caserio Cruce de Vega  que pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Todas estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Genoveva se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales  (gallinas, pavos, pollos y ovejas), el corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con dieta balanceada y pastos naturales.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso ideal en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Piura;  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado Genoveva es de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla, será destinado  para la compra de alimentos balanceados y la implementación de otro corral ya que sus animales se han incrementado donde y crien más cómodos, con la finalidad de que engorden para  venderlos a un buen precio en el mercado y así poder pagar su préstamo, lo que le ayudara  a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Genoveva es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder ofrecerles algo mejor para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Genoveva is the mother of a family. She is 39-years old and she lives with her husband and children. They have a house of their own and it is equipped only with hydro. It is located in the community of Cruce de Vega in the district of Tambogrande. It is about 40 minutes from the department of Piura. The primary businesses in each of these regions are agriculture, farming, and tourism.

Genoveva raises and sells livestock (poultry, turkeys, and sheep). The corral where she keeps them is located outside her house and she feeds them a balanced diet and natural grasses. She sells her livestock once they have reached an ideal size and weight at the different markets in the city of Piura. This increases her income and helps her to acquire what she needs for the home.

The loan that Genoveva requests is in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) through Capital Semilla. The funds will be used to purchase balanced feed and to install another corral. Her livestock has increased in number and she needs it to raise them more comfortably. The goal is to fatten them before their sale to acquire a good price at the market. This will help her repay her loan and it will help her improve the quality of life for her family. 

Genoveva is a very hard working and earnest woman who has always known to move forward and to improve in life, and to offer her children something better.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock and to install another corral.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es: El Sr. Serapio tiene 43 años de edad, vive en zona del Palmar con su pareja la Sra. Martha desde hace 14 años, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad (10-14 años), que se encuentran en edad escolar, El Sr.  Serapio es propietario de un vehículo y se dedica al rubro del transporte desde hace tres años. Este  crédito que se le otorgo es para el arreglo de su vehículo ya que le esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes, por lo cual quedo muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Serapio, 43, has lived in Palmar with his spouse, Martha, and their two minor children (10 and 14 years old) who are school aged.

Serapio owns a car that he’s used to provide taxi services for the last three years.  

This loan he was granted is to repair the car since it’s starting to show some wear and tear which impedes him from providing a better service to his customers.  

He was most grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: 30 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “30 MAYO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Florencia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: kiosco de salchipapas, comercio diferente, hilado de lana de vicuña, tienda de barrio, ayudante de albañil, venta de tostado, venta de utensilios de limpieza, venta de ropa. 

La señora Florencia indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por medio de mis padres. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de mercadería en general, que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás con la ayuda de su esposo, este oficio lo aprendió de su hermano mayor.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para comprar mercadería (compra de material en general, enlatados, embutidos, arroz, etc.), que consiguieran de diferentes lugares en el Desaguadero (frontera Perú y Bolivia). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The May 30th Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Florencia. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as operating a “salchipapas” (sausages and potatoes) kiosk, managing different retail outlets, making thread out of vicuña wool, managing a neighborhood store, working as a masonry assistant, selling roasted foods, selling cleaning utensils, and selling clothes.

Sra. Florencia indicates that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the group because of her parents. At the moment, she has a business selling general merchandise. She began working two years ago with the help of her husband. Florencia learned this trade from her older brother.

The loan she is now receiving will be used to buy merchandise such as general materials, canned goods, cured meats, rice, and other products. She acquires her products in different places along “El Desaguadero” (the border between Peru and Bolivia). This method of working allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. She is in a common-law marriage and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Florencia said she enjoys the training classes and the health services.

loans.use: to purchase general materials, canned goods, cured meats, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Namulesa Womens Group

texts.en: 50-year-old Ruth got a foothold for her clothing sales business 20 years. Ruth, a happily married mother of three, says starting this business was in many ways her means to an end in her below breadline existence back then. She says with hard work, the business was on the up and up after only four years. She began this business with savings from her earlier farming business. Ruth anticipates making further inroads in her business with the acquisition of this Kiva loan. Monthly, the business generates her profits equal to shillings 240,000. The proceeds from this loan, she says, are for the purchase of more new clothes. She transacts her business in Lugazi.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to resell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Florentina nació en la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, Florentina  vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Florentina tiene un restaurante y tiene un nombre particular “Flori”. Florentina tiene 16 años que se dedica a la venta de comida y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Florentina was born in Quispicanchis Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 47 years old and currently lives in the city of Cusco with her two children. Florentina has a restaurant named “Flori” where she has been selling food for 16 years. She has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work.

Florentina is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items. She is a responsible and hardworking person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the “Mosoc Killa” Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Angela Moserrate

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque todas sus compañeras se llevan muy bien y son como una familia. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 16, 13, 11 y 7 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es maestro tapizador.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganarse algo y así contribuir con los gastos de su familia se dedica a realizar los quehaceres domésticos en una casa de su ciudad, pero además también nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio,  vende de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, nos cuenta que ella aprovecha los momentos que tiene libre para ofrecer sus productos y que tiene gran cantidad de clientes ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y además porque les da facilidades de pago.  Lleva más de tres años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido bien a pesar de la crisis que golpea a nuestro país.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo Canton is found in Manabí Province.  The San José communal bank meets here.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard working people who are farmers and who raise livestock.

Ángela is a founding member of the communal bank.  She’s its financial overseer and likes it because all her fellow members get along real well with each other and are like a family.  She is 33 years old, married and has four children who are 16, 13, 11 and 7 years old.  The three oldest are in secondary school and the youngest goes to elementary school.  Her husband is a master upholsterer.

She is a great housewife who, in order to generate income and contribute to her family’s expenses, works as a domestic employee in a house in the city but in addition, our friend is also a merchant.  She sells all sorts of clothes door to door and based on prior orders.  She tells us that she takes advantage of her free time to offer her products and that she has a large number of customers since her products are of good quality and also because of the easy payment plans she gives them.  She’s been in commerce for over three years and has done well despite the crisis the country is undergoing.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: Moises Tony

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés vive en la localidad de la guardia,  barrio lindo, es nacido en el departamento de Tarija, quedo viudo hace unos dos meses, este es un golpe muy fuerte para el Sr ya que ahora es el único sustento de la familia, su actividad principal es chofer propietario, perteneciente a la asociación de taxi, tiene tres hijos a su cargo que se encuentran en edad escolar y los cuales están también están trabajando, su hija mayor de 14 años es la que le ayuda en las labores del hogar, el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir una habitación y barda en su domicilio, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
Moisés lives in the town of La Guardia, in Lindo neighborhood.  He was born in Tarija department.

Moisés became a widow two months ago.  This was a very hard blow for him because he is now the only source of support for his family.  His main business activity is working as a driver in a car that he owns.  He belongs to a taxi association.

Moisés has three school-age children in his care who are also working.  His eldest daughter, who is 14, helps with the housework.

Moisés will use this loan to finish building a room and a perimeter wall around his home.  He feels grateful to the institution for the financial support they have provided.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María D. 48 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María desD. hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. aves D. corral (gallinas, patos y pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios D. su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenega pueD. cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad D. vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es poder superarse y  mejorar económicamente en bien D. los suyos.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old and lives with her husband and their children in their own house. The house is not connected to public utilities and is located in the rural area of the district of TambogranD. in the department of Piura. The area is known for farming, cattle rearing and crafts.

For four years María has been farming and selling poultry (chickens, ducks and turkeys). The henhouse behind her house is appropriate and large. She feeds her poultry with balanced feed and natural grains to ensure perfect growth. She sells the poultry at the various markets in her area and earns a very good income that she spends on daily household expenditures.

María came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 500 new soles to buy balanced feed for her animals. The profit will enable her to pay the loan installments and improve her quality of life. María is a hard-working and determined woman whose only wish is to progress and improve the economic well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Filomina has a retail shop that sells fruits like mangoes & papaya. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fruits to sell. 

Filomina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Filomina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha, de 25 años, es una mujer alegre. Hace 5 años que formó su familia, del cual nació su hijo Josep al que cuida y educa en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Bellavista Huaracayo. Está trabajadora mujer se dedica a la siembra de maíz, papa, verdura y demás hortalizas; pero según menciona su principal cultivo consta de papa, pues tiene mayores clientes que le compran sus cosechas. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en la agricultura y en todo este tiempo logró incrementar su capital de trabajo, ya que ahorra lo más que puede, pues sabe que tiene que forjar un buen futuro para su hijo. Además de tener toros que le ayudan en el arado de la tierra, ahorrando así dinero en la contrata a terceras personas. Ahora espera lograr sus objetivos con la ayuda de su banco comunal, pues para su futuro desea comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ya que solo trabaja con tierras arrendadas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Mirtha de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales que le servirán para su próxima siembra de alverja y maíz.
texts.en:
Mirtha, aged 25, is a happy woman.  She started her family five years ago with the birth of her son Josep, who she looks after and educates in a rented house, located in the Bellavista Huaracayo area.  

This hard-working woman works growing corn, potatoes, greens and other vegetables, but according to her, her main crop is potatoes, as she has more customers that buy this.crop.  She has four years of experience in agriculture, and during this time she has been able to increase her working capital; she has been saving what she can, as she knows that she needs to forge a good future for her son.  She also has bulls that help her plow her fields, saving her money from hiring third parties.

She is now hoping to achieve her objectives with the help of the communal bank, as in the future she wants to buy her own farmland, as currently she only works rented fields.  She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank, where she is hoping for a small loan to continue with her goals.  She also promises to be punctual with her repayments.

On receiving the help, Mirtha will invest the requested money in buying several bags of natural fertilizer which will help be used in her next planting of peas and corn.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo was born in 1960. He lives in Achajur village, Tavush regeon. He is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. Sergo’s sons live and work in the Russian Federation, and his daughter is jobless and lives with her parents. His wife is a disabled person and she doesn’t work. 

For 16 years, Sergo worked at an Ijevan road-building organization as an operator. Since 1992, Sergo has been engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. On his farm he breeds cows, chickens, ducks, turkeys and rabbits; on his plot of land he grows wheat and oats. Also, Sergo grows various fruits and vegetables in his garden. 

Sergo and his family use agricultural produce (such as milk, butter, cheese, fruit, vegetables and wheat) for personal use, but when there happens to be a heavy crop they sell a part of their production. Farming allows Sergo to provide for his family. 

This is Sergo’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals. Sergo has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Beatriz tiene la actividad de venta y elaboración de cigarros de chocolates artesanales este los elabora en su mismo domicilio los elabora con azúcar y esencias, el trabajo de la señora Beatriz es sacrificado por que viaja a distribuir a distintos departamentos de Bolivia, la elaboración de sus productos es manual y la elaboración dura, ella trabaja juntos a dos empleados que le ayudan en horario continuo, sus ayudantes trabajan desde las siete de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde luego ellos se dedican a estudiar, la señora Beatriz es soltera actualmente no tiene hijos, el sueño de la cliente es formar familia y que sus hijos sean gente de bien, el crédito será invertido en el aumento para la compra de una movilidad que le servirá para la distribución local de sus productos.
texts.en:
Beatriz sells and decorates artisanal chocolate cigarettes.  She decorates them in her own home with sugar and essences.  Beatriz sacrifices for the work because she travels for distribution in different departments in Bolivia.  The decoration of her products is done manually, and it is hard work.

She works together with two employees who help her full-time.  Her assistants work from 7 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon, then they study.

Beatriz is single and currently has no children.  Her dream is to have a family and for her children to be decent people.

She will invest the loan in the amount to buy a vehicle to use for the local distribution of her products.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La señora Flora, tiene 40 años es madre de tres hijos en edades escolares, su esposo trabaja en su propio taller de tornería, su vivienda y pequeña granja están ubicadas  en la maica chica a tres kilómetros de la ciudad está mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su granja, necesita capital de inversión para comprar cáscara de soya para sus vacas asimismo está terminando unos comederos para su ganado.
texts.en: Sra. Flora, 40, is the mother of three school-aged children.  Her husband works in the machine shop that he owns.  Her house and farm are in La Maica Chica, some three kilometers from the city.  To improve her standard of living, she is looking for investment capital that she will use to make improvements to her farm.  She plans to buy feed troughs and cattle feed.

loans.use: to buy feed and feed troughs for cattle business.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié.Il est père de deux enfants et a aussi en charge son épouse et ses deux parents.Il exerce le métier de tailleur depuis prés de 10 ans.Il A ainsi pu acquérir une bonne clientèle qui lui est très fidèle.A l'approche de la fete du mouton ( Tabaski), il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour renforcer ses produits en achetant notamment des tissus, des garnitures et des fils.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un secon,d atelier de tailleur et d'embaucher des jeunes.
texts.en:
Babacar is married. He's the father of two children, and also has to support his wife and two parents. He's been a tailor for nearly ten years.

During this time, he managed to build a good and very faithful clientele. With Eid al-Adha feast (Tabaski) approaching, he's seeking a loan of XOF 300'000 in order to bolster his stock by buying fabrics, trimmings, and threads.

He ambitions to open a second tailoring workshop, and to hire young people.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, trimmings, and threads

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo, de 31 años, es un hombre que se dedica mucho a su trabajo. Vive en compañía de su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de ocho años en casa de su madre. El trabajo de Rodolfo consiste en el transporte de pasajeros y carga dentro y fuera de la ciudad, el desde muy temprano empieza su labor, pues ha contratado a tres choferes que manejan cada uno un mototaxi, pues es dueño de cuatro unidades y uno lo maneja él. Tiene 10 años realizando este trabajo. Por otro lado, se dedica a la venta de comida, ya que en su casa posee un patio  para ejercer este negocio. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, gracias a ello tiene ingresos fijo y a diario. Mas adelante empezará a vender comida por las noches, así logrará tener mayores ingresos para su hogar. Este será el sexto crédito con la institución MFP, tiene todas las ganas de seguir trabajando mucho para poder pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, además manifiesta estar muy agradecido con los prestamos recibido ya que le sirvieron para invertir en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará tablas, listones de madera, y otros materiales para terminar el patio de su casa y así empezará a vender también por las noches, además invertirá en comprar ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 31, is a man who works very hard in his job.  He lives with his partner with whom he has an eight-year-old son in the house of his mother.

Rodolfo's job consists of transporting passengers and cargo in and outside the city.  He begins working very early, since he has hired three drivers who each drive a motorcycle taxi.  Rodolfo owns four motorcycle taxis and he drives one of them.  He has been doing this work for 10 years.

He also works selling food, since in his house he has a patio to carry out this business.  He enjoys his work a lot, and thanks to it he has fixed earnings daily.

Later he will begin to sell food at night so he will have greater income for his household.  This will be his sixth loan with the MFP institution.  He wants so much to continue working a lot to be able to make his payments on time.  He is very grateful for the loans he has also received that he used to invest in his business.

With the loan he is requesting he will buy planks, strips of wood, and other materials to finish his patio.  In this way he will begin to sell at night as well.  He also will invest in buying ingredients and supplies for preparing food.

loans.use: to buy strips of wood to equip the patio of his house and to buy materials to prepare food.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana  sells banku at Eguafo. She is a widow and has 6 dependents.  Nana has been selling banku for 15 years. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to buy bulk maize for the preparation of the banku . She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bulk maize for the preparation of the banku

loans.name: Lovinsa's Group

texts.en:
Lovinsa's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Lovinsa is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Lovinsa has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Lovinsa has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help Lovinsa to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Lovinsa hopes that in the future she will be able to own a plot of land. 

Lovinsa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lovinsa's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to improve her business.  With the loan she wants to fix water pipes in her house and purchase a blow dryer for her beauty salon business.  She dreams of expanding her business and purchasing more equipment to meet her customers' needs. Her family's living standards have improved due to more income in the business.

loans.use: to fix water pipes in her house and purchase a blow dryer for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Baasantsogt

texts.en:
Mr.Baasantsogt, 29, runs a taxi business around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business since 2005 and he already has permanent customers. But his daily income does not always meet with his family's necessities.
 
Lately his apartment has become very uncomfortable and cold to live in, because all the window insulations have been removed and there is too much heat-loss during the winter time. Therefore he needs to make adjustments and insulation to his apartment windows. The loan he is requesting will be dedicated to purchasing the building materials to make the windows insulated.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials to make the windows insulation.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is 60 years old, married, and has four children ranging in age from twenty-five to thirty years. She describes herself as a courageous, energetic and passionate woman. She has been selling clothes and perfumes for the last seven years. The business is in a strategic location. Her business faces a challenge of the increased price of goods. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes. Halima's hope and dream is to run a bigger clothes store in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Consuelo Antonia

texts.es: Consuelo Antonia, ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000 en el cual ha mostrado ser  una persona emprendedora, en estos meses nos cuenta que están buenas las ventas pero en la temporadas bajas ellas buscan estrategias para poder que los productos se le muevan, sus hijos están estudiando y los ha sacado adelante con muchos esfuerzos para darle todo lo necesario sin descuidar sus estudios que uno de los sueños de Consuelo es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios. Actualmente está solicitando crédito  para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos como granos básicos, aceite, maíz, frijoles, jabón, entre otros productos que más se mueven.
texts.en: Consuelo Antonia was already granted a loan by the microfinance institution Fundación León 2000, in which she demonstrated her entrepreneurial spirit. She says that she had good sales over the previous months; however, in the low season she still must seek a strategy to boost her turnover. Her children are studying and she succeeded with great effort to make them progress. She gives them everything they need so that they don't have to neglect their studies, because one of Consuelo's dreams is to see her children complete their studies. She is currently applying for a loan to invest in her business. She will buy products, such as staple food, oil, corn, beans, soap, and other products in great demand.

loans.use: to buy staple food, oil, corn, beans, soap and other products.

loans.name: Lorenzo Agapo

texts.es:
Lorenzo un hombre trabajador de 58 años de edad el mantiene una relación en unión libre con Norma con la que tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales 2 aún viven en casa con ellos. Él vive y trabaja en el l Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos en un pequeño recinto llamado Guadalupe es un lugar muy hermoso y tranquilo es un recinto muy conocido por la gran cantidad de ganaderos que existe uno de ellos es Don Lorenzo que se dedica al negocio del ganado lechero conoce mucho de esta actividad, desde muy niño aprendió con sus padres ya que ellos tenían una finca ganadera. Trabaja un promedio de 8 a 10 horas diarias por lo que no le queda mucho tiempo libre, a Don Lorenzo le gusta hacer deporte y aprovechando que en casa tienen una cancha para realizarlo con frecuencia en las tardes 
Este negocio no es muy complicado pero en ocasiones las vacas se enferman y se les dificulta un poco porque tienen que salir al pueblo a buscar un veterinario quien les ayude 
Don Lorenzo tiene muchos sueños que quisiera realizar uno de ellos es incrementar su producción de leche comprando mas vacas y también le gustaría comprar ganado para carne, este préstamo ayudara a don Lorenzo a mejorar su calidad de vida he ingresos ya que se lo invertirá en un negocio muy rentable del cual tiene mucho conocimiento, una granja de cerdos. Don Lorenzo agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando a él y su familia de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a hard-working, 58 year old man. He lives common-law with Norma with whom he has six children. Two of them still live in their home.He lives and works in the 1st canton of San Miguel de los Bancos in a hamlet called Guadalupe. It is a beautiful and tranquil place and is known for the great quantity of people who raise livestock there.

Lorenzo is one of them and he raises milk cows and has a lot of knowledge in this field. As a youngster he learned for his parents on their cattle farm. He works on average 8 to 10 hours per day. He doesn't have much free time but he likes to play sports. They have a field at their house so he can practice there in the evenings. The business is not overly complicated but sometimes the cows get sick and he has to go to town to find a vet to help him. 

Lorenzo has a lot of dreams. One of them is to increase his milk production by buying more cows. He also would like to buy cattle for meat. This loan will help Lorenzo improve his quality of living. He will invest it in a very profitable business that he knows a lot about, which is a pig farm. Lorenzo is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for it's support and the opportunity being offered to his family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: Xxx

texts.en: xxxis 25 years old. She is married, with one child who has four years of age and does not yet go to school. She is a tailor and has been doing business for three years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more clothes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in same business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Hélène

texts.en:
Miss Helene K. is a young, dynamic woman and mother of a girl whose father has been missing for three years. Abandoned and on her own, she has many difficulties to overcome and much to finance: food, rent, her child\'s education, clothing, etc. Born in 1974, she successfully completed her secondary education. She had her first professional experience in a private school. As a misfortune never happens alone, she had to put an end to that activity of teaching as her already low salary was not even paid to her. Very bewildered but keeping her courage, as she has nobody to help her, she has undertook the trade of sweets, biscuits and chocolates with $35 which she had at her disposal. After that she received a credit of $100 she repaid. Her second credit of $200 allowed her to expand her activities to shoes and beauty products, which could bring her more income if she has possessed a more consistent working fund. Currently, at the coming of the year end feasts, she needs $550 to buy articles, namely: womens shoes and beauty products. This will help her to grow her income and to improve her own living condition and that of her children.

Mlle Hélène K. est une jeune femme très dynamique et mère d’une fille dont le Père est introuvable depuis trois ans. Abandonnée à elle-même, elle a du mal à joindre les deux bouts : nourritures, loyer, scolarité de son enfant, habillement, etc. Née en 1974, elle est une femme lettrée qui a terminée le second cycle de l’enseignement général. Elle a eu ses premières expériences professionnelles dans une école privée. Comme un malheur n’arrive jamais seul, elle a dû mettre fin à cette activité d’enseignante qui tourne à la mésaventure car le maigre salaire aussi ne se payait pas. Très désemparée mais gardant son courage car n’ayant personne à lui venir en aide, elle a entrepris le commerce de bonbons , biscuits a chocolats avec $ 35 qu’elle disposait. Par la suite elle a obtenu un crédit de $ 100 qu’elle avait bien remboursé. Son second crédit de $ 200 lui a permis d’étendre ses activités à la vente de chaussures et produits de beauté qui pouvait lui rapporter si elle possédait un fonds de roulement plus consistant. Aujourd’hui, à l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle a besoin de $ 550 pour acheter les articles, notamment des chaussures de femmes et des produits de beauté en vue d’accroître ses revenus et d’améliorer ses propres conditions de vie et celles de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy women shoes and beauty products,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials, packaging and transport

loans.name: Rosa Linda

texts.en:
Rosa Linda has had a business selling decorations for a year and a half. “My business is located on the street, where there is a lot of competition. For this reason, I would like to have more merchandise and I would also like to buy a vitrine to display some small items I have for sale. I am requesting $1,000.00 to invest in my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Rosa Linda tiene un negocio de venta de curiosidades desde hace 1 año y medio “Mi negocio esta en una calle en donde hay mucha competencia así es que me gustaría tener más mercancía y comprar también una vitrina para acomodar algunos objetos pequeños que tengo en venta”.Solicito 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in my business.

loans.name: Lori

texts.en: Lori M. is a 55 year old dynamic craftswoman. She has been making pottery for more than 25 years. She is a well-known as a jar and pot maker in Abobo, a township north of Abidjan. She is a widow, taking care to her six children with revenues generated from her art. She is a motivated and ambitious woman. She wants to use the loan to increase her production of jars and thereby increase her revenue. She received her first loan from AE&I in December 2004 and has been a good performer so far.

loans.use: Lori Matomo will use the loan to increase her pottery production

loans.name: Dau

texts.en: Dau runs a small fruit stand at the commune market place.  She sells a variety of fruit that includes bananas, mandarin oranges, and Siamese custard apples.  Her husband passed away, and Dau was left with the soL. responsibility of raising her 4 children.  Her son, Yen, was born with brain damage.  He is unabL. to go to school and must stay at home.  Her other son, Thanh, works in Ho Chi Minh City.  He sews clothes in a factory, but with his earnings, he is only abL. to support himself.  Dau has 2 other children still in school.  Life is very difficult for Dau, and she hopes Mekong Plus and Kiva can help her with a small loan.  She believes the loan will improve her business and increase her daily profits.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her fruit stand

loans.name: Fanny Yaniret

texts.es:
My name is Fany Yanireth and I sell used clothing. I've worked at this business for some years and I depend on it to pay my family's expenses and other commitments. Thanks to this business, I can earn an income and care for my son. I don't have enough capital now to stock my business sufficiently for the coming months, when sales are normally best.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fany Yanireth, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos. gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos y cuidar de mi hijo, actualmente no cuento con el capital suficiente para surtir mas mi negocio, tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
I have had this business for more than a year inside a school in Nuevo Laredo city, where I am in charge of preparing the meals that they sell to the children. This business is very important to me as it is a way to sell the children meals that are convenient, healthy, and freshly prepared. I need a stove and merchandise to sell. I am asking for a loan of US $1000 dollars to purchase a stove and merchandise.



Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de un año que tengo este negocio dentro de una escuela de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, me encargo de preparar los alimentos que se les venden a los niños. Este negocio es muy importante para mi ya que es una forma de vender les a los niños cómoda sana y recién echa. Me esta haciendo falta una estufa y mercancía para vender. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de una estufa y mercancía.

loans.use: Buy a stove and merchandise

loans.name: Ushirika B Group

texts.en:
Zena, age 45, is divorced and has five children. She owns a business of selling clothing, which she began in 2006. Now, she sells the clothes on the street of her home from 10am to 4pm daily. The business brings her a monthly profit of about $132.

Zena hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will be sharing this loan with her small group members, who have shop, cafe, and soft drink businesses.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Choin

texts.en: Mrs. Choin S., 43, is married with four children and works on a piece of land growing vegetables and rice, making around $1 each day. Her husband (pictured) works collecting palm juice from the palm trees and produces it into palm sugar. With this business activity, he can typically make around $3 each day. Therefore, one of her children works at a garment factory and the rest are enrolled in school. Mrs. Choin S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more seeds to expand her crops as well as buy more farming tools to facilitate her husband's work.

loans.use: Choin would like to purchase more seeds to expand her crops as well as buy more farming tools to facilitate her husband's work.

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trinh Thi T., 50 years old, lives in Luong Bang commune in Kim Dong district with her husband and her 5 children. Two of her children are still in school. Besides farming, her main job is to breed pigs. With her ten-year experience in breeding, her farrow of pigs always look healthy and fat. Every 3 or 4 month, she can sell one litter of pigs. At that time her family got a big income. In order to afford the weekly payment, Mrs. T. sells vegetable to earn more money. In difficult times, her husband and her older children also help out to pay the loan. Her family's monthly income is about 250USD. Next loan cycle she wants to borrow 1200USD to buy piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Toán, 50 tuổi, sống tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động cùng chồng và 5 người con. Hai trong số 5 người con của chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Ngoài làm ruộng công việc chính của chị Toán là chăn nuôi lợn. Có kinh nghiệm hơn 10 năm trong việc chăn nuôi nên đàn lợn nhà chị Toán lúc nào trông cũng béo tốt khoẻ mạnh. Cứ 3-4 tháng lại có 1 lứa xuất chuồng. Những lúc đó cả nhà lại có thêm một khoản thu nhập lớn. Để có tiền hoàn trả tuần chị Toán chạy trợ bán rau để kiếm thêm đồng ra đồng vào. Những lúc khó khăn chồng và người con lớn lại hỗ trợ thêm. Thu nhập của cả gia đình chị Toán đạt 250USD/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 1200USD để mua lợn con thay cho đàn lợn mới xuất chuồng trong dịp Tết vừa qua.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of athletic shoes, new and used clothing (t-shirts, dress shirts, dresses, jeans, etc.)

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar is 51 years old widow and the mother of six children. With her first loan (300 Nuevo Sol, Peruvian currency) from the Manuela Ramos group, she invested in a small shop. These days her shop is well-stocked – she sells groceries, handicrafts, ribbons and other adornments. Her children help her tend the store and on the weekends Pilar likes to go for walks with them. With this loan of $300 (800 Nuevo Sol) she will purchase one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, milk, pasta, canned foods, cooking oil, bread, and more. Pilar opened her shop with the future of her children in mind. She wanted them to be able to continue studying and have good jobs in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Pilar pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Américas, ubicado en el Jr. 23 de Febrero 179, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años es madre de 6 hijos, es viuda. Pilar con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega esta mas surtida, vende abarrotes y productos de pasamanería, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienden su negocio y los fines de semana le gusta salir a pasear con ellos. Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, aceite, pan, etc. Pilar salió adelante por sus hijos, decidió poner la bodega pensando en su futuro para que mas adelante puedan seguir estudiando y ser buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Leticia Jacqueline

texts.es:
Leticia is 53 years old and lives in the region of Sabana Grande. She has 4 children who are attending school; her life partner is a driver and helps with family expenses.

Six years ago Leticia and her partner used their own capital to begin their business by selling chicken. Currently she also works as a dressmaker and hopes that in the future she can expand her sales and dressmaking, as part of this growth she is requesting a loan to buy products and fabrics in order to complete her customers’ dressmaking orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Leticia tiene 53 años de edad y habita en la comarca Sabana Grande. Tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, su compañero de vida es de oficio conductor y le apoya con los gastos familiares.

Doña Leticia junto a su compañero hace 6 años empezaron el negocio de las ventas de derivados de pollo con capital propio. Actualmente se dedica también a la costura y desea en un futuro poder agrandar sus ventas y sus costuras, y como parte de ese cercimeinto está solicitando el crédito para comprar productos para sus ventas y telas para poder haciendo las costuras solicitadas por sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase chicken for sales and fabrics for her dressmaking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk for a small business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Ms. Gladys is divorced with one university-aged son. Gladys is very proud of her son who is also her best friend. Gladys owns a sewing workshop in her house. She began sewing with her aunt, who taught her much about the craft. Later, with her savings, she purchased a sewing machine and began working independently.

The loan that she is requesting she will use to enlarge her house which will allow her to have a larger workshop. The extra space will allow for a fitting room for her clients.

Ms. Gladys' dream is to one day have her own brand of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gladys es divorciada, tiene un hijo mayor estudiante universitario del cual ella esta muy orgullosa pues es su mejor amigo, y un ejemplo como hijo. Ella posee un taller de costura en su casa. Se inicio en la costura con una tía con la que trabajo varios años y le enseño lo que sabe, luego, con sus ahorros compro una máquina de coser y se independizo.

El crédito que solicita desea destinarlo para la ampliación de su vivienda y así poder tener un taller más amplio para dar comodidad a sus clientas que vienen a su casa a probarse los vestidos que ella les cose.

La señora Gladys sueña con algún día poder tener su propia marca de ropas.

loans.use: Enlarging her house

loans.name: Mrs. Morm Sam Oeun Group

texts.en:
The four women in Khsom Village in Kandal Province who have formed a loan group will use the loan for a variety of purposes. The group leader, Mrs. Morm S. O., grows corn, assisted by her husband, Mr. Chon S. Art, and since her business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to buy more corn seeds to cultivate. In addition, she has one cow for breeding.

Mrs. Morm S. O. is 50 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory earning $50 each per month. The remaining two are attending school.

loans.use: To buy more corn seeds to cultivate

loans.name: Charles K

texts.en: Charles K G. is married and has one child. He has received technical training at school. Charles K sells mobile phones and accessories. He also repairs phones at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. He has been in this business since 2005. His wife is a trader. Charles K uses his income to feed his family and to pay utility bills. Charles K will use the loan to buy more mobile phones to meet his ever increasing customer demand. He will also buy tools and equipment to enhance his phone repair work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Charles K plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones as well as tools and equipment for his phone repair work

loans.name: Karla Del Carmen

texts.es:
La dama Karla A. es propietaria de una pulpería el cual atiende en la ciudad de Masaya brindando variedades de productos tales como comestibles, bebidas y productos personales.

Inició su negocio ofreciendo pocos productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha invertido en el negocio y  esto gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido salir adelante en su negocio y de esta forma mantener su humilde hogar de habitación. Actualmente se ha perfilado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel y espera que su crédito sea otorgado para la compra de la mercadería.
texts.en:
Karla Aragon is the owner of a small general store that she runs in the city of Masaya where she offers a variety of products like food, drinks, and personal hygiene products. She started her business offering very few products but as time has passed, she has invested in the store and thanks to help from Ceprodel, she has been able to grow her business which helps her cover the expenses of her humble home. She stands out as a faithful customer of Ceprodel and hopes to receive this loan in order to purchase additional merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general store products

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabitri M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the growing villages in Nepal. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives with her husband and daughter. Her husband, Mr. Dharma Lal M., works in Nepal Telecom, and her daughter is in primary school.

Mrs. M. is a wood dealer in the village of Thecho where she sells wood and timber to the carpenters. She started this business 5 years ago to help improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 ($275) to buy a truck-load of timbers for her business. Mrs. Sabitri M. wants to earn more money to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Buy timber to sell

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than S., 27, is married and resides with her two children and her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been growing different kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make $4 per day, while her husband is a construction foreman and makes $5 a day. Their two children are too young to attend school.

Mrs. Than S. would like to take out a loan of $700 to purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools.

loans.name: Nana Obeng

texts.en:
Nana Obeng A. lives in Agogo, a suburb of the Ashanti region, Ghana. His major occupation is crop farming. He's also a professional carpenter and makes all kinds of furniture including dinning sets, beds, chairs and coffins for over 3 years. He recently added coffins to his business to sell within his community after realizing families had to travel long distances to buy coffins for deceased relatives.  

Nana is 51 years old, married and father with seven children. Four of his children have successfully completed senior high school, and the other 3 are still in primary school. Lots of people in the community are amazed with his work and his good health. Nana is happy because he has work to do and is not idle.  
 
Nana requests a loan to buy more wood, nails, and coffins because the demand is very high. With the loan, Nana will be resourceful and use the loan wisely in his business so he can continue taking care of his family. He is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Nana wants a loan to buy wood, nails, and coffins

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Pablo Antonio L. Alemán tiene la edad de 37 años, habita en el barrio san caralampio ubicado en la Concepción junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, .Ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos los cuales estudia su secundaria actualmente,  los planes hacia su familia es salir hacia delante con la producción  para apoyar a sus hijos económicamente en sus estudios , la mayor dificultad que ha tenido que las plagas le afectaron sus cultivos y la falta de financiamiento . Desde hace seis años se dedica a la agricultura. El solicita financiamiento para poder aplicárselo a los cultivos y no seguir perdiendo producción. Ya que es su fuente de subsistencia para su familia. Es por ello que da agracias a Afodenic por el apoyo que brinda mediante el préstamo que será de mucho beneficios para su producción
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Antonio L. Alemán is a 37-year-old man who lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood, located in La Concepción, with his family. His wife works as a housekeeper, and they have three children who are currently in high school. His family plans include moving forward with crop production so that he can financially support his children’s studies. The biggest problem he faces is that pest insects have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He has been working in agriculture for six years. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, he gives thanks to Afodenic for the support it gives him via this loan, which will be of great benefit for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies to improve crop production

loans.name: Mamadier

texts.ru: Мамадёр мужчина 30 лет , женат имеет четверых детей.Жена домохозяйка занимается уходом и воспитанием детьми.Сам Мамадёр ежедневно работает разнорабочим.Его средний доход очень низкий , не хватает на проживание семьи.Поэтому он с молодости занимается откормом и продажей скота,для увеличения скота и расширения сарая  он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Mamadier is 30 years old, married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker, who takes care of the children. Mamadier works as a handyman every day. His income is very low and is not enough to support his family. That is why since his youth, Mamadier has been raising and selling livestock. He wants to use this loan to increase his livestock headcount and to expand his barn.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan C., who is thirty-one years old, has been a wholesaler-retailer of vegetables in Poblacion, Quezon for five years. Her husband assists Susan with the purchases of vegetables in Valencia, utilizing their motorcycle at least three times a week. With their personal capital plus the financial assistance of HSPFI, the couple would be able to sustain the project. Susan is requesting additional loan assistance from HSPFI in the amount of $325, which they will use to purchase more vegetables. Susan's long time goal is to own a 4-wheel-drive vehicle for delivering their goods to the nearby settlements.

loans.use: To purchase volume of assorted vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda Banez is a 50-year-old mother of ten. Her husband Numeriano is a farmer who works a two-hectare rice field. Rebecca barters (soft drinks and bread) in exchange for rice during harvest season. Her sons and daughters stopped schooling after their secondary education because of the scarcity of money to finance their college education. 

Rosalinda joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to buy fertilizer, and to buy assorted foods for her bartering. She hopes that through her loan, she can purchase the inputs in bulk and in advance to get a lesser price in the market to avoid borrowing from usurious lenders. The couple hopes that with the loan extended to them they can save their harvest for the whole year's consumption.

loans.use: Tu buy farm inputs such as fertilizer,  and assorted foods for bartering

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Rovelyn A. is 34 years old and married to Jojico A., a private driver. They have three children, who are all in school. She is a new member of Kiva's partner Paglaum MPC under the micro-finance program.
