She applied for the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store -- a mini grocery store were you can buy assorted goods -- and now she has moderate stocks of groceries.

She has also a small fishing boat for their food consumption. She hopes to improve her business and avail herself of higher amounts of loans for the progress of her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for  her store

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice D. is currently in the business of making and selling Sudanese local bread, fried in oil. She is requesting a loan to open up a bigger bread-making business. Joice is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a bigger bread making business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
"My husband is a farmer and I am helping him manage our small rice farm. When we got married, we bought 2-hectares of land. Now, we are still using it to produce rice for our family’s needs. We are currently preparing our farm. We will soon plant young rice and hopefully it will give us an abundant harvest in the future," says Elizabeth M..

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, Ammonium Sulfate and herbicides. The loan will definitely improve their harvest and increase their income as well.

CEVI has been providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, Ammonium Sulfate and herbicides.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth P. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is single, 23 years old, and she has one school-aged child.

To make a living Ruth owns and operates an "a la carte" -- a small stall where she sells grilled chicken and pork. Ruth is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ruth successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI that she used to purchase chicken and pork meat to grill and sell.

Ruth is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which she will use to invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support her child's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her a la carte business

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
G. Đỗ Thị (228961388) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is widowed and has five adult children.

G. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over fourteen years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 1996, G. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

G. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 15th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy I. is 43 years old and married with three children. Joy sells bags, shoes and jewelery. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more jewelery, bags and shoes to sell so that she can supply her increasing number of customers and make more profit.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelery, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Easter

texts.en:
Easter P. is currently in the business of selling goods like cooking oil, soap, body lotion, etc., in an open place and is requesting a loan to build up a shop. Easter is 30 years old and is married with a husband who works as a driver. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more goods in her shop to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan S. has been a successful micro-entrepreneur, selling fruit in his small community of Casa Colorá. He lives with his wife and young child in a run-down house made of wooden planks. The house is falling apart and it is unsafe and uncomfortable. Juan is in the process of building a new house for his family out of cement blocks.

Hurricanes and tropical storms are very common in the Dominican Republic and houses made of wood are swept away every time. With a house made out of cement, Juan and his family can weather the storm safely. Funding this loan will allow Juan and his family to be safe and secure in their home. *Juan was not available for the photo,so his wife Alexandra is pictured above.

loans.use: Cement Blocks

loans.name: Jecelyn

texts.en: Jecelyn R. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Jecelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp and fruit like pineapple in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jecelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jecelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. is from the village of Sipaloc. She is 37 years old. Maria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Maria is just starting this business.

In 2008, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business particularly the pig raising project. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mr. Chorn Uorng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of seventeen people, is located I. Trea Village I. Kandal province. Mr. Chorn U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. All the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Chorn U. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. On his farm, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support the field. So he decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field and to make his crop more productive.

Mr. Chorn U. is 53 years old and his wife, Mrs. N. Srey Pov, helps him on the plantation. They have two children, one of whom is employed I. a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make his crop more productive

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 41-year-old single mother with two adult sons, ages 19 and 21. She has been selling second-hand clothes for seven years. She says that the market in which she sells is the busiest and biggest in Kenya. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase three bales of trousers.

In the future, she would like to expand the business so that her sons can join her, with a branch for herself and one for each of them.


 
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of trousers

loans.name: Daniel Omondi

texts.en:
Daniel Omondi is 27 years old, married to Claris, and the father of a boy who is two years old. Daniel operates a small shop, a business that he has had for 12 years. He started the business with capital he had raised through farming sweet potatoes on his small piece of land. He and his family are totally dependent on this business for their needs and so far he has not had a challenge.

Daniel was introduced to KADET Limited by a friend who was an existing client. This will be his third loan, and he intends to use the funds to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat, which are mostly demanded during the December festive season.

He aspires to open a wholesale business for household goods.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Pascuala Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza es originari de la comunidad de Chuculjuyup del municipio de Totonicapan su Actividad principal es ama de casa con los ingreso y con la colaboracion de su esposo que trabaja como abañil ha sobre salido con su hijos en darles una buena educacion y alimentacion hoy necesita de un credito que lo inveriran en la inscripcion y colegiatura de dos hijas que empiezan su carrera de diversificado en la ciudad de Quetzaltenango por la politicas de los colegios la inscripciones se realizan durante el mes de noviembre y la primera quincena de Diciembre y los cupos son limitados don ellos quieren incribirlo para no tener problema en el futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza is originally from the community of Chuculjuyup in the town of Totonicapan. She is a housewife who generates an income, while her husband works as a bricklayer. They help each other get ahead so that they can provide their children with food and a good education.

Esperanza is requesting a loan so that she can pay the registration fees and tuition for her two daughters, who are starting their general degree program in the city of Quetzaltenango. According to the school policies, registration occurs during the month of November through the 15th of December. Space is limited, so she wants to complete her daughters’ registration so that they will not experience problems in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the education expenses of her two daughters

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene owns a hair dressing salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells drinks and hair materials like shampoo, hair extensions and cream to her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more crates of drinks and salon materials to sell. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She is married with three children. She is a focused, hard worker. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell and salon materials

loans.name: Margarita A.

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael, la señora Margarita R. se dedica con mucho ahínco a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y beneficiar grandemente a su familia. Ella se ha destacado por ser muy disciplinada en su trabajo y por preocuparse por el bienestar de su hogar. El crédito que ella solicita es para la compra de algunos electrodomésticos como lo es una cocina porque la que ha tenido ya no presta buenas condiciones y también necesita la compra de un televisor.
Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para así lograr su meta de adquirir estos electrodomésticos para su hogar.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael, Ms. Margarita Ramirez works very hard to make a living for her household and greatly benefit her family. She has distinguished herself by being very disciplined in her work and caring for the well-being of her home. The loan which she is asking for is to purchase some appliances such as a stove because the one she has does not work well anymore, and she also needs to buy a television. She hopes that her loan will be given satisfactorily in order to achieve her goal of acquiring these appliances for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy appliances

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 35 years old, is married, and is the mother of four kids who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment.

Diana is a trader, trading in garment cloth and lace material which she sells through hawking (going door-to-door). Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Accra to buy her stock of goods but, for lack of adequate working capital, Diana buys only a small stock of lace material.
		
Diana loves selling goods. She has another business through which she obtains an additional source of livelihood: she has been selling beans and maize cereals for seven years to support her family. Maize is one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrates in diets. She takes delivery of stock direct from farmers in Techiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

With this loan, Diana wants to buy maize and beans in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her business expansion and her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase lace material, textiles, beans and maize in bulk

loans.name: Tuvsanaa

texts.en: Tuvsanaa is a driver and is the father of two. He has lived in the city for the past two years. Tuvsanaa purchased the insulated ger (nomadic tent) blanket because he needed a warm and clean blanket to make it through the rest of the cold winter. He says that he, his wife, and two children have already felt warmer in the weeks that they have had the blanket. About XacBank Eco Products Program: Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels. XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a six-layer highly insulated yurt (ger) covering

loans.name: Cesinia

texts.en:
Cesinia B. is from the village of Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Cesinia owns & operates a general store. Cesinia has been engaged in her business for nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Cesinia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cesinia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cesinia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory, as working capital and to build a house for lease. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Cesinia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jemilat

texts.en:
Jemilat is 40 years old, married to a teacher and has four children. She has been a member of LAPO microfinance for over three years now with a good repayment record.

Jemilat sells groceries to make a living in Lagos state and has been managing it for some years now. She is focused on making sure she meets the demand of her customers, which she said will also lead to increases in profits for her. Jemilat sees herself as a partner to her husband. She supports her husband in meeting the family financial needs.

Jemilat is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries in bulk as this will enable her get a better discount and maximize profits. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Freol

texts.es: Freol tiene 32 años, es un joven entusiasta que desea sacar adelante a su familia, soltero y vive en la casa de su tío Félix, quien tiene una hija. Como ejemplo de sacrificio y entrega a las tierras donde creció, tiene  a su tío, quien le enseñó todas las técnicas agrícolas desde pequeño, es por eso le gusta sembrar y cultivar todos los productos que crecen en sus chacras. Es así que hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, y con la ayuda de sus hermanos menores y de algunos operarios que contrató, cuidan de los cultivos de maíz, alverja y papa,  resultándole muy rentable la venta de esta producción, cubriendo de esa manera los gastos y ofreciendo beneficio a su familia, para que no pasen necesidades. En el futuro espera sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues desea convertirse en un negociante mayorista de todos los productos que siembra y existe en la sierra peruana, por lo que está tratando de contar con negociante mayorista en el mercado de la capital. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, ya que le  agrada compartir nuevas experiencias con sus compañeros, por lo que desea continuar progresando junto a ellos. Con los dos mil ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará dos bolsas de semilla de alverja y cinco sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Freol, 32, is an enthusiastic young man who wants to get his family ahead in life. He is single and lives in his uncle Felix’s house; his uncle has a daughter. His uncle is a living example of someone who sacrifices himself for, and is dedicated to, his native soil. He learned all he knows about farming from him from a very early age. This is why he so enjoys farming his lands. It is thus that he has farmed for the last 20 years and, with help from his younger siblings and some hired help, he cares for corn, pea and potato crops. The sale of these products is quite profitable and provides enough income to cover family expenses so that they can meet all their basic needs. He would like to plant more in the future because he’d like to become a wholesaler of all the products he grows as well as of all products typical of the Peruvian mountains; he is trying to become associated with a wholesaler in the capital’s market. This is his 9th loan with MFP; he enjoys working in a communal group because he likes to share new experiences with his fellow members. He wants to continue to progress together with them. He will use the 2800 new soles requested to buy two sacks of pea seed and five sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yrma Yuliana

texts.es: La Sra. Yrma  tiene 32  años de edad, es separada tiene 2 hijas de 15 y 10 años de edad,ella vive en casa propia de material noble de un piso  ubicado en el distrito de Parcona. Ella  cuenta con el ingreso del alquiler de una moto taxi y un automovil tico. Adicional a ello  tiene un pequeño negocio de la  venta de chicha de jora y mazamorra morada  en su casa, lo apoyan sus hijas. Ella se inicio en el negocio de alquiler de vehiculo hace 3 años. La Sra. Yrma tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de los tantos es que sus hijas sean profesioanles. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en el mantenimiento y pintura  de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sra. Yrma is 32 years old and separated from her spouse. She has two daughters, ages 15 and 10. Her home is made of solid materials and located in the District of Parcona. Yrma generates an income by renting out a motorcycle taxi and a taxi cab. In addition, she manages a small business selling “chicha de jora” (a beverage made of corn) and purple “mazamorra” (corn porridge) from her home in order to support her daughters. She started her vehicle rental business three years ago.

Sra. Yrma has many dreams and goals. One of them is to see her daughters become professionals. With the money she requested, she will pay for maintenance and painting of her vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance & painting for her vehicle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This friendly and very hardworking entrepreneur, Teresita F., has run a fishing and fish-trading business for almost seven years in the province of Rizal, earning her a reasonable monthly revenue. Her main challenge has been having a small amount of stock due to the hindrance of insufficient working capital to put into her fishing business.

Teresita joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2008 and is very grateful for secured access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. This loan of 15,000 Php is to help her buy fishing nets to increase her stock to match her customers’ demands in the local community.

Teresita thinks that commercializing her business and expanding it will enable her to earn more revenue and enable her to pay school fees for her children and cater for other family needs. With access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful her dreams of sending her children to a university to complete college degrees will be achieved.

Teresita’s desire to give her children a brighter future fuels her dedication to her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets to increase her stock

loans.name: Allah Wahid Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Alimatu S. is a 42-year-old woman who describes herself as punctual and hard-working.  She is married and has 2 children, ages 20 and 23. Alimatu’s husband is a taxi driver.  She would like to help her children gain a university education.

Alimatu has been a retail seller of undergarments for the past 7 years.  She will use the loan to buy more undergarments like panties, singlets, and boxer shorts as well as skirts and tops.  She hopes to eventually expand her business and supply more items to her customers.

Alimatu is currently the leader of the trust bank group called “Allah Wahid" in Arabic.  There are 13 members in this group.  The other group members also operate retail businesses selling items such as foodstuffs, second-hand clothes, and honey.  They plan to use the loan to buy inventory to grow their businesses and to enable them to take care of their respective families.

loans.use: To purchase underwear, skirts and tops in bulk

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mr. Chann P., 27 years old, is a local construction laborer earning $3 per day in a commune of Kompong Tom, a province of Cambodia. He is a single man who currently lives with his older father and other family members. They all have jobs at different fields.

Chann P. has requested a loan for the purpose of repairing the broken wooden wall of his existing house. The loan will provide a more comfortable living for this family.

loans.use: To repaire the broken wooden wall of an existing house.

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.ru: Халимов Тавакал проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын работает и живет в России. Сам Тавакал имеет средне - специальное образование, "Сварщик". Работает по профессии. Он в основном изготавливает металлические двери на заказ. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа электрода.
texts.en:
Tavakal H. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 51 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. His son works and lives in Russia. Tavakal has specialized secondary education, he is a welder and is working in this field. He mainly makes custom metal doors. He has been in this business for fifteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy electrode.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrode

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 4 children. Her oldest child is twenty-seven and her youngest is eighteen. She does farming for a living. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest around her community. Her husband helps her maintain the farm and does the major farming duties. She, on the other hand, manages a sari-sari store where basic food and daily use products are sold. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education and have them finish college.

Elsa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment and also additional inventory for her store. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Elsa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment and also additional inventory for her store.

loans.name: Augustine Ayadjénou

texts.fr: D. Augustine Ayadjénou est née en 1967 à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à MINDENOU Alexandre, Augustine est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Il y a près de vingt trois ans que Augustine s'est installée à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-POdji, où elle vit avec sa famille. Augustine vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Augustine a très tôt abandonné l'école, puis a appris la coiffure. Augustine exerce cette activité depuis une quiinzaine d'année. Augustine mène cette activité à son domicile. Parallèlement, Augustine vend des mèches. Augustine s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Augustine sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue d'acheter beaucoup de mèches et de réaliser des perruques qu'elle mettra en vente.
texts.en:
Augustine Ayadjénou D. was born in 1967 at Djeffa, in the Sèmè-Podji commune in Bénin. Married to Alexandre MINDENOU, Augustine is the mother of six children, all of whom are in school. In addition to their children, the couple has two other children in their care. Augustine settled in Lokokoukoumè in the Sèmè-Podji commune nearly three years ago, where she lives with her family. She helps her husband to provide for the family’s various expenses. She left school very early and then learned hairdressing. Augustine has been in this business for about fifteen years and runs her business at her home. In addition, she sells hair pieces. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. This is the first time that Augustine has requested financial assistance from ALIDé, so that she can buy many hairpieces and make wigs that she will sell.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase boxes of hair pieces.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been practising mixed farming for 8 years in Kitale town, Western Kenya. He has employed one farm-hand. His main products are milk, vegetables and oranges which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his timber business.

Ali recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000 KES and has requested this loan of 71,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this loan he will be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption. However, he faces the challenge of diseases and droughts which cause shortages of food and water.

Ali is 34 years old. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 12. All the children attend school. He is optimistic that in 5 years time, he will have a posho mill machine which will generate income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is married to a manager with whom she has four children. All her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.   She owns a retail shop in Kazo Angola. She sells to all categories of people, retail. 

Resty buys her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala City and uses public transport to and from Kikuubo.  She goes shopping once a week.  She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and jerrycans of cooking oil.  She has been in this business for years. 

Besides this grocery business Resty also sells second-hand shoes at her shop.  Resty works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include the rainy season because she lives in a place which is prone to floods, and transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo to her home in Kazo Angola. She is aspiring of educating her children up to university and owning a wholesale shop  

Resty joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap,  and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita L. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Sampaguita, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: general store, buy and sell (charcoal) and hog fattening businesses. Her husband, Luis, who is 50 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have nine children who are between 11 and 28 years old. 

Joelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1989 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her general store and for food for her hogs so she can continue to save up for her children's future education and for house renovation. Joelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell and for pig food

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 54 tiene 3 hijos. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que Rosa siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia, desde muy joven ha trabajado, por lo que no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio tiene una gran variedad de clientes pues ha sido muy provechoso. Este financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, trajes, cosméticos y calzado. Sueña con establecer un tramo en el mercado para mostrar sus diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 54 years old and has 3 children. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise. Rosa is always looking for a way to improve her income so she can support her family; she has worked since she was very young, and it has not been easy to maintain her business. She has had her business for more than 6 years, and it has been very profitable because she has a large variety of customers. She will use this loan to purchase pants, shirts, dresses, cosmetics, and shoes. Rosa dreams of setting up a stall in the market so that she can display her various products.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man and the father of 2 school-aged children. He has owned a citrus fruit business for the past 10 years. He cultivates only citrus products on his land. He is the main income provider for his family. He uses plastic tents to grow his produce. These tents allow him to better monitor product quality as well as growing his produce for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase needed supplies for his agriculturA. work.  In the future, he is planning to grow his business and cultivate other agriculture produce but he hasn't yet decided which type of crops.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Annet has a business making charcoal stoves, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clay soil.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Annet hopes to learn more about hairdressing. Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by expanding her business more than before.

loans.use: To buy more clay soil

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza T. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Tuboran, Brgy. Camba-og, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a pottery business.  Her husband Joeffrey, who is 36 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 5 and 13 years old. 

Annaliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twelve loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annaliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,400, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children. 

Annaliza T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her pottery business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Lydia has a beauty shop business, which she has had for three years.  She also sells charcoal.  

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase oil treatment for the hair.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lydia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her mother.  

In the future, Lydia hopes to build rental houses and expand her business further.  Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning new games and knowing how to handle her life.

loans.use: oil treatment for the hair

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws). Saidat has a business of selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Saidat sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Saidat has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.  The main business challenge(s) for Saidat include seasonality and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to start selling wholesale only. Saidat lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia vive  en el municipio de el Torno,  es nacida en el departamento de Chuquisaca, hace unos 20 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad de santa cruz, su esposo brinda el servicio de taxi en la ciudad de santa  cruz, hace unos 4 años que esta en este rubro, tienen tres hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar,  por lo que tienen que trabajar los dos para sostener a su familia ya que sus ingresos a veces no les alcanza, el destino del crédito solicitado es para comprar ropa y asi poder incrementar  el capital de trabajo, ya que por fin de año la demanda de productos es alta y esta época ella puede ahorrase algo de dinero, es una persona muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.	.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in the town of El Torno.  She was born in Chuquisaca department but came to live in the city of Santa Cruz twenty years ago.  Her husband provides a taxi service in the city of Santa Cruz.  He has been in this business for 4 years.  Silvia has three young, school-age children.  Both she and her husband have to work to support their family since their incomes sometimes don't stretch far enough.

Silvia will use her loan to buy clothes so that she can increase her working capital.  During the end-of-year season, demand for her products is high which means that she can save a little money.  Silvia is a very hard-working person and she is grateful to our institution for the support she receives.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Kariuki

texts.en: Kariuki is a member of Faulu Kenya under Bidii Daima group.  He joined the group of young entrepreneurs so as to share business ideas, save his money and to get loans from Faulu Kenya easily.  Since he joined the group, he has been able to expand his business, which is selling charcoal.  He was previously selling newspapers for a living before he started selling charcoal.  He has requested for 40,000 KES to add stock of charcoal.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 46 years old, married and a father of three. He owns a van which he uses for his transportation business. He was previously employed as a driver before he went into business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his finances by saving his money. He hopes to own more vans and employ more people in the future. He needs a loan of 60, 000 Kes to buy tires for his van.

loans.use: To buy tires for his van

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Abu Bakarr. He is married and has one two year-old child. He has one additional dependent who lives with him who is a relative of his wife. In 2008, Abu established his electrical appliances business because he wanted to be self-dependent. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,950,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy additional electrical appliances. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 390,000. 

In the future, Abu plans to increase his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional electrical appliances

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia owns a small grocery store in Ayacucho. She is 49 years-old and has 6 grown children. Two of her daughters are also members of FINCA Peru. She has been a member of FINCA for 2 years and appreciates the meetings, training, assistance in raising her children and general support. Amalia will be using her loan to purchase supplies for her grocery store. In the future, she hopes to expand her house.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members, they are located in Chanlak village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Ben M., born in 1942, has been selected as the group leader by the other members. Mrs. Ben M. is widow with a child who is a security guard in a private company. 

She is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow rice. But she doesn’t have enough money to support her farming, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, gasoline, and a pesticide sprayer.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, gasoline, and a pesticide sprayer

loans.name: Gbotima I Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businesswomen in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and earn more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, and feeding and clothing them. 

Baby A. is the leader of this group. She was born in Pujehun 45 years ago. Baby is married and has four children. Her husband is a monthly salaried worker and her children are attending schools. Baby sells fish. She has been doing this business for 10 years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying fish wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale to add to current stock

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem V. is 30 years old.  She lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. V. is a farmer and also a food vendor, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband has a job transporting fruit juice, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 75 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more ingredients to expand her food selling business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. V. appears in the photograph while she is selling her food to her customers.

loans.use: purchase ingredients for her food selling business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a thirty-nine year old married man with three children who lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For five years he has been trading in cattle and he is also an employee of a non-government organisation. He faces the challenge of price flactuation and he dreams of owning a ranch. Godfrey needs the loan facility to buy a heifer to raise.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to raise

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Fatmata K., a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to invest in her business. 

A wife and a mother of three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school – the 42-year-old was born in one of the villages make up Sanda, but she now lives and sells in Kabala town. Fatmata sells market food stuffs like fish, rice, groundnuts, soap, etc. She has been doing this business for 28 years. 

Fatmata has requested this loan in order to increase her business inventory. With this loan, she estimates buying bags of caustic soda for the production of a large quantity of soap, five bags of husk rice, two bags of cleaned rice, and ten bags of ground-nuts.

loans.use: to buy bags of caustic soda, a large quantity of soap, five bags of husk rice, two bags of cleaned rice, and ten bags of ground-nuts in order to increase her inventory

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra, a 27-year-old married mother of one child, has owned a mobile phones shop since October 2009, a business she decided to start in order to help her husband with their family's income and expenses. Zahra works hard to improve her enterprise, regularly introducing more and different products to her customers. In addition to prepaid mobile numbers, she sells mobile phones and accessories and also perfumes.

Zahra is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to increase capital for her mobile phone accessories, such as covers, earphones and many other useful accessories. She hopes to expand her business in the future by moving into wholesale trade. As well, she aspires to provide her child with the best childhood and the best education ever.

loans.use: to increase her stock of mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María  Magdalena, es casada con el señor  Juan, con quien a su responsabilidad tienen cinco hijos  y son: Cruz de  trece años de edad, María Corazón de diez años José  Julián  de siete años de edad, Luis Miguel de seis  años,   francisco Javier de tres años,   maida Lizet de cuatro meses.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de ganados en donde lleva  cinco meses el comenta que le va bien ya que con ello esta poyando a su esposo ya quien es el que se en carga del negocio que y ella dispone  de las ganancias que va obteniendo de la venta.

   Lo que lo inspiro fue su esposo pues  dice que desde que se casaron viene trabajando juntos así poder darle  lo mejo a su hijos que están creciendo  y desean algunas cosas  que les gusta.

   Su más grande deseo es con la ayuda de dios y el préstamo otorgado pueda seguir trabajando y días con días se incremente mas, así cuando sus hijos crezcan le den lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is married to Juan with whom she has five children: Cruz who is 13 years old, Maria Corazon who is 10 years old, Jose Julian who is 7 years old, Luis Miguel who is 6 years old, Francisco Javier who is 3 years old and Maida Lizet who is 4 months old. 

She requested this loan to invest in the purchase and sale of cattle which she has been doing for five months. She is doing well and she is supporting her husband. Her husband takes care of the business and she provides the profits that she obtains from the sale.

Her husband inspired her because they have been working together since they got married which allows them to give their children the best since they are growing and want things they like.

Her biggest desire is that with the help of God and with the loan she can keep working and every day she can improve so that when her children are grown she can give them the necessities.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and sale of livestock such as cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Jannette Jamilet

texts.es: Jannette Jamilet se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi. Además tiene su trabajo que es docente en una escuela. El negocio Jannette inicio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso, pues actualmente con el salario que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el gasto de la gasolina del taxi, ya que el precio de la gasolina es muy inestable. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de llantas, focos y mantenimiento al vehículo.
texts.en: On top of her regular job as a teacher in a school, Jannette Jamilet also works as a taxi driver. As her main wage is not enough to pay for her family’s expenses, Jannette started this activity because she needed a second income. One of her main challenges is the cost of petrol for the taxi, because gas price varies a lot. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tires and headlights, and to pay for the car’s upkeep.

loans.use: To buy tires and headlights, and to pay for the car’s upkeep

loans.name: Iksasalethu Group

texts.en: Nobuhle, with hand raised, is 41 years old and single with two children who are 20 and 22, neither of whom attends school. She runs an agricultural business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. She has been in this business for 5 years selling vegitables from her home and sometimes around the neighborhood. Nobuhle requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that she hasn't faced any challenges selling vegetables and that the extra income from this loan will help her business grow and she will be able to save money in the bank. In future she would like to see her business grow and build a shop to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Magueye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Magueye agée de 33 ans,marié,pere de 3 jeunes enfants ,habite un village se situant à 15 km de la principale ville de la region.
IL est enseignant dans l’ élèmentaire depuis plus de 3 ans. Il adore son métier et aime partager ses connaissances avec ses élèves.
Avec ce credit il envisage de prendre en charge les frais médicaux de son enfant malade.
Il veux stabiliser  l’ état de santé de son enfant ,pour qu’ il puisse aller normalement à l’ école.
texts.en: Magueye is 33 years old, married, and a father of three young children. He lives in a village located 15 kim away from the capital city in his region in Senegal. He has been an elementary school teacher for the past three years and really enjoys sharing his knowledge with his students. He is asking for a loan in order to cover the medical costs of his sick child, who needs special care before being back in stable health in order to continue to go to school.

loans.use: cover medical expenses of his child

loans.name: Rodencio

texts.en: Rodencio is 53 years old, married and blessed with five children. He has been engaged in farming rice for almost 31 years. His net income last cropping was 50,000 PHP, and he is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. Rodencio hopes to improve his family's living conditions through hard work and support. He hopes to send his young children to college and renovate their house to live more comfortably. He would like to continue to acess loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to him in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: María Paula

texts.es: María Paula de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con sus tres hijas en una zona semiurbana del país. Ella posee una tortillería y una pequeña tienda en el lugar de su residencia, sus negocios son muy visitados por las personas de la localidad pues María siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan, su tienda la mantiene muy surtida y las tortillas son calientitas y con un sabor delicioso todo a precios son realmente accesibles; María esta lista siempre para el trabajo para ella no hay imposibles siempre se encuentran los medios adecuados para sobresalir es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, golosinas, granos básicos, productos instantáneos, bebidas, entre otros así podrá ver crecer su negocio y María Paula le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Paula, fifty-five years old, lives with her three daughters in a semi-urban area of the country.  She has a tortilla stand and a small store in her home.  Her businesses are visited often by local people, since María always has what they need.  She keeps her store very well-stocked and the tortillas are hot and delicious, all at a truly accessible price.  María is always ready for the work; for her, nothing is impossible, and she always finds suitable ways to succeed.  This is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to purchase wholesale corn, sweets, staple grains, instant products, drinks, and other items so that she will be able to grow her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn, sweets, staple grains, instant products, drinks

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 33 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana de José Leonardo Ortiz que pertnence a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad comercial y transporte público.

Carmen conuna experiencia de 3 años viene preparando y vendiendo desayunos en el mercado Modelo, cuenta con su clientela que la mayor parte son los mismos trabajadores de la zona, con sus ingresos podrá solventar sus obligaciones de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para compra de cocina industrial y utensilios necesarios para seguir realizando la misma actividad, satisfaciendo la necesidad de sus clientes.  Carmen es una mujer alegre que con esfuerzo y trabajo saca adelante a su familia y trata de brindarles otras oportunidades académicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 33 years old. She lives with her family in her own house. The house has all the basic services and is located in the urban area of José Leonardo Ortiz, in the the province of Chiclayo. This area is dedicated to commercial activities and public transportation.

Carmen has 3 years experience in preparing and selling breakfast in the Modelo market. She depends on her customers who work locally and her revenues to cover her household expenses. 

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy an industrial cooker and kitchen utensils. which she needs to continue in the same business, satisfying the needs of her customers. Carmen is a cheerful woman who with effort and hard work supports her famliy and tries to provide her children with other educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy an industrial cooker and kitchen utensils for her food stall.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru:
Акмал добросовестный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 1 ребёнка. Акмал любит свою семью и старается, обеспечит и содержит в хороших условиях жизни. Он начал свой бизнес с продажей мелочевки, а потом постепенно перешел на продажу  тканей и одежду.  Более 5 лет он занимается торговлей и у него богатый опыт. Акмал хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента тканей и одежду. Он заранее благодарен вам всем за вашу доброту!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Akmal is a conscientious and honest person.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  Akmal loves his family and tries to provide and support them living in good conditions.  He started his business with the sales of small items and then transitioned into sales of fabrics and clothing.  He has been involved in retail sales for over five years and has a rich experience.  Akmal wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of new assortment of fabrics and clothing.  He thanks all of you in advance for your kindness!

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Marta Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Marta se dedica a la venta de abarrotaría desde hace 3 años, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación en donde vende arroz, frijoles, maíz, frescos, jugos, leche, embutidos, jabón y todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar. Sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
el credito lo utizara para invertirlo en la compra de mas abarrotería ya que necesita surtir su negocio. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca cada dia y tener muchos prodcutos para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Marta has made her living for the past 3 years selling groceries.  She has a small grocer's store in her home.  She sells rice, beans, corn, sodas, juices, milk, cold cuts, soap and everything to do with a family's basic grocery needs.  Her customers are the friends and neighbors who live in her community.
The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of additional groceries, since Señora Marta needs to stock up her business.  She hopes to see her business grow each day and to have sufficient products for sale to be able to better serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, milk, juices, sodas, beans, rice, bread, coffee, margarine, lard and oils.

loans.name: Karoline

texts.fr:
Madame KAROLINE est une femme mariée de 37 ans, qui vit dans une famille nucléaire à Ouéléssébougou.
KAROLINE quitta l’école très tôt pour des raisons de mariage, afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, elle  intégra le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour entreprendre la vente de boissons de façon ambulante.
Après quatre prêts tous bien remboursés, elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel, qu’elle  compte utiliser pour acheter et se constituer un stock important de boissons pour une longue période sans rupture.
Elle est approvisionnée sur place par  livraison de son fournisseur et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  cent dix milles (110.000)  qu’elle utilisera pour le paiement de ses échéances et subvenir à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
Madame KAROLINE ambitionne dans les jours à venir, avec l’appui de Soro Yiriwaso être un dépositaire de boissons pour faire la vente en gros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karoline is a married 37-year-old woman with five children who lives in Ouéléssébougou with her husband and children.  She left school very early to get married, and in order to contribute economically, she is participating in Soro Yiriwaso's credit program in order to sell soft drinks on the street.

After four loans which were all repaid, she is on her fifth individual loan, which she plans to use to buy and build up a large stock of soft drinks to last a long period of time.  She buys her stock locally through delivery from the supplier and hopes to make an average monthly profit of one hundred and ten thousand (110,000) FCFA, which she will use to pay her bills and daily expenses.

Mrs. Karoline hopes, with the support of Soro Yiriwaso, to one day be a bulk seller of soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Fraternidad Prospera, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui, parroquia que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, su estructura es un pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

Doña Rosa tiene 52 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, solo uno es casado e independiente, sus cuatro hijos solteros trabajan solo para sus gastos personales. Su esposo es comerciante, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica al comercio de sombreros, gorras, bisutería, frutas y todo lo que este es temporada, lleva en este negocio 20 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros, gorras, bisutería y más mercadería.
 
Su meta es comprar un vehículo para trasladarse con su mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Fraternidad Prospera Communal Bank.  She lives south of the city of Cuenca, in Tarqui Parish, which is organized as a small urban community of irregular design with houses of adobe, wattle and daub, and tile roofs, and that preserves its vernacular and traditional architecture.  The people work in livestock and agriculture, and are known for being friendly and charismatic.

Rosa, 52, is married and has five adult children from her marriage.  Only one child is married and independent.  Her four single children work only for their personal expenses.  Her husband is a businessman.  The house they live in is their own.

Rosa sells hats, caps, costume jewelry, fruit, and everything that is in season.  She has been working in this business for 20 years and works every day without a set schedule.

This is her first loan with the communal bank and she's going to use it to buy hats, caps, costume jewelry, and other merchandise.
 
Her goal is to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy hats, caps, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en: Bryan is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with two children. Bryan is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Bryan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bryan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Cándido Rafael

texts.es: Cándido se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de almohadas al por mayor y de contado  Él es un hombre casado y tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 2 a 22 años de edad, con los que sueña ver   exitosos y esto es lo que estimula su día a día de trabajo. Desde el año 1989 inició junto a su esposa, este negocio  con una sola máquina de coser doméstica; gradualmente fue comprando otras dos más, con recursos propios y algún dinero prestado. En este negocio trabajan dos hijas también en el proceso de fabricación. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes  en el proceso productivo y los fines de semana  es su actividad comercial, porque él mismo sale a vender los productos puerta a puerta. Su mercado está ubicado en la ciudad de Barranquilla y en el municipio de Soledad, pero también viaja a diversas poblaciones del departamento del Atlántico, donde ya son reconocidas sus almohadas. Las ventas las realiza de contado, pero diariamente ve crecer su mercado, por eso requiere un mayor capital de trabajo para responder a esta necesidad y ofrecer precios competitivos, producto de las compras de contado y en mayor volumen. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva con el cual comprará espumas, hilos, telas y otros materiales para aumentar su producción.
texts.en: Cándido works making and selling pillows wholesale and retail. He is a married man and has 6 children aged 2 to 22. He dreams of seeing them become successful and this is what drives him every day at his job. He started this business with his wife in 1989 with just one household sewing machine. Gradually he bought two more with his own resources and some loans. His two daughters also work in the manufacturing process. His work schedule is Monday through Friday in production and weekends he does the comercial activity, because he sells door to door. His market is located in the city of Barranquilla and in the city of Soledad, but he also travels to different towns in the department of Atlántico, where his pillows are well known. He charges upfront but every day his demand goes up and he needs more working capital to respond and offer competitive prices in more volume. At present, he is using his first Kiva loan to buy foam, thread, and other materials to increase production.

loans.use: to buy foam, thread, straps and other materials to increase production.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem and her husband, Vit, live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1999 and have five children-one son and four daughters. All of them are in school.  

Chem is a garment worker, while her husband raises pigs at home. She is applying for a loan of $500 to assist in her husband’s pig farming business by buying pig feed.

loans.use: To assist buy pig feed.

loans.name: United Farmers S H G Group

texts.en:
Richard takes care of ten children at home with his wife. In the recent 2011 season, Richard had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Richard was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices. With income from maize sales, Richard will educate his children and build a house.

Richard is the facilitator of the United Farmers SHG group. As with the majority of people in this part of Kenya, Richard and his group members are farmers who rely on maize for income and food security. Richard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of United Farmers SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. In the photograph above, Richard is pictured with his group members. The field officer is standing on the left side of the photo. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Richard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 59 years old, married, and a father of three children. He owns and has been running a green grocery business in Mombasa for the last 10 years, and with this business he receives an income of KES 10, 000 in a month.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, after paying back the previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of vegetables, onions and tomatoes in order to satisfy his customers.

He will save the anticipated profits and pay back the loan. He hopes to grow his business and open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Neangtouch

texts.en:
Neangtouch is a 49-year-old mother, divorced with two children; one of them is dependent and still in school.  She lives in a small thatched roof house in a rural area where rice farming is common.  She has been farming for more than 30 years for her main source of income and supplements her income by planting cassava and sometimes works for others to raise additional income. 

Neangtouch is the second cycled client who earns less than three U.S. dollars per day. She successfully paid back her first loan to VisionFund.  After the loan she has enough regular income to send her children to school.  Now requesting another loan, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer and plant cassava for her farm.  She hopes this loan will enable her to earn better income to set aside some money to buy a zinc roof for her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plant cassava on her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en: Chanthoeurn, 24, is married, resides with her husband and a kid in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working as garment workers for three years. Due to less income, Chanthoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi when he is free from his work at the factory to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop at home and send her kids to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, de 60 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos. Lleva 20 años de ser comerciante tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación además de vender mercadería en general, puso este  negocio con capital propio y con ayuda de financiamientos que ha sido claves para su crecimiento. Anteriormente trabajo durante 15 años atendiendo una farmacia. 
Ella realizo el préstamo para compra de granos básicos, productos de limpieza, sopas, enlatados, aceite. La inversión en este tipo de inventario es de suma importancia pues son productos muy solicitados por sus clientes. Uno de sus planes es comprar un freezer pues desea vender pollo y carnes.
texts.en:
María, age 60, lives in the city of León. She is a merchant. She is a single mother with 3 children. For 20 years she has had a shop in her house selling general merchandise. She started this business with her own capital and with financial help that has been the key to its growth. Previously, she worked for 15 years in a pharmacy.

She wants the loan in order to purchase basic grains, cleaning products, soaps, canned goods, and cooking oil. The investment in this type of inventory is of great importance since they are products much sought after by her customers. One of her plans is to buy a freezer since she wants to sell chicken and meat.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, cleaning products, soaps, canned goods, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión está formado por 9 socias quienes son mujeres emprendedoras, luchadoras y muy trabajadoras ganándose el pan de cada día con su esfuerzo, así han logrado sacar a su familia adelante y ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, parroquia de grandes pastos  y de fincas ganaderas, modernas construcciones y el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional. Su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Jessica, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es maestro albañil y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, la casa en la que vive es propiedad de sus padres.
 
La Señorita. Jessica ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa pero también se dedica a la cría de animales como pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad. También labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su consumo y para la venta.

Se encuentra en el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos.
 
Su meta es seguir los estudios Universitarios y llegar a ser profesional.

Los niños que se encuentran en la fotografía son hijos de algunas de las socias.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ilusión” (New Hope) communal bank is composed of nine members who are enterprising, tenacious, very hardworking women earning their daily bread through their efforts and raising their families this way offering them a better future.  They live in Cusco’s Cumbe Parish, a parish of vast grasslands and cattle ranches, modern constructions and the charm of traditional architecture.  Its residents are kind and preserve the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the group members is Jessica, 20.  She’s single and lives with her parents.  Her father is a master bricklayer and her mother does housework.  The house she lives in belongs to her parents.
