This will be Hillary's first loan in KADET and he plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. He plans to raise his family's standard of living with the profit he is going to get. In future he wants to expand his farming business and educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Cheikh Ibra Fall Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CHEIKH IBRA FALL est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 13 femmes d'un même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. 

Madame KHADY M., debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo, vêtue de grand boubou blanc parsemé de points noirs est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle a adopté une orpheline de 04 ans. 

Elle est vendeuse de tissus et de chaussures. Elle s'approvisionne en Gambie et en Mauritanie. Elle mène cette activité depuis 1996.

Avec son crédit elle va acheter des tissus en basin et Khartoum des écharpes et des chaussures. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et participer à la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The Cheikh Ibra Fall solidarity group was created on 5th December 2007. It is made up of 13 women from the same neighborhood, who are neighbors and/or friends. Mrs. Khady M., who is on the extreme right of the photo and dressed in a large white "boubou" (African dress) sprinkled with black dots, is in charge of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to five children. She has also adopted a four-year old orphan. She sells fabrics and shoes. She gets her supplies in Gambia and Mauritania. She has been carrying out this business since 1996. With her new loan she is going to buy damask and "khartoum" fabrics, scarves and shoes. Her aim is to increase her savings and contribute to the costs of looking after her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and fabrics

loans.name: Ruth

texts.fr: K. Ruth est née en 1971 à Cotonou et est mariée à HOUNSOU Nicolas, un forgeron. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a quatorze ans environs que Ruth s'est installée avec sa famille à PK11, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Ruth subvient ensemble avec son mari aux différents besoins de ses enfants. Ruth a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Ruth vend des boissons et des tissus à Sèmè-Podji, ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses charges. Ruth achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ruth désire élever un peu plus le niveau de son activité et mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose pour atteindre son objectif, Ruth sollicite pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Ruth K. was born in Cotonou and is married to Nicolas Hounsou, a blacksmith. The couple have four children all of whom attend school. About 14 years ago Ruth settled with her family at PK11, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. Ruth and her husband provide for the various needs of their children together. Ruth left school at secondary level. For the last ten years, she has been selling beverages and fabric at Sèmè-Podji, this allows her to cope with her expenses. Ruth buys her stock at Dantokpa, the Benin international market. She would like to develop her activity and better satisfy her customers' demands . In view of the inadequate means at her disposal for achieving her objective, Ruth is requesting for the second time, the financial support of ALIDé.The first loan was repaid correctly.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beverages and fabric

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns and operates a specialized retail store selling fish and shrimp in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Janet joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Janet is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan L. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Jargalsaihan's two daughters attend a local high school. His wife works as a maid in the school. 

Jargalsaihan operates a successful transportation service using his truck. He has been engaged this business since 2009, transporting loads to destinations between Bars and Narantuul. Both are very popular and large markets in Ulaanbaatar. His monthly average income is 780,000 MNT. For the future, he wishes to provide higher education for his daughters. 

Jargalsaihan is a very hardworking man and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan both to purchase spare parts for his van and do some construction on his home.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the van he uses to provide service

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
L. señora Mercedes es socia del Bancomunal Arrieros, tiene 32 años, 2 hijos D. 14 y 11 años D. edada, los cuales están estudiando, el primero esta en cuarto año D. secundaria y L. ùltima esta en sexto grado D. primaria. Mercedes se dedica a L. venta D. quesos y carne D. cordero, estos productos lo reparte a sus clientes, quienes le pagan D. manera mensual; también se ayuda vendiendo papa rellena en el Colegio Froebel y tambien venD. ropa.
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha invertir en L. compra D. ropas variadas para venderlas en las Comunidades D. Muyurina y Chacco. Anteriormente, del 2002 al 2007, vendía en un cafetín escolar pero por motivos que le subieron el alquiler del local y no había mucha venta decidió cambiar D. negocio. 
Afortunadamente Mercedes no ha tenido dificultades en los negocios que tiene actualmente porque sus clientes son puntuales en lo pagos. Mercedes se siente muy contenta D. ser socia D. Finca Perú ya que gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió como ahorrar y a ser puntual en sus actividades cotidianas. su sueño es tener una casa propia y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes is a member of the community bank Arrieros (Muleteers). She is 32 year old and has two children, ages 14 and 11, who are in school. The older is in the 4th year of secondary school, and the younger is in the sixth graD. of primary school. Mercedes sells cheese and lamb meat, which she splits up among her customers, who pay her monthly. She also helps herself by selling stuffed potatoes at the Froebel School, and in addition she sells clothing.

She will invest the loan that she is applying for in the purchase of a variety of clothing to sell in the communities of Muyurina and Chacco. In the past, from 2002 to 2007, she sold food in a school cafeteria, but because they raised her rent and she didn't have many sales, she decided to change her business. Fortunately, Mercedes has not had difficulties in the businesses she has now, because her customers are punctual in their payments. Mercedes feels very happy to be a member of Finca Peru, because thanks to the training she learned how to save and be punctual in her daily activities. Her dream is to have her own house and to have her business grow.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia G. is married, lives in Sta. Catalina, Brgy. Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running three businesses: selling dried fish, bamboo and pigs that she has raised and fattened. Her husband Jaime, who is 59 years old, has his own store and also helps his wife. The couple has three children who range in age from 26 to 36 years old. 

Alicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she wanted a better life for her family. With the help of 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She has applied for a new loan, for PHP 17,000, to buy more dried fish and bamboo to sell to her customers. Her goals are to continue to expand her businesses and help her children. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and bamboo to sell to her customers

loans.name: 16-01-03-Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
Hang T. T. (23) is a 25 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hang is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03-Dong Hai (16-01-03-Dong Hai).

Hang is married and has one small child. To making a living, Hang owns a business harvesting and selling river-caught fish.  She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3200000 VND a month.

In 2008, Hang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. The loan will be the 20th she has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Hanh (35) is a 47 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her service business. 

2.  T. T. Hai (40) is a 58 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  D. T. Hong (37) is a 36 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hang T. T. (23) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hang là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03-Dong Hai (16-01-03-Dong Hai).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở sông trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hang thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hang kiếm được khoảng 3200000 VND.  Vào 2008, Hang đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hang đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua cá bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 20th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  L. T. Hanh (35) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

2.  T. T. Hai (40) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  D. T. Hong (37) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Proposito 4 Group

texts.en:
Marlenis is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Unidas con Proposito 4 (Unite Women with purpose). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to attend to university. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to watch television and listen to music.

Marlenis is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She is starting her business with this loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes, shoes and accessories. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. She dreams of finishing her university, becoming a professional, and help her family and others. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she was interested in starting a business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Isatu J.. She is married and has 4 children ages 2, 5, 7, and 12 years. In 2003, Isatu established her palm oil and rice business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain herself and her family. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, Isatu earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to add stock to her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 550,000.  In the future, Isatu plans to sell her goods in neighbouring countries in order to increase her profits. She would also like to hire workers. 

Isatu is very hardworking and dedicated, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To increase stock for business

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 37 years old and married. She sells clothes to earn a living. She started the business in 2007 and has seen a lot of growth in the business since she joined Faulu Kenya. This is because of the previous 30,000 Kenyan shilling (Kes) loan from Faulu Kenya, which she used to add stock.  

She has requested another loan of 30,000 Kes to buy clothes, handbags and shoes.

loans.use: To buy clothes, handbags and shoes

loans.name: Mpara Hiv/aids Prevention And Support Group-Kyenjojo

texts.en: 45 year old B. Umaru has been involved in a timber sales business for the past 3 years in Kijwiga-Kyenjojo. He says he began this business out of personal interest. This fledgling business has been making progressive strides over the past few years. He has been running the business on the basis of his tenacity, hardwork and enterprising spirit. Umaru, who is happily married and has 8 kids, also has a cattle sales business on the side. Weekly this business generates him shillings 20,000. Most of the timber he sells is bought by individuals constructing family homes and carpenters from Kyenjojo town, some even come from as far away as Kampala. With this loan, Umaru says he is going to buy more young eucalyptus trees to plant. The plan is to be able to get more timber to resell once the trees mature.

loans.use: The purchase of young eucalyptus trees to plant.

loans.name: Tamuyusu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamuyusu” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 800,000.00 for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata B..  Fatmata is age forty-five. She was born in  Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and six children, three of whom are in primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells rice, pepper, groundnuts, palm-oil, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mention items at wholesale to improve her business.

loans.use: Buys rice, pepper, groundnuts, palm-oil, etc. at wholesale to improve her business

loans.name: Rubel Eliseo

texts.es: El señor Rubén Eliseo tiene 26 años. el se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de cyber. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de computadoras, mouse, repuestos para computadoras entre otros. Su meta es incrementar la cantidad de maquinas y obtener un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en: Rubén Eliseo, 26, has an internet service.  More than 2 years ago he started with a little capital and little by little he saved so that he had some customers.  He will use the loan to buy computers, mouse, computer stands, etc.  His goal is to increase the number of computers and have a little more profit.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda L. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Luzminda is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & detergents in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 36 años y vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Vende animales de ganado porcino y ovino desde hace 4 años y medio, animales que los adquiere de personas que tiene sus granjas en zonas rurales y los oferta cada fin de semana. De esta manera se genera ingresos semanales, los demás días de la semana opta por trabajar cuidando niños en su casa ocasionalmente cuando alguno de sus vecinos le solicita. Su madre la apoya en estas actividades y siempre esta al pendiente de vender animales en buen estado de salud  para que  los venda a buen precio, este negocio es rentable y más cuando es en época de festividades por lo que el deseo de Angélica es el de seguir vendiendo animales y tener más capital de trabajo. Es la oportunidad número 17 que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, lo ha demostrado durante estos años con la puntualidad en sus pagos, en esta oportunidad es un crédito individual porque tiene una importante oportunidad de negocios y agradece a aquellas personas que son gestoras de su crédito. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cerdos, así como en la compra de semillas alfalfa y alimento para sus animales.
texts.en:
Angélica, 36, is a very hard working woman living with her husband and two children in her own house.  She has sold pigs and sheep for the last 4 and half years.  She gets her animals from people who have farms in rural areas and she sells them every weekend.  This is how she generates weekly income.  The rest of the days of the week she works taking care of children in her house on occasion when a neighbor asks her to do so.  Her mother helps her with these activities and she is always careful to sell animals in good health so that she can sell them for a good price.  The business is profitable; more so during festive seasons.  This is why Angélica wants to continue selling animals and to have more working capital.

This is her 17th loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has demonstrated this throughout all these years with her punctual payments.  

This time it’s an individual loan because she has an important business opportunity.  She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan.  She will use the requested loan to buy more pigs as well as alfalfa seed and feed for her animals.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, alfalfa seed and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay S., 32, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband purchases cows to resell, earning an income of $6 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cows to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 28 year-old single mother of twins. She shares two rooms with her children in Ntasen, a quarter in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon.

Stella has faced difficulties in her life, ranging from inability to meet her daily needs, increasing demands of her children, and the operation she had before their birth. Among other challenges, she also has had the difficulty of inadequate capital to expand her business. With this loan, she plans to buy more materials, buttons, thread and other materials for sewing dresses. She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly.  Thus she has many clients. Her activity will help her community by providing clothing close to home so that they won't have transportation costs and won't have to sew their own dresses.  Their cordial relationship will allow room for negotiations.

She will use a fraction of her profit to provide for the children’s school needs and meet her personal needs. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office, and the low interest rate and the installment method of paying back a loan.
ABOUT GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase materials, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania J., a 27-year-old lady, started a small home business selling clothes. She started her business three years ago. She is known to carry a fine collection that would suit most of her customers' taste. She depends on word of mouth to gain more customers. Rania applied for this loan to add a new collection of clothes and accessories to the products she sells.

loans.use: to add a new collection of clothes and accessories to the products she sells.

loans.name: Yubina Patricia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Patricia, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 14 y 13 años  de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años, es la presidenta del mismo  y le gusta porque todas sus compañeras son personas muy responsables y ordenadas.

Tiene un mini bazar en su casa en el cual vende una gran variedad de productos, tanto para regalos como para el hogar, además de ropa, zapatos y perfumes. Los fines de semana y feriados instalan un pequeño comedor aprovechando que su casa está frente al mar y como estas playas son muy visitadas en feriados y fines de semana  sus ventas están aseguradas, nos cuenta que el plato preferido por sus clientes son los mariscos en especial el pescado apanado con ensalada y patacones. Lleva 8 años que se dedica a sus negocios.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz,  pescado, platanos verdes, carne y otros ingredientes para preparar los alimentos, así como también ropa que le hace falta en su bazar.
 
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
In the district of Crucita in the region of Portoviejo we find a place known as Los Arenales. It is where the members of the communal bank named "Faith and Hope" meet every two weeks. It is known for its beautiful beaches, its food, and the welcoming population. 


Here we meet Patricia. She is 34 years old, married, and she has three children from her marriage, aged 15, 14, and 13 years old. They are in school. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been with her communal bank for 4 years and she is the president of the group. She enjoys it because all of her colleagues are very responsible and organized individuals.

She has a small general store from where she sells a wide variety of products, including gifts, items for the home, clothing, shoes, and perfumes. One the weekends and on holidays she sets up a small restaurant, taking advantage of the fact that her house is beside the ocean and since the beaches are very popular on holidays and on weekends, her sales are always guaranteed. She says that her clients' favored menu item is seafood, especially fried fish with a side salad and bananas. She has had her businesses for 8 years.

This loan is to purchase rice, fish, green bananas, meats and other ingredients to prepare foods. She will also purchase articles of clothing that she needs for her store.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fish, meats, green bananas, and other ingredients to prepare foods and to purchase articles of clothing.

loans.name: Reina Rocio

texts.es:
Reina está aplicando a su tercer credikiva, financiamiento con el cual surtirá su negocio con mangos, aguacates, mamones, nísperos,  y  también comprará CD. DVD MP3 y dulces con los cuales surtirá su punto de ventas. Reina se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo financiero para su negocio y pide que ojalá sigan ayudando muchos más microempresarios, ya que gracias a Kiva ella ha logrado incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades y con esta son tres ayudas. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Reina puede ingresar a los siguientes enlaces:  
http://kiva.org/lend/184971
 http://kiva.org/lend/238422
texts.en:
Reina is applying for her third Kiva loan which she will use to stock her business with mangos, avocados, papayas and loquats.  She will also buy CDs, DVDs, MP3s and candies for her sales location.  Reina feels very grateful for the financial support for her business and hopes that Kiva lenders will continue helping many more small businesspeople since, thanks to Kiva, she herself has managed to increase her sales and profits.  This is her third loan.  If you would like to know more about Reina's story, you can click on the following links:
http://kiva.org/lend/184971
http://kiva.org/lend/238422

loans.use: to stock her business with mangos, avocados, papayas, loquats and also to buy CDs, DVDs, MP3s and candies

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto de 44 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la provincia Morropón que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana.

Gilberto se dedica a la preparación y venta de harina de maíz que la utilizan para la elaboración de chicha de jora, actividad que realiza desde algunos años  y lo ofrece a sus clientes que la conocen, de esta manera se ayuda a tener más ingresos económicos, permitiendole solventar sus gasto familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar maíz para molerlo y volverlo harina para su comercialización, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos, ya que su clientela se ha incrementado, para poder pagar su crédito adquirido y de paso mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.  Gilberto desea que más adelante su negocio crezca para seguir ayudando a su familia y brindarle mejores comodidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 44, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  It does not have basic utilities and is located in Morropón Province belonging to Piura Department.  Farming, raising livestock and crafts are typical activities in the zone.

Gilberto makes corn flour to sell that’s used to make Chicha de Jora (corn based beverage).  He’s been in business for several years and sells to customers that are aware of it.  This way he helps himself have more income allowing him to meet family expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy corn to grind into flour to sell which will allow for more income because his clientele has grown, to repay the loan and at the same time improve his family’s quality of life.  Gilberto wants for later on that his business grows to continue helping his family and providing his children with more comfort.

loans.use: to buy corn to grind and sell as cornmeal.

loans.name: Shomurod

texts.ru: Шомурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 69 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Его сын уехал в России на заработки. Сам Шомурод более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Shomurod lives in Shahrituz.  He is 69 years old, married, and has four children.  His son left for Russia to work.  Shomurod has been working as a herdsman for more than twelve years. He primarily makes money breeding cattle.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to expand his herd.

Шомурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 69 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Его сын уехал в России на заработки. Сам Шомурод более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Eugenio René

texts.es: El Sr. Eugenio Rene  él es trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal de SRS desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad  tiene  tres    años de trabajar para esta institución es casado  actualmente. Ha obtenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Eugenio René is an active employee of the town of San Rafael del Sur, where he has worked as a security guard for three years. He is currently married. Eugenio has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, and other supplies for expanding and improving his home.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit and have allowed him to improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, stone, gravel, and other supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoem has been in the crop-planting business for years. She plants various crops and normally generates an income of 2.5 per day. Her husband is a used-goods buyer. He buys all kinds of secondhand goods from villagers in rural areas who want to sell their old things. Then he sells them to generate income. This couple has been married for years and has six children. All of the children are teenagers; one of them is employed as a domestic garment worker. Mrs. Chhoem will use her Kiva loan to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 41 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Gulu region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Harriet has had a bar business for three years. She sells clothes as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soda and beer for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Harriet hopes to open up a garment shop.  Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to meet her target.

loans.use: to purchase soda and beer to sell

loans.name: Mardonia

texts.es: Mardonia de 37 años, es muy laboriosa y atenta, ella vive en la casa de su mamá Alejandrina de 67 años, a quien cuida, también vive con 4 hermanas y dos sobrinas en la localidad de Huaracayo. Lleva 8 años dedicados a la venta de productos comestibles en un espacio disponible de la casa de sus padres, además siembra maíz, arveja, papa y cebada en sus terrenos propios, con la ayuda de peones que le ayudan en la faena diaria. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es atender a las personas que visitan su tienda desde tempranas horas de la mañana, pues ella es la primera en atender por su zona, por eso es la bodega más preferida por los vecinos. Como su trabajo es rentable y le permite cubrir sus gastos desea ampliar su tienda con más cantidad de productos alimenticios, que solicitan sus conocidos, sabe que le irá muy bien. Asimismo con la ayuda de una de sus hermanas planea instalar un centro comercial en un local alquilado en la ciudad de Tarma, que le permitirá recibir más utilidades. Este es el undécimo crédito que tiene con MFP y en todo este tiempo aprendió a valorar  el esfuerzo del trabajo arduo, además promete pagar puntualmente cada pago. Mardonia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono, mientras el resto de las utilidades las dispondrá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en: Mardonia is 37 years old and is very hardworking and considerate.  She lives with her 67-year-old mother, Alejandrina, and cares for her.  She also lives with four sisters and two nieces in Huaracayo.  She has worked selling food items for eight years in a spare area of her parent’s house.  She also grows corn, peas, potatoes and barley on land she owns and contracts laborers to help her with the daily tasks.  What she likes most about her job is tending to the people who visit her store early.  Her store is the first to open in the area, which is why her neighbors prefer it.  Since her work is profitable and allows her to cover her expenses, she wants to expand her store with more food products requested by her customers and knows that she will do well.  In addition, she also plans to set up a shopping area in a rented space in Tarma with the help of her sister so that she can have higher profits.  This is her eleventh loan with MFP and during this time, she has learned to value hard work.  She promises to make each payment on time.  Upon receiving the loan, Mardonia will invest the money requested in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds and several sacks of manure, while she will use the rest to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds and several sacks of manure.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ariunbold is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He drives a taxi and has been running it since 2007. And his wife has been working as a hotel organizer for many years. This family owns a small-sized plot of land and a house. 

Recently he decided to build a house with 6-8 rooms inside his fence to rent out to others. One room's price will be USD20-25 a day. It is absolutely beneficial for his family income. If he can manage it, his income is going to increase rapidly. Maybe he could start to gain a return from renting after year or an even shorter period.  But he needs additional funding for it.  

Therefore Ariunbold requested a loan to use as additional funding to build his rental house. Before this, he took out a loan from another source and was able to repay successfully on time.

loans.use: To use as additional funding to build his rental house.

loans.name: Santos Tomas

texts.es:
el sr. Santos tiene 41 años de edad y se dedica al cultivo de café,  tiene una experiencia de 20 años de cumplir  con esa  labor  ya  que  este a sido su trabajo y le ayuda a cubrir las necesidades que tiene en su  hogar, el vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. 
El Sr. Santos utilizara el credito para la compra de una planta de energía solar, el a notado que esta seria de mucha utilidad  para él y su familia por que en la zona donde el vive no cuentan con el servicio primordial para  todas las viviendas del país, y así  poder cambiar totalmente la imagen de su vivienda y sus condiciones de vida. 
ahora podra tener un televisor y podra comprar un celular para comunicarse con sus familiares.
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old, and he is a farmer who cultivates coffee.  He has 20 years of experience in this line of work; this work has allowed him to pay for  the household necessities.  He lives with his wife and their 3 children.

Santos will use this loan to buy solar energy equipment.  He notes that this would be very useful for him and his family, because in the area where he lives they lack the primary utilities that many homes have in his country.  Having solar power will totally change his house and living conditions.  Now, he will be able to have a television and a cellular phone that he can use to communicate with his family.

loans.use: to buy solar power equipment for his home

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a hard-working business lady aged 21 and the single mother of one. For the last two years, she has been operating a business selling clothes to make a living. She has witnessed a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
Norma Betulia es una joven de 23 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos, es una persona amable y muy servicial, reside en el barrio Las Brisas en el municipio de Silca y se dedica a la venta de golosinas.

Hace cuatro años atras Norma recibió su titulo de educacion secundaria y al no encontrar trabajo decidió dedicarse a la venta de golosinas ya que su madre le enseñó a cocinar muy bien. Su horario de atencion inicia a las 6:00 pm y culmina a las 9:00 pm y los fines de semana termina un poco mas tarde, y mientras ella atiende su negocio le ayuda a cuidar a sus dos pequeños hijos. Su mayor reto era encontrar una institucion que la apoyara con un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio pero por su edad y bajo perfil crediticio ninguna le otorgado un prestamo hasta FAMA creyó en ella y en el potencial de su negocio.

El prestamo que Norma solicita lo necesita para la compra de carnes, verduras, harina, salsas, condimentos, refrescos, frijoles, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo ella podra satisfacer la demanda de sus golosinas y eso le dara mayores ganancias.

Su meta en instalar una pequeña cafeteria porque actualmente vende al frente de su casa. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Norma Betulia is a young woman of 23.  She is married and has two children.  Norma is a kind and very helpful person.  She lives in Las Brisas neighborhood, in the town of Silca.  Her business is selling sweet treats.

Four years ago, Norma received her high school diploma and, as she couldn't find work, she decided to start selling sweet treats as her mother taught her how to cook very well.  She starts serving her customers at 6.00pm and finishes at 9.00pm.  On weekends she finishes a little later.  While she is serving in her business, she helps take care of her two young children.  Her biggest challenge was to find an institution who would support her with a loan to invest in her business.  Owing to her age and her low credit rating, no institution would give her a loan until FAMA believed in her and in the potential of her business.

Norma needs the loan that she has requested to buy meat, vegetables, flour, sauces, seasonings, soft drinks, beans and other products.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to satisfy demand for her sweet treats and this will make her more profits.

Norma's goal is to set up a small café because she currently sells her products in front of her home.  This is her first loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and soft drinks

loans.name: Pork

texts.en:
Mrs. Pork, from Reussey Keo commune, is a 27-year-old married woman. She is in the business of making clothes for both men and women. She has been engaged in this job since 2008. There are many customers who come to her shop to have her adjust, repair and make clothes every day. With her skill in clothes making, she can earn around 3 USD per day for their household expenses. Mrs. Pork is married with two children who are both still single. Her husband works as a construction supervisor in a mobile place.

Mrs. Pork would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva in order to support her husband's business. She wants to use this fund to purchase construction materials. This is her third loan with Kiva. With the previous loans, Mrs. Pork repaid punctually and successfully.

In the future, she hopes that she will be able to provide her two children with great opportunities to attend the university.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor estudiará una especialización en derecho de empresas, por lo cual solicitó el crédito. Espera coronar su carrera y terminar de estudiar la especialización. En un futuro se ve con su familia establecida y ejerciendo su carrera de abogado, lo motivan a seguir adelante los consejos de su mamá para que siempre luchara por ser alguien en la vida. Los ingresos no le permiten poder pagar la especialización de una sola vez, pero espera con este crédito poder salir adelante
texts.en: Victor is asking for a loan to study an area of corporate law. He hopes to cap his career and finish studying this area of specialisation. In the future he sees himself with a family established and practising his legal career as a lawyer. His mother's advice motivates him to get ahead and it is for her that he always strives to be someone in life. His income is not enough for him to be able to pay his fees in one go, but he hopes that with this loan he will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for the course fees.

loans.name: Gandaria 6 Group

texts.en: Puji is 32 years old and married with two children. Her husband works as an employee. Her husband's income can feed the family, but now she has a six month new born baby. She wants to have more income to buy milk for her baby. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. With this loan she wants to start producing and selling nasi uduk (Indonesian rice dish). She hopes by doing this business she can still take care of her baby and get more income. She hopes this business will grow and she can save for her children's education. Other group members will use their loans to help their businesses which include selling fried bananas and selling clothes on credit.

loans.use: to pay for rice, tofu, tempe [a soy product], and vegetables.

loans.name: Nepeita

texts.en:
Nepeita is a very hardworking woman who practices farming. She has been farming for over 3 years. She is 28 years old and married with one child.

Nepeita is a good client. She repaid her first loan well and applied for her second loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a 31-year-old married man with two children who attend school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. He owns a house, which does not have electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Mwero has operated a retail shop for the past three years. His customers are the local villagers. He faces a major challenge of transport. With a loan of KES 25,000, he wants to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and soap for his shop. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future. He decided to join Yehu to access loans so he can expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and soap for his shop.

loans.name: Chantrea

texts.en: Chantrea, 23, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a traditional basket maker and her husband rents the threshing machine to generate income to support the family. Chantrea has requested a loan of USD 600 to purchase a ploughing machine to plough her own rice field and rental rice fields.  In the future, she would like to run a new business of rice trading and build a new toilet.

loans.use: to purchase a ploughing machine to plough her own rice field and rental rice fields.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз женщина 31 года, замужем имеет троих детей, муж работает мастером электриком на частные заказы. Дилафруз кредитуется уже второй год и она берёт кредиты на увеличение бизнеса. Она продаёт нижнее женское бельё. Товар привозит из Истаравшана и закупает у местных оптовиков. У неё очень большой разнообразный ассортимент, и поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Следующий займ, она хочет использовать на завоз зимних колгот и других женских товаров.  Она благодарна организации за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a 31 year-old woman, who is married and has three children.  Her husband works as an electrician as a private contractor.  Dilafruz has been obtaining financing for the second year now and takes out loans for business expansion.  She sells women's undergarments.  She brings her merchandise from Istaravshan and buys it from local wholesalers.  Dilafruz has a wide selection of merchandise and, thus, has regular customers.  She wants to use this loan to bring in winter tights and other women's goods.  She is grateful to the organization for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to purchase women's winter tights

loans.name: Dina Esperanza

texts.es: Dina Esperanza de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive con sus padres en casa propia. Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia en el cual confecciona prendas de vestir para toda  ocasión, pero en especial vestidos tradicionales, se ha hecho de mucha más clientela últimamente pues su trabajo es  excelente, además que utiliza material de muy buena calidad y vende a precios accesibles, en esta época navideña quiere aumentar su producción y obtener mejores ganancias en el negocio; Dina es una mujer muy entregada a su labor siempre está dispuesta a superarse y mantenerse adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que las personas no se pueden poner ningún límite, ya que no hay nada imposible para el que se esfuerza para lograr el triunfo, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor. Dina Esperanza tiene fe que así podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Dina Esperanza is 51 years old and lives with her parents in their own house. 

She owns a dressmaking workshop in their home in which she makes clothing for all occasions, but particularly traditional dress. She has recently got a lot of customers because her work is excellent and she uses good quality materials, her prices are also accessible. 

In this Christmas season, she wants to raise her production levels and obtain better earnings from the business. 

Dina is a woman who us very dedicated to her work and allows wants to overcome and stay ahead of her competition. She believes that people shouldn't limit themselves as nothing is impossible and with hard-work we can triumph. 

This is why she has asked INTEGRAL for a loan so that she can buy wholesale fabric. Dina Esperanza has faith that in this way she will be able to bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar  tiene 25 años de edad, él vive en la Tinguiña, ubicadao en el departamento de Ica Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente; como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Julio Cesar  es la "Carapulca". Julio es Técnico en Computación, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Medicina  Veterinaria.

Julio  actualmente es conductor de taxi , se dedica a este trabajo 8 horas diarias, en un día puede atender 30 clientes y esto le permite ganar  hasta S/. 70 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.90 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales y para  invertir en el negocio, el cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es muy educado y amable con los clientes y sobre todo muy honesto. 

Actualmente está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda proporcionada va poder realizar mantenimiento a su vehículo, con esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener un auto en buenas condiciones y los clientes se sientan seguros en su vehículo,  con ello tendrá mas ingresos y así seguirá ahorrando para comprarse un auto y poder realizar su gran sueño:” Trabajar en su carrera de Computación”
texts.en:
Julio César, 25, lives in La Tinguiña, located in the department of Ica, Peru.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country, and is acclaimed by Peruvians as The Land of the Sun.  It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and 6.9 in 2011), grape production, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps above all as the source of the traditional national beverage of Peru, pisco.  As is well known, Peru is known for having the most delicious food in the world, and one of the dishes that Julio César likes is "carapulca" [chicken with potatoes and peanuts].

In this warm and arid climate are his house and business.   Julio is a computer technician, but he would have liked to study veterinary medicine.

Currently Julio is a taxi driver.  He works at this job eight hours a day.  In one day he can serve 30 customers, and this allows him to earn up to 70 PEN daily, and in a good day he can earn up to 90, which helps him pay some additional household expenses and invest in the business.  He believes that it is going well for him in his job because he is very polite and pleasant with the customers and, above all, very honest.

Currently he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help offered he is going to be able to do maintenance on his vehicle.  This improvement will be able to help him have a car in good condition, and the customers will feel safe in his car.  With this he will have more income and so he will continue saving to buy himself a car and be able to realize his big dream, to work in his field of computing.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace wants to buy more quantity and varieties of mangoes, avocados, apples, bananas, oranges, and passion fruits.

loans.name: Amé

texts.en:
At 47, Madame G. Ame is married and the mother of seven children. Despite not having any formal schooling, she has launched into the business of grains and traditional soaps. She has a natural feel for business and takes advantage of business opportunities as they arise, and wishes to expand her business activities outside her neighborhood in order to increase her earnings. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan of $800.00 so that she can travel to different grain production zones and search for more better bargains.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 47 ans, Madame G. Amé est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. N’ayant aucun cursus scolaire, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréale et des savons traditionnels. Ayant pris du goût à l’identification des occasions entreprenariales suite aux multiples formations en matière de renforcement de capacité, elle a voulu à tout prix mener ses activités aussi au-delà de la localité afin d’améliorer ses revenus. Voilà pourquoi elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 pour aller jusque dans les zones de production des céréales et s’approvisionner à des coûts mieux rentables.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of grains.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida A. fled to Baku from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan in 1993. She is married, with two children. She started her sewing business in 1998 with two loans totaling $1000. She currently needs a new loan of $1000 in order to buy new equipment for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy modern equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in beverages and clothing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 34 years old and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Maria makes table clothes, shawls, napkins and cushions. She also buys some of the handicrafts from the women in her community and exhibits them at a place in the community of Nachig, along the international highway. She is a part of the group Merced 1. With the loan, she hopes to buy more thread and fabric to embroider, so there's more merchandise from the artisans of her community and more variety to sell.

MARIA, tiene 34 años, 5 hijos, su esposo es campesino. Ella se dedica a confeccionar manteles, chales, servilletas, cojines y también le compra algunas artesanías a las mujeres de su comunidad y posteriormente exhibe en un local que tiene en la comunidad de Nachig a orillas de la carretera internacional. Pertenece al grupo Merced 1 , con el préstamo espera comprar mas tela e hilos para bordar así como también mas mercadería a las artesanas de su comunidad para poder tener mas variedad que vender en sus local .

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira is the mother of 4 children, all of whom have moved far away with their own families in search of better opportunities. She raised them all with a good education and good values.

Now she lives in her small home with her husband and lifetime companion. She works independently after losing her job just a few years before she had enough years for any retirement benefits. Elvira doesn't let these problems bring her down, always making an effort to improve her situation. Proof of this is the small shop/restaurant she opened. She had the necessary space and fortitude to be able to contribute to the monthly costs.

Thanks to her charisma and her growing customers, she now needs to expand the stock she offers in her small shop, buying more everyday household items and regional products which she also sells after her customers suggested it.

Let's help this couple maintain their well being, as they stay together and manage through adversity.

Elvira es madre de 4 hijos que se encuentran fuera de su hogar porque habiendo alcanzado su madurez y teniendo que velar por sus propias familias han decidido migrar fuera para otorgarles bienestar a sus nuevos miembros gracias a la educación y las buenas costumbres que ella les impartió desde muy pequeños.

Ahora sólo habita su pequeña morada en compañía de su único y gran compañero que se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente y a brindar servicios públicos de transporte en su unidad, ya que perdió el trabajo hace poco faltando un par de años para cumplir el tiempo necesario para jubilarse; a pesar de las adversidades por las que pasó ella no permitió que los problemas lo derroten y permaneció siempre a su lado dándole mucha fuerza, prueba de ello es el empeño que puso en aperturar una bodega para aplacar los sinsabores de este infortunado acontecimiento ya que tenía el espacio suficiente y las fuerzas necesarias para contribuir con los gastos familiares. Debido al carisma con el que cuenta y a la concurrencia masiva de su clientela, se encuentra en la necesidad de poder aumentar los artículos de su pequeña bodeguita comprando más abarrotes y productos regionales que también vende gracias a las sugerencias de su público. Colaboremos con esta pareja de esposos que tratan de permanecer juntos a pesar de las adversidades para seguir brindándose compañía y bienestar

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO EXPAND THE STOCK OF MERCHANDISE SHE CARRIES IN HER SMALL SHOP/CAFE, AND IMPROVE HER SALES.

loans.name: Yannette

texts.es:
Yanette needed to move away from her exhusband and decided that it was time to go on her own and filed for divorce. "Being divorced has forced me to look for work", comments Yanette. She started to look for work but the money that she earned was not enough to to support her three children and it was not enough to send them to school. After work Yanette started selling fried foods from her home with only one small table and a few little bags of fried foods with salsa, and she started to makes some sales. Today she has more variety in her products but she it's still a daily struggle to establish her business.

Yanette is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 US to be repaid in a term of 5 months. With this loan Yanette will be able to purchase a larger table and add to her sales merchandise so that her clients will have more choice. With your help Yanette will be able to support her children without having to depend on her exhusband.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Yannette no aguantó vivir con su ahora ex esposo y decidió que era momento de seguir por su cuenta por lo tanto se divorció “El estar divorciada me obligo atener que buscar trabajo”, comenta Yannette Así fue que comenzó a buscar trabajo, pero el dinero que ganaba no era suficiente como para poder mantener a sus tres hijos quienes necesitan de dinero para poder estudiar. Fue por eso que después de trabajar Yannette comenzó a vender frituras afuera de su casa, tansolo con una pequeña mesa y unas cuantas bolsitas de frituras con una salsa comenzó a vender y los clientes a llegar. Actualmente ya tiene más surtido de frituras sin embargo la lucha continúa por establecer su negocio.

Por lo tanto Yannette está solicitando un crédito de US $325 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Yannette podrá comprar una mesa más grande y surtir de más mercancía su negocio para que sus clientes tengan de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda Yannette podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos sin la necesidad de su ex esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and a larger table where to display her products.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Señor Antonio G. is married to Seferina Mencia de G., and they have 3 young children.

Don Antonio makes a living repairing engines, and his wife sells charcoal out of their home. He began working repairing engines as an assistant at a company. He became independent 8 years ago after many years of work.

He is requesting the loan because he hopes to add on to his home so he can give more comfort to his family and be able to work better.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Antonio G. esta casado con la señora Seferina Mencia de G. y tienen 3 hijos menores.

Don Antonio se dedica ala rectificación de motores y la señora se dedica a la venta de carbón en su domicilio. Se inicio en el rubro de rectificación desde muy joven como ayudante en una empresa, hace ocho años que logro independizarse luego de muchos años de trabajo.

Solicita el crédito pues desea realizar una ampliación en su casa, de esta forma podrá dar mayor comodidad a su familia y podrá trabajar mejor.

loans.use: To add on to his home

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum K., 41, is a mother of five children and lives in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She works selling seasonal fruits and makes on average around $1.50 each day of net income. Her husband is a farmer, growing rice and collecting palm juice to produce palm sugar. Two of her children are employed by a garment factory and the other three are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Prum K. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more fruits to meet her clients' needs and to use the remainder to buy a motorcycle for her business’ transportation.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more fruits to meet her clients' needs and to buy a motorcycle for her business’ transportation.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy belongs to the "Honesty and Work" communal bank and lives in Juanjui in the San Martín region in Peru. She set up her restaurant in a portion of her home specially developed to daily serve her customers, who are from her neighborhood or visitors from nearby.

She started out selling chicken skewers. In order to buy her first grill she had to work as a domestic servant and then with a loan from her communal bank she was able to add a typical menu and sold her meals from the afternoon through the evening.

With the $1050 loan, which she will repay in six months, she will remodel her restaurant to give it a better ambiance, purchasing a wood table and chairs, and will thus be able to improve her customer service. She will also buy ingredients to prepare her meals such as rice, sugar, beans at wholesale, all kinds of vegetables, beef, chicken, pork, and fish.

Lucy is an enthusiastic and happy 47-year-old who dreams of forging a better future for herself and her family. She feels more communicative and self-assured now than ever.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lucy pertenece al banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, distrito D. Juanjui. Desarrolla su negocio en un ambiente D. su casa especialmente acondicionado donD. diariamente acuden su comensales, los cuales son moradores D. la propia localidad o visitantes D. lugares cercanos. Se inició vendiendo anticuchos D. pollo. Para poder comprar su primera parrilla tuvo que trabajar como empleada doméstica y luego con el crédito del banco comunal adicionó a este la venta D. comida tipo menú, el cual venD. por las tardes hasta la noche. Con el préstamo D. S/ 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, refraccionará el local D. venta D. comidas para así tener un mejor ambiente, comprará una mesa D. madera y sillas y así dar una mejor atención y también comprará los insumos para la preparación D. los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes D. res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos que le permitirá preparar comida variada para la atención a sus clientes. Lucy es una mujer entusiasta y alegre que con sus 47 años desea forjarse un futuro mejor para ella y su familia, hoy se muestra más comunicativa y segura D. si misma.

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs for her restaurant as well as ingredients to make her meals / Compra de activos (mesa, sillas) e insumos para la preapación de comida.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy is a single young man who works in agriculture and animal husbandry. He works so that he can cover his expenses and take care of his mother. He wakes up early every morning to walk through and work his many dispersed crop fields. As all of this walking was exhausting, he decided to buy a mule so that he could travel these long distances and optimize his time. Nevertheless, he still needs to devote more time to the care of his mother. She needs medications for her ailments and the degradation of her health. Fredy wants to increase his crop production with the aim of augmenting his income so that he can better care for his mother. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

FREDY, es un joven soltero que trabaja en la agricultura y en la crianza de animales para poder solventar sus gastos y los de su madre a quien cuida.Es por ello que desde muy temprano sale rumbo a sus terrenos de cultivo que tiene en zonas muy distantes y las horas de caminata son cansadas, gracias a que pudo adquirir un caballito se traslada a tan distantes lugares y puede optimizar su tiempo para invertirlo en el cuidado de su anciana madre.Sin embargo su madre necesita mucho más que cuidados, necesita medicamentos para sus dolencias por su resquebrajamiento de su salud y para que Fredy pueda velar por ella quiere aumentar su producción a fin de tener un incremento en sus ingresos. Por ello requiere un préstamo de para la compra de semillas para sus sembríos

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Suhailee

texts.ru:
Suhailee is married and has 3 children. He sells candy on the market. Currently he sells truffles, caramel candy, cookies and chocolate. He has been working in this business for the past 5 years. A good sales location is about to become available right next to where he sells his goods. He needs money to reserve this spot and start selling goods there as well. His wife and daughters will be working there selling candy. For this purpose he has come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Сухайли женат имеет троих детей. Он торгует на рынке конфетами: трюфелями, карамелями, печеньями и шоколадами. Он сидит на рынке 5 лет. Не далеко от его точки освобождается место, поэтому ему необходимо забронировать и там торговать. Там будет сидеть его дочери и супруга, они также будут торговать сладостями. Для этого ему необходимо определенная сумма, и он обратился в Микроинвест. Он будет арендовать еще одну точку, так как его обеспечивают товаром одна компания это помещение ему необходима.

loans.use: Increase variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of natural medicines to move a small business forward.

loans.name: Tav

texts.en:
Mrs. Tav M., 42, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband, Ang Sear, is a motorbike mechanic. The couple has four children, one of whom is employed and contributes to the family’s income.

Tav is seeking to boost her husband’s business operations. She would like to borrow $500 to purchase air pumps and other tools so that he has the adequate equipment to run a profitable moto shop.

loans.use: Tav would like to purchase an air pump and other mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Mrs. N. was born in 1951. She is married and  she has six children and three orphans to care for.
Four among them are in secondary school and three in primary school.
She sells hardware in Gakinjiro  market.
She began her activity with 25,000 Rwf (about US$ 45) and now she has 300,000 Rwf (about US$ 550) as capital.

loans.use: Increase her business capital

loans.name: Abc Group
loans.use: Buy AA

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera contribuir con el gasto familiar y para poder comprar sus cosas para sin tener que esperar a que le diera dinero su esposo. Comenzó en Febrero de 2007, ya que era empleada de un comedor pero ese trabajo le absorbía mucho y no le permitía estar al tanto de sus hijos, fue entonces que una hermana que vive en la ciudad de Reynosa, la convenció que vendiera ropa usada en los mercados rodantes cercanos a su colonia y ella le enviaría la ropa desde Reynosa para que la vendiera, lo cual llevó a cabo y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar un extenso surtido de productos que en esta temporada tienen una mayor demanda y poder ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria began her business out of the necessity to earn income that would allow her to contribute to the family bills and so that she could buy things without having to hope that her husband would give her money. She began in February 2007. She was a restaurant employee, but this job required a lot from her and did not allow her to be with her children much. It was then that a sister who lives in the city of Reynosa convinced Maria to sell used clothing in the mobile markets near her area. She sent clothing from Reynosa to sell, which Maria carried out, and since then it has gone well.

Maria needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in four months, to purchase an extensive supply of products that, in this season, are in great demand and so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena tiene 37 años de edad, estudió quinto de Secundaria, es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 10 años de edad. Vive en la Av. Circunvalación Nº 152 , distrito de Ilave, provincia de El  Collao, Puno, y es una de las socias del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita” en Ilave.

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital y compró más mercadería. A los 15 años de edad empezó a vender ropa en el mercado, no pudo continuar sus estudios superiores porque a los 18 años de edad tuvo a su hijo lo que le impulso a trabajar más. Actualmente continua con este negocio y tiene una tienda de ropa en el Jr. José Gálvez. Tuvo que salir delante sola sin apoyo del Padre de su hijo.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará más mercadería como casacas, pantalones, juegos de ropa para niñas y niños, ropa deportiva, etc..

Su mayor deseo es que su negocio crezca y pueda tener dos o más tiendas de ropa.
texts.en:
Filomena is 37 years old and she completed grade 11. She is a single mother and she has a son aged 10 years. They live at Av. Circunvalacion No. 152 in the district of Ilave in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a member of the community bank "La Ilavenita" in Ilave.

She started otu with a loan in the amount of S/.300, with which she increased her working capital and purchase more merchandise. At the aged of 15 years she started selling clothing in the markets. She couldn't keep going to school because at the age of 18 y ears she had her son and this gave her the push to work even harder. Currently she keeps the same business, having a clothign store in Jr. Jose Galvez. She had to work alone because she did not receive any support from her son's father.

With this loan, amounting to S/.2000, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase more merchandise, including shirts, slacks, and clothing for boys and girls, sports outfits, etc..

Her greatest dream is to see her business expand and to have two or more clothing stores.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shirts, pants, clothing for boys and girls, sports outfits etc.

loans.name: Gwali Mutala Group

texts.en:
Resty is a dedicated and happy mother and a hard-working productive farmer. She is 56 years old with ten children and three orphaned grandchildren. Four of her children attend university and two are still in primary school. Her grandchildren are also in primary school.

Kasanje is a beautiful rural farming community in the hills near Entebbe. Resty grows matoke, beans, maize and cassava and she raises goats, pigs and cows on her plot overlooking Lake Victoria. She also produces a local distilled brew made from millet called Malwa. Her husband farms coffee and vanilla, and operates a small retail shop in the nearby village.

Resty is using this loan to help pay wages for two workers that help her on the farm. She will also buy millet and wants to buy another goat. She has been a Pearl client since 2000. Small loans have helped her buy the plot she grows her crops on, which have provided the income needed to support her children through school. Without the loans, she would not be able to sustain or grown her business.

Well-dressed, engaging and conversational, Resty is a natural leader. She is Treasurer in the Gwali Mutala group, the women’s leader in the community parish and the Treasurer of a national agriculture association. She hopes to start construction on a new home one day and buy more plots of land for her children to sow. She is always looking for new ways to build her farm and would like more animals. School fees and caring for her orphaned grandchildren take most of her income, leaving little for savings.

loans.use: Pay wages for farm workers, buy millet for brew and another goat.

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.en: R. Noriniso applied first to MicroInvest in 2008. She trades in fruits, salads, vegetables and greens. She works with suppliers of fruits, she makes salads herself and she sells greens that she grows herself. Mrs. R. Noriniso has recommended herself already as a client as she has not delayed loan repayments. Now she is applying to KIVA for a loan of 1000 STJ for 5 months for opening a new trade outlet in the crowded bazaar, which will help her to increase her business. She thanks KIVA for its help and support.

loans.use: Open a new trade outlet

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is thirty-two years old and married with three children, two boys and a girl. Two of her children are currently in junior high school. Her husband is a vegetable farmer. He cultivates mostly tomatoes in the community in which they live. They live in Konongo in the Ashanti Region. Rose is into trading and sells food items like rice, groundnut, cooking oil, and other things. She procures her goods from the northern part of the country where it is more cost-effective. Rose sells on a table top in front of her house. She has been in business for over ten years, and dreams of expanding it by acquiring a bigger store to sell her wares. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk at every trip.

loans.use: To enlarge her food business and buy more inventory for it

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru:
