Хусейн 1985 года рождения, женат. Занимается продажей верхней одежды на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Предпринимательскую деятельность начал в 2004 году с продажи мужской обуви. В ее ассортименте большой выбор женского пальто, короткие и длинные, с мехами и без них, а также имеются шерстяные джемперы и безрукавки. Товары закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон». 
Ассортимент продаваемых им товаров пополнился разновидностями халатов. Хусейн  хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Huseyn M. was born in 1985 and is married. He sells outerwear at the Korvon market in the city of Dushanbe. He started this enterprise in 2004, selling men's shoes. His inventory includes a wide selection of women's coats, both short and long, with fur and without, as well as wool sweaters and vests. He purchases his goods at the Korvon wholesale market. He has broadened his product range to include an assortment of robes. Huseyn would like to participate in Kiva's program and take out a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to purchase seasonal goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's and women's robes

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: S. is 55 years old and a resident of the Pursat Province in Cambodia. She has five children. Three of them are married and live separately. The other two are single and live with her; one is a teacher and the other is a motor-taxi driver. S. has been a rice trader since 2000. She is recognized as a hard-working mother and a responsible neighbor. Recently, she faced a problem with the transportation. So, S. is looking for a loan to buy a motorbike for herself and her family. The loan will help the family achieve a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for herself and her family

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn and her family are living in Barangay (township) Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is already 36 years old and married to Edwin, a secretary in their village. They only have one son named AJ, one year old. Jocelyn helps her husband earn an income by maintaining her poultry and vending businesses.

Jocelyn sells meat products in their village. She roams from one house to another to offer her products. Aside from meat vending, she also raises poultry such as native chickens and ducks. Her weekly net income out of her businesses is averaging PHP 1,000. She budgets her income for their daily food and immediate needs at home. Her business has been a great assistance to their daily living.

To further sustain the businesses, Jocelyn thought of asking for financial support from lenders. She would like to borrow the amount of PHP 7,000 that she can use as additional capital. Jocelyn is hoping to become successful in her business someday so it would be easy for them to send their son to school in the future. “Just believe and put God first before anything else,” said Jocelyn.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Damien

texts.en:
Greetings from Damien M. in Kigali, Rwanda! Damien is currently seeking his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more rice and sugar for his general store. He has owned his business for six years and has two employees who help him at the shop. He works daily from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., earning approximately $500 before expenses each month.

Damien is 34 years old, married, and has two children and two dependents. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 Rwandan Francs to be paid back on a monthly basis over 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar for his general store

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Mrs. Melita B. is 51 years old and married to Adelfo, a private employee. They are blessed with three children. Melita is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC under the micro-finance program in Coastal View Center. She already has completed more than 10 loan cycles and is a good leader in the cluster.

Her business is garment- and dress-making, which helps them especially to meet the financial needs of their children in school and in the family. She borrowed the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase more cloth for so she can make more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy bundles of cloth for dress-making

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Residing at P5 Gango, Ozamiz City, this is Mrs. Patricia E.. She is 55 years old and was legally separated from her husband 10 years ago. She decided to file an annulment because her husband had an affair with another woman. They have five children; four are already married. Previously she was engaged in a Sari-sari Store business. Started this kind of business 20 years ago in her house with an initial capital of PHP 5,000 from her personal income and was able to establish a little Sari-sari Store. Her business grew and became well known locally, and also to the neighboring Barangays.  She became a wholesaler of soft drinks and beer at that time. But, unfortunately, she experienced downfall on her business due to the problems she encountered in life. She was unable to manage that business and got busy in solving those problems. Now, she plans to rise up again and fight the challenges in life. She wants to become a wholesaler and retailer of soft drinks again. She joined PAGLAUM MPC in order to take a loan for additional starting capital to put back into her business. She is applying for the amount of PHP 7,000 as her 1st cycle loan.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari Store.

location.town: Ozamis-P-5 Gango, Ozamiz City Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Massitan

texts.fr:
Madame  Massitan H. est une femme mariée de 44 ans, mère de 5 enfants qui habite avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier ATTbougou de la ville  de Ségou (4ème  région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école par refus de son père traditionaliste  qui voyait en l’école, un chemin d’amoindrissement de l’éducation des  filles. Alors depuis sa tendre enfance elle embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de ses parents. Elle a vendu des jus pour sa mère qui gérait un réfrigérateur. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissages passées auprès de cette dernière, elle devient  très riche  en expériences. Elle décida  d’évoluer seule en menant des activités d’achat et de vente d’habits et de chaussures depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans son lieu de résidence et  bien d’autres endroits de la ville. Les femmes viennent constamment acheter jusqu’à domicile.
Dans l’intention d’augmenter son fonds de commerce elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 10 complets de brodés et plusieurs paires de chaussures au Burkina Faso. Madame Massitan H. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de prendre bien de dépenses familiales (nourritures et habillements). 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Massitan H. is a married woman of 44, mother of 5 children, who lives with her husband and children in the ATTbougou neighborhood of the town of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She did not attend school because her traditional-minded father refused to let her, seeing schools as a way to diminish a girl's education. So from her young days she began to work at earning money alongside her parents. She sold juice for her mother who had a refrigerator. After some years of such apprenticeship with her mother, she gained a lot of rich experience. She decided to go out on her own, selling clothing and shoes for 10 years now. She has a good reputation where she lives and in many other places around town. Women come constantly to buy her goods in her home.

With the intention of adding to her working capital, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with us for 36 months. After 4 solidarity loans and 1 individual loan, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her second individual loan. She expects to use this loan to buy 10 embroidered outfits and several pairs of shoes in Burkino Faso.

Mrs. Massitan H. sells for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA which will allow her to cover many family expenses (food and clothing). Her ambition is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of outfits and shoes for resale

loans.name: Daour

texts.fr: daour S. est une jeune femme née en 1978 à thiès ;elle est mariée et a deux enfants en charge;elle a commencé à faire du commerce depuis plus de dix ans avec le soutien de son père;elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son fonds de roulement pour la vente de parfums qu'elle achète à dakar
texts.en:
Daour S. is a young woman who was born in 1978 in Thiès. She is married and has two children in her care. She began doing commerce over ten years ago with the support of her father. She's requesting this loan to boost her working capital for selling perfumes that she buys in Dakar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell perfumes

loans.name: Tea

texts.en: Tea S., 49, has worked for the government as a soldier since 2000. He is based in Phnom Penh City and has an income of US $6 per day. His wife sells groceries from her house in the village; she has an income of US $6 per day. Together, they have 4 school-aged children. S. wants to borrow US $200 to expand his wife's grocery business. He said his house is convenient for this business, and he hopes to generate more income for the family's use and expenses. (S.'s wife is pictured at her grocery store).

loans.use: buying more groceries

loans.name: Nakasero East Nakazi Jenifer Group

texts.en: Jenifer N., a single businesswoman blessed with two children who are attending school, also takes care of three dependents who go to school as well. Jenifer is leading her group and she wants the loan to purchase new shoes for children, ladies and gents for her shop to satisfy customer demand. She has been in the business for over six years and hopes to improve it with the loan. N. Jenifer is a hardworking lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes for children, ladies and gents in her shop to satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok R. owns and operates a medium size pigpen, where she raises at least six pigs. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who owns and operates a battery-charging service for neighbors. This determined couple has one young child. Sok R. will use half of her loan to purchase pig food and piglets for breeding and the rest to buy rice in bulk at reasonable prices from farmers, then resell to customers at higher prices, thus gaining income.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and piglets for breeding

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr: Diatou D. est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est marchande de fruits et aimerait renforcer son capital d’investissement. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diatou D., 54, is married and the mother of 7 children. She sells fruit and would like to bolster her working capital. Her objective is to improve living conditions and the health of her family and pay school fees for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling seasonal fruit

loans.name: Tully

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 19-year-old Tully K. from Mbozi. She is single. Tully has been running a milk-selling business since 2008. She buys milk from farmers on a wholesale basis and sells it retail. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about 100 USD from her business. Tully is requesting a loan in order to purchase more milk in bulk to resell. In the future, she plans to continue in the same business. Tully thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more milk in bulk to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa E. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 54 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Upper Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. Maria Luisa is just starting her business.

In 2009, Maria Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda M., is 67 years old and married to Jorge M., who is a retired hospital employee. Since Jorge receives a small pension from his former job, he now helps Florenda in her food-vending business so that they can earn a little more. The couple have five children who are 34 to 43 years old, and have finished their training in their chosen fields: one is an electrician, another graduated from a nautical course, another finished a nursing course, and one is a midwife. One of her children works abroad and sends some money to help support the family; all the others are also gainfully employed and also help their parents in one way or another. But Florenda and her husband Jorge do not want to be a financial burden to their children and want to retain some sort of independence. This is why they are striving hard to make their business a success in spite of their advanced age. Having a business also keeps them busy and alert. Years ago, Florenda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access capital so that she could help her husband increase the family income, especially so that they could afford the school tuition of their children. When she got her first loan of Php 5,000, she invested it by putting up a general store. As she was able to increase her loan amounts at each new cycle, she also expanded the operations of her general store and widened the line of products she offered to her customers. To earn a large amount, enough to pay for tuition fees, she also engaged in hog-raising and sold the pigs just in time to pay for the college tuition of her children. Patience, hard work and dedication to achieve her dreams is the key to Florenda’s success, success in the sense that all of her children were able to finish college and earn their degrees. Now that her children are already gainfully employed and are starting to help her financially, she is taking things a little bit easier and is concentrating more on food-vending, selling sweet potato, cassava, bananas, bread and hotdogs from her home. She earns a monthly income of PHP 4,000 from this business activity. In her previous loan, Florenda borrowed Php 16,000 as additional working capital for her business, and her loan was fully paid on time and in full, without any delays. Now, for her 11th loan, she is to borrowing Php 18,000 to be used to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her food preparation business

loans.name: Shirlita

texts.en: Shirlita F. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two infant-aged children. Shirlita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Shirlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Shirlita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady S. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO depuis 7 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle développe un commerce de bananes, elle achète en gros par régimes et revend au détaille en faisant du porte à porte. Ses bénéfices lui servent à participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Khady S., aged 49, is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the village bank Kandé Banéto for seven and a half years. She uses her loan to develop her banana business. She buys bunches of bananas wholesale and resells them hawking from house to house. The profit enables her to participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her fruit business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía es una mujer de 47 años, muy amorosa con su familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo de 35 y sus 2 hijas: Yesica de 13 y Nelida de 8, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En San Antonio de Putina (provincia de la región de Puno), se encuentra el centro poblado “La Mina Rinconada” (poblado predominantemente minero), es aquí donde Epifanía tiene su tienda, donde vende toda clase de productos. Pero últimamente está teniendo problemas para cubrir la demanda de productos que le hacen, ya que el incremento de la población a hecho que la mercadería que lleva no le alcance.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frió que hace en el pueblo. Para el futuro, espera incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que trae, ya que desea que su tienda se convierta en la más importante de la mina La Rinconada.

Este es el primer préstamo de Epifanía con MFP y está dispuesta a ahorrar para poder pagar sus cuotas, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una de las socias más alegres y responsables. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para llevar a vender a la mina La Rinconada.
texts.en:
Epifanía is a 47 year old woman who is very loving with her family. She lives in her own house with her 35 year old husband and their two daughters. Yesica is 13, and Nelida is 8. The children are the motivation for all of their efforts. In San Antonio de Putina (a province in the Puno region) you will find La Mina Rinconada (predominantly populated by miners) town center. That is where Epifanía has her store, where she sells all types of products. Recently she has been having problems meeting the demand for products. The increase in the population has made her supply of merchandise insufficient. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers. She has been doing this for four years. The most difficult thing is having to put up with the intense cold in the town. In the future she hopes to increase the amount of merchandise she has. She wishes to turn her store into the most important one in the La Rinconada mine. This is Epifanía’s first loan with MFP. She is prepared to save to be able to make her payments. She does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is one of the happiest and most responsible members. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy more merchandise to sell in the La Rinconada mine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas, are part of the Asociación Arariwa. This communal bank consists of 16 members from Andahuaylillas, a small town above the left bank of the Vilcanota River that is surrounded by mountains.

One member of the group, Luz Marina, is 39 years old. She lives with her spouse and two children. She was born in Andahuaylillas and still lives there today. Luz Marina has been selling meat and potato kabobs in the Andahuaylillas market for six years. She will use her loan from Arariwa to improve this business.

Most of the members of Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas are involved in food sales. Some, like Luz Marina, sell kabobs in markets, while others own small grocery stores or raise and sell animals. Leonardo has been raising hens for nine years. The group members will use their loans to improve their businesses in the food and animal sectors. 

All of the group members appreciate and thank you for the loan. They promise to repay the monthly payments on time. 

(All of the group members were present in the meeting, but two do not appear in the video.)

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur LUZ MARINA from  Peru

loans.use: Supplies for food and animal businesses

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro C. de 54 años de edad, su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa es comerciante de juntas en el mercado de Montebello tiene 1 hijo que estudia en una escuela particular.

Pedro comenzó hace 1 año atrás con 5 pollo de criadero, así poco a poco vendiéndolos pudo comprar más y ahora trabaja en un pequeño puesto en la principal de Paraíso vendiendo pollos de criadero listos para cocinar a veces la esposa le ayuda pelando los pollos, una de las dificultades de su negocio es el precio por la competencia que hay en el lugar.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 600 pollos para poder así incrementar su negocio. En el futuro quiere agrandar el negocio y poder así remodelar la su casa para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro C. is 54 years old and his house is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His wife is a wholesale merchant in the Montebello Market. He has one son who studies in a private school.

Pedro began a year ago with 5 breeder chickens. Selling them little by little, he was able to buy more. Now, he has a small stall in the principal market of Paraíso selling breeder chickens ready to cook. Sometimes his wife helps him plucking the chickens. One of the difficulties of his business is price, because of the competition that exists in the market.

With this loan he will buy 600 chickens in order to expand his business. In the future, he wants to enlarge his business and be able to remodel his house to ensure his family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CHICKENS TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Benjamin Daniel

texts.es: Benjamín Daniel tiene 32 años,  La actividad económica es la venta de pan. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de su familia y además tenía que pagarse sus estudios por lo que tenía que buscar la manera de obtener ingresos él es un hombre que le gusta luchar y proponerse salir adelante con su actividad económica y sus planes para el futuro. Es por eso que solicita financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de pan que es la materia prima necesaria para ofrecerles a sus clientes. El sueño de él es poder finalizar sus estudios y además seguir adelante con este negocio que es el único medio de vida que posee.
texts.en:
Benjamín Daniel is 32 years old and his business is selling bread. He has been making his living from this business for more than 5 years. He started this business of his own accord because he had to take care of his family and to pay for his studies, which is the reason he had to find a way to make money. He is a man who likes to work hard and to set his mind toward getting ahead with his business and his plans for the future. For that reason he is requesting financing for working capital to purchase bread, which is the raw material he needs to offer to his customers. His dream is to be able to finalize his studies and in addition get ahead with this business, which is the only means he has of making a living.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs.Han A. (pictured here), age 31 and her husband, Mr. Khorn Porm, age 32, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2001 and have 2 sons. 

Mrs. Han A. has been a silk weaver since she was s15 years old, a skill she learned form her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then in turns sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been farming and raising cows for 15 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer R. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elmer owns & operates a business providing taxi services to local community members. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Elmer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elmer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como empleado en la Alcaldía, lugar donde se le presentó la oportunidad de atender a los empleados con el almuerzo.

 El crédito que solicita es para comprar ollas, vajilla y otros materiales que le sirvan para la atención a sus clientes..

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002. Por el buen historial de pagos David puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
David lives in his own home with his wife and children in the Pasankeri neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He is employed at the City Hall, where he was given the opportunity to serve the employees with lunch. The loan that he requests is to buy pots, dishes and other materials that will help him attend to his customers. He has been a client of IMPRO since 2002. Because of his good credit history David can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes and other items to provide lunch service at the City Hall of La Paz

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es: Jose Javier de 26 años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la joven Rosa Adilia Hurtado con quien procreo a su hijo de nombre Wiston, que tiene 2 añitos de edad; Jose trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Policia Municipal desde hace casi 3 años, esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado antes que inicie el invierno, ademas desea ponerle perlines en vez de madera para que dure mas tiempo.  Jose Javier es un joven con gran espiritu de superacion, pues a pesar de los horarios que tiene que cumplir con su trabajo en los turnos de la noche, tambien estudia los domingos su 4to año de secundaria, su esposa tambien estudia el 5to año de secundaria, pues el mayor sueño que tienen es poder coronar una carrera universitaria para obtener mejores oportunidades de trabajo que le permitan darle a su familia y a su hijo un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
Jose Javier, 26, is single and lives in a common-law union with Rosa Adilia Hurtado, with whom he has son, Wiston, 2. Jose has been a police officer with the city of Juigalpa for almost 3 years now. He is asking for his 2nd loan to do some home improvements, specifically replacing the damaged roof before Winter. Besides, he wants to install metal sheeting because it lasts longer than wood Jose Javier is a young man with a great self-improvement spirit because, despite his work schedule-he works the night shift-he is also finishing 10th grade on Sundays; his wife is finishing 11th grade. Their greatest dream is to complete a college degree so that their work opportunities will be better and they will be able to provide their family and son a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof.

loans.name: Hasab

texts.en:
Hasab is a 37-year-old widow woman raising 3 children. She has been working as a farmer for the past 15 years. She cultivates all types of vegetables and fruits, according to the season. Two of her children try to help her with the family's income. With the help of several loans from Ameen, she has been able to develop her business level. 

Today, Hasab is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds. She says that with the help of the loan she will be able to cultivate her land with new summer vegetables and fruits to increase her sales and, therefore, her income.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Salieva`s Group

texts.ru:
Ырыскан 60 лет. Она вдова с 2 сыновьями. Старший сын на заработках в Казахстане, младший сын член крестьянского хозяйства.Она занимается жЖивотноводством: откорм и разведение КРС и реализация молочных продукциию. В основном младший сын помогает в бизнесе. На кредит клиент планирует закупить 1- бычка и доенную корову.

Айнуре 37 лет. Ее супруг находится на заработках в РФ. Старшая дочь находится на заработках в Казахстане, работает продавщицей. Вторая дочь учится в местной школе в 9 классе. Третья дочь учится в 6 классе. Младшая дочь дома. Она на кредит планирует закупить строй материалы (древесину и  500 кг цемента) для постройки конюшни.

Кыздархан, 47, замужем. Ее супруг работает частным строителем. У нее 3 детей: старшему сыну 21, младшему 16, дочке 14 лет. Она вместе с детьми занимается откормом и разведением КРС и реализацией молочной продукции. Кроме этого у нее имеется земельный надел, где она выращивает технические культуры. На кредит клиентка планирует закупить 500 кг. минеральных удобрений, 28 кг. семена хлопчатника и ГСМ для транспорта.

Уулхан, 60, замужем. Ее супруг пенсионер, получает пенсию в размере около 70 долларов. Сын Нурлан на заработках в Бишкеке, сын Нурбек на заработках в Алма-Ате (Казахстан), сын Жылдыз член крестьянского хозяйства. 'В 1994 году заемщица переехала на новый дом с земельным участком 0,15га и стала самостоятельно с супругом выращивать с\х продукцию, в основном сажали хлопок и получали хороший доход. На кредит она закупит минеральные удобрения на 1,30 га земли и семена хлопчатника.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Yryskan is 60 years old. She is a widow with 2 sons. The oldest son works in Kazakhstan, and the youngest son is a member of a farm collective. Yryskan is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding of cattle and sales of dairy products. The youngest son primarily helps her with the business. The client plans to use the loan to buy 1 bull and a dairy cow. Aynura is 37 years old. Her husband works in the Russian Federation. The oldest daughter works as a salesperson in Kazakhstan. The second daughter attends 9th grade at a local school. The third daughter goes to 6th grade, and the youngest daughter is at home. Aynura plans to use the loan to buy construction materials (wood and 500 kg of cement) in order to build a horse stable. Kyzdarhan is 47 years old, married. Her husband works as a construction contractor. She has 3 children: the oldest son is 21, youngest is 16 and the daughter is 14 years old. Together with the children, Kyzdarhan is involved in fattening and breeding cattle and sales of dairy products. Besides this business, she has a plot of land, where she grows agricultural crops. The client plans to use the loan to buy 500 kg of mineral fertilizers, 28 kg of cotton seeds and fuel for the transport. Uulhan is 60 years old, married. Her husband is retired and receives a pension in the amount of about 70 dollars. Her son, Nurlan, works in Bishkek, son, Nurbek, works in Alma-Ata (Kazakhstan), and son, Jyldyz, is a member of a farm collective. In 1994, Uulhan moved to a new house that had a 0.15 hectare plot of land, and she and her husband started to grow agricultural crops. They primarily planted cotton and received a good income. Uulhan will use this loan to buy mineral fertilizers for 1.30 hectares of land and cotton seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull and a dairy cow

loans.name: Josue 1.9 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Josue 1.9 está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas. El coordinador es el señor Marvin Alberto S. Méndez quien tiene un tramo en el Mercado de Masaya donde comercializa huevos por cajilla.

El inicio con este negocio  ya que en la empresa Avícola donde trabajó cargando y descargando contenedores  le propusieron poner un tramo en el mercado de Masaya y que ellos le iban a proporcionar al crédito los huevos para que los vendiera. El actualmente comercializa grandes cantidades y necesita de mayor cantidad de productos además que su costo es menor si se compra al contado.

Los otros miembros del grupo son Luz Marina S. quien trabaja en la compra y venta de artesanías especialmente masetas y adornos de barro y Carlos José M. quien posee una mini-pulpería que está iniciando donde vende especialmente golosinas.
texts.en:
The group "Josue 1.9" is made of up of three hard-working, determined people. The coordinator is señor Marvin Alberto S. Méndez, who has a stretch in the Mercado de Masaya market, where he sells eggs by the carton. He started this business because he worked at a poultry business where he loaded and unloaded containers, and the company proposed that he get a stretch in the market since they were going to offer him the eggs to sell on credit. He currently sells large quantities of eggs and needs a larger quantity of products. His cost is also lower if he pays cash. Another member of the group is Luz Marina S., who works buying and selling handmade goods, especially flowerpots and clay decorations. Carlos José M. is the third member, who has a small general store that he is starting where his specialty is candy.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase eggs

loans.name: Kyabahuura Twetungure, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
It is now twelve years since N. Geralds started his farming adventure in Kyabahuura, Kazo. The married father of three is very aggressive and determined when it comes to business. He has since engaged himself in various farming practices including livestock.

Geralds’ main drawbacks include the bad weather conditions like drought which reduce his rate of production output compared to the input, and also the fluctuating prices. With this loan he is looking forward to buying seeds and hiring labour as he is set to prepare land for maize and bean planting. Gerald is very optimistic about getting more harvests and more revenue.

Geralds is the first on the right raising his hand, while the others on the left with their hands raised are the committee members.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for labor for planting

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song N., 46, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of about $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of around $5 per day.  N. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase raw silk to produce more silk products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: purchase raw silk to produce more silk products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the floor of his house

loans.name: Bibihurayra

texts.ru: Аралова Бибихурайра проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 58 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и бобовые культуры. В этом ей помогает муж. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеет повторный урожай.
texts.en:
Bibihurayra A. lives in Yavan. She is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than five years. The plot of land where she grows vegetables and legumes is at her home. Her husband helps her. She is taking out a loan to buy seed and mineral fertilizer in order to sow a second crop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S. is the village bank president. She is 35 years old and was selected by thirteen people located in Damnak Reachea village, Takeo province. All the members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Ny S. is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. She is a dessert seller while her husband, Mr. Nuch Vech, is a construction worker.

Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Ny S. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of three children of whom all are studying in school and they are helping with their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maravillas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama MARAVILLAS,  porque a las  clientas son muy devotas de la imagen religiosa del señor de las Maravillas,  que se venera cerca de su comunidad; además de presumirse que hacen maravillas con su dinero,  pues hacen que rinda frutos al 100 % en sus respectivos negocios. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Puebla, en México, el grupo está conformado por 10 mujeres exitosas que cuentan con negocios propios y fructíferos, además que es el ciclo cuarto trabajando con credicomun y siempre han sido muy puntuales con sus pagos.  Este préstamo será destinado para comprar materia prima (rollo de peluche, ojos de diferentes tamaños, hilo, relleno)
La Tesorera del grupo se llama María de Lourdes Nieves A. L., es la persona más responsable y honesta  del grupo, motivo por el cual fue elegida para ese puesto dentro de la mesa directiva. Tiene 45 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria, es soltera;  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Artículos de Peluche, es una persona emprendedora, pues ella es la creadora de sus propios diseños;  para sus demás compañeras es un ejemplo a seguir pues con sus mínimo grado de estudios, actualmente y mediante mucho esfuerzo ya cuenta con una vasta cartera de clientes. Para ella el éxito se vería reflejado mediante la creación de su propia fábrica de peluches y su marca registrada, además de soñar sean reconocidos sus diseños a nivel mundial, mediante la exportación de sus productos.   Su meta en la vida es poder ser creadora de F. de empleo para otras mujeres,  que como ella sueñan  con darles a sus familias  una buena educación,  para que no sufran de las carencias que ellas han  pasado, además  de impulsarse como micro empresarias con la ayuda de nuestros créditos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
GABRIELA A. L.           - VENTA DE COSMATICOS,
JOSEFDINA G. T.          – MISCELANEA,
IRMA A. L.               - VENTA DE ZAPATOS
MARIA ROSA IGNACIA G. M. - VENTA DE BLANCOS
OLIVIA CLARA A. L.       – VENTA DE JUGOS
MARIA DEL CARMEN A. G.   – LAVANDERIA
MARIA SOLEDAD C. C.      – VENTA DE ROPA
CECILIA F. G.            – COMIDA
SUSANA C. F.             – VENTA DE TRASTES.
texts.en:
This group is called “MARAVILLAS” (Marvelous) because its members are very devoted to the religious image of the Marvelous Lord, which is venerated near their community. They are also proud because they do marvelous things with their money, making it return 100% profit in their respective businesses. This group is located in Puebla, Mexico and is made up of ten achieving women, each having her own successful business. This is their fourth cycle working with CreditComun and they have always been punctual with their payments. They will use the money from this loan to buy supplies (fabric for making stuffed animals, different sizes of artificial eyes, thread, and stuffing). The group’s treasurer is named María de Lourdes Nieves A.L. and she is the group’s most honest and responsible person. This is why she was elected to this position among the other officers. She is 45 years old, has a junior high school education, is single, and makes and sells stuffed animals. She is a very enterprising woman and designs her own items. Her peers see her as a person to be emulated, despite her limited formal education. With a lot of effort she’s been able to establish a large number of customers. For her, success would mean opening her own stuffed animal factory and creating her own brand. She also dreams of becoming known throughout the world and exporting her products. Her goal in life is to create jobs for other women, who, like her, dream of providing good educations for their families, so that they don’t suffer from the same needs that they have had to deal with. These loans have made it possible for each of them establish their small businesses. The other members of the group are: Gabriela A. L. – Cosmetic sales Josefdina G. T. – General merchandise Irma A. L. – Shoe sales Maria Rosa Ignacia G. M. – White sales Olivia Clara A. L. – Juice sales Maria Del Carmen A. G. – Washing Maria Soledad C. C. – Clothing sales Cecilia F. G. – Food sales Susana C. F. – Dish sales

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia V. is from the village of Namnama. She is 50 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she manufactures and sells bamboo products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $68 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a rice farmer who is able to make about US$ 2 per day. She has been farming since 2000. She has three children; two are in school and one is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a traditional musician. He makes US$ 3 a day. He earns the most from December to May. 

Rath S. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase in bulk of foods such as bananas for resale

loans.name: Tindolo

texts.en:
Tindolo J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  

Tindolo is 45 years old and widowed. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a member of Faulu Kenya under Bomas united group.  She makes her living running a green grocer shop.  She has been running the business with one employee.  She hopes to own her place of business instead of renting.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become disciplined in handling money as she has to part with some money on a weekly basis as part of her savings with Bomas united group.  She has requested 30,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر ال 22 سنة غير متزوج يعمل في بيع الأقراص المدمجة والافلام وتعهدات صوتية يحب عمله جدا يعمل به منذ              
ان كان صغير حيث ان المصلحة لأهله يعمل بجد ونشاط يبرع في عمله يمتلك مهارات تخوله ان يتطور ويعتمد على نفسه وان ويملك محل خاص به                                                                                                               
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة شراء معدات صوتية جديدة لأنه يواجه منافسة من محيطه العملي يلقى دعم كبير من العائلة   وزبائنه                                                                                                           
يقصدونه من عدة مناطق لنشاطه وحبه للعمل لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة لكي يصبح قادر على منافسة محيطه في مجال عمله
texts.en: Mohamed is 22 years old.  He is single and earns a living through selling DVDs, CDs, movies, and audio equipment. He loves his job and has been operating his family’s business ever since he was young. He is active, passionate, and has the necessary skills to develop and become independent by owning a private business. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he would like to purchase new sound equipment, as he faces strong competition from the field. Mohamed has the support of his family, and his clients come from different areas. He lacks the finances to be able to compete in the field.

loans.use: Purchase new audio equipment

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Alex; el tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos y luego lo distribuye a sus amistades o personas que lo solicitan. El socio es contador de profesión pero por el momento se dedica al negocio.

El socio solicita el préstamo  para la compra de insumos para su negocio como alimentos balanceados para las diferentes clases de animales que cria. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LLANKACHINAPAC".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sr. Alex.  He is 34 years old, living with another person, and has one child.  The member alternates his daily activities with the business of raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs and then distributes them to his friends or people upon request.  The member is an accountant by profession but for the time being is committed to his business. 

The member is requesting the loan for the purchase of materials for his business as feed for the different kinds of animals he breeds.

The member thanks those who support his dream by these means, and he commits to comply with the payment of his dues on time.

loans.use: El socio solicita el préstamo  para la compra de insumos para su negocio como alimentos balanceados para las diferentes clases de animales que cria.

loans.name: Ablamvi Théophile

texts.fr: Théophile est âgé de 36 ans et est marié. IL a en charge 3 enfants.  Pour arriver à répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, il fait l’activité de taxi moto. Il a débuté cette activité en 2006 et le fait dans les zones environnantes  d’Agbalépédo. A travers cette activité, il avait sollicité plusieurs crédits qui sont déjà remboursés. Il demande un nouveau prêt pour acheter une nouvelle moto pour son activité.
texts.en: Théophile is a married 36 year old with three children in his care. In order to meet their needs he drives a taxi bike for a living; he began working in this field  in 2006 and works in the areas around Agbalépédo. Through this line of work he has already received and repaid several loans.  He is now seeking a  loan in order to buy a new motorbike for his work.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Aukor  Lokwang

texts.en:
Aukor Lokwang N. is 37 years old. He is married to Lilian Alim, who is a housewife. They have three school-going children ages ten, seven, and four years old. They live in Lodwar, Kenya. 

Aukor sells livestock and has been in this business for six years. He earns a monthly profit of KES.10, 000.

Aukor learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer. He is applying for a second loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to buy more goats,cows,sheeps to sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his livestock business.

In the future, Aukor wishes to expand economically and be the leading local investor.

loans.use: To buy more goats, cows, sheep to sell

loans.name: Ruya

texts.en:
Ruya Kanaan is an employee of the Palestine Business Men Forum. Ruya is an ambitious woman who is studying at the American University of Jenin to earn a Master's degree.

Ruya came to FATEN and took a loan to pay the last semester's tuitions fees. Ruya will finish her degree this year and this will reflect on her academic and financial situation. 

Ruya appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: To pay for graduate school tuition fees

loans.name: Las Caminantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo las caminantes lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de Managua; una de ellas es Nohemí Gutiérrez López. Esta señora de 49 años tiene una pulpería la cual hace un año volvió a reabrirla con la ayuda de su hija. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas etc. y algún día desea tener una miscelánea.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Xiomara Martínez  comerciante de artículos escolares como cuadernos, papeles, lápices…etc. y Jennifer O. desde hace cuatro años tiene una tortillería.
texts.en:
Las Caminantes Group ("the women who get things moving") is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women from Managua.

One of them is Nohemí Gutiérrez López, aged 49, who had a local store which she reopened last year with the help of her daughter.  She will invest her loan in staple food, yogurt, soda, etc. She wants to own a general store someday.

The other group members are Xiomara Martínez, selling school supplies such as notebooks, paper, pencils, etc., and Jennifer Ordóñez, who has sold tortillas for four years.

loans.use: To buy staple food

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Manuel, tiene  38 años tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. José se dedica a la venta de pan. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 2 años, el dio inicio debido a que el tenia problemas económicos pero su familia lo ayudo para que pudiera establecer un negocio y mantenerse ocupado. Por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de harina, cazuelas, huevo, mantequilla entre otros. El  sueño de él es mantenerse en el negocio, debido a que la competencia es bastante grande, además que desea invertir para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. José Manuel is 38 years old and has two young children for whom he is responsible. He sells bread and has been in business for two years. José Manuel had financial problems when he first started, but with the support of his family he was able to establish his business and remain busy. He is a very responsible gentleman who enjoys his work.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of flour, pans, eggs, butter, and other items. His dream is to maintain his business because there is plenty of competition. In addition, he plans to invest in completing the construction of his home.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy flour, pans, eggs, butter, and other items

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia C. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Simplicia is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Simplicia owns & operates a specialized store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas & coconuts in the local community. Simplicia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Simplicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simplicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Simplicia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like bananas & coconuts for copras. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Simplicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like bananas & coconuts

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfonso de 42 años, quien trabaja de obrero en una mina cercana a la ciudad de Huancayo y sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea darles una buena educación. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Clorinda sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son, papa, maíz, arveja y los gradiolos, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlas. Para el futuro, planea poner su propio puesto de ventas, en el mercado de Tarma, ya que esto le generará mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de arveja, también comprará abono e insecticidas, para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Clorinda, who is 45, is a very uncomplicataed and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Alfonso, who is 42 and works in a mine near the city of Huancayo, and their three children, to whom she wants to give a good education. Every day, very early in the morning, Clarinda goes out to work in her fields. For her, there are no days of rest, since she has to work continually on her farm to have good production. Her principal crops are potatoes, corn, peas, and gladiolas, which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma. The freedom that she has working in her fields is what she likes most about her work, since she can freely enjoy the green fields. She has been doing this work for 25 years and finds that the most difficult part is protecting  her crops from the pests that can afflict them. In the future, she is planning to have her own stand in the market at Tarma, since this will generate better income. This is her eighth loan from MFP. She has been very punctual in making her payments and hopes to be punctual again with this loan. In her communal bank, she is well-liked by the other members, since she is very cheerful. With the 3000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more pea seeds, and she will also buy fertilizers and insecticides to improve her crops.

loans.use: Buy pea seeds, bags of fertilizer, and insecticides for insect pests

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a 36-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Dinah has been in the business of raising hogs for a year. She plants to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. She also owns a sari-sari store and plans to use part of the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell. In the future, Dinah hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Marek Ole

texts.en:
Marek Ole D., 40-year-old married father of three children aged nine, six, and two, has been a mixed farmer for the past eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 2000. 

This is his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase certified wheat seeds from kenya seed, fertilizers and land preparation. also to use part of the loan to buy a cow for fattening which he will sell later at a profit. 

With the profits generated he plans to re-invest and pay school fees for his children.  An assiduous man who works hard to attain more despite limited resources, Marek dreams of becoming a prominent farmer.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds, fertilizers, and prepare the land for planting, and also to buy a cow

loans.name: Mak

texts.en: Mak S., 41, sells fish at the local market in Takeo province. She has been selling fish since 2006, and is able to make about US $4 of profit each day. She has three school-aged children living at home to support. Her husband is a professional television repairman, who usually makes US $5 per day. Mak S. wants to take out a loan of US $500 to purchase more tools for her husband. S. is unavailable, so her husband appears in the photograph instead.

loans.use: to buy more tools for her husband.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena es una madre de familia de 23 años de edad.  Vive en la casa de sus suegros con su esposo y su menor hijo. Reside en la zona rural de la  provincia de Catacaos en el departamento de Piura y no cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz.

Rosa Elena se dedica  a la elaboración de chicha de jora (bebida hecha a base de maíz fermentado) esta es una bebida oriunda del Perú,  además vende harina  de maíz y leña, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años en sus mismo domicilio, años en los cuales ella ha podido adquirir clientela fija en su zona.

Rosa Elena se ha dado cuenta que  últimamente su clientela se ha visto en aumento,  ella no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender su producto en otras comunidades.  Es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que ella pueda comprar más insumos como el maíz para la elaboración  de la harina y la chicha 

Rosa Elena es un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, es una mujer muy trabajadora que desea salir a delante y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena is the mother of a family and she is 23 years old. She lives in the house of her parents-in-law, together with her husband and their young son. She lives in the rural region of the province of Catacaos in the department of Piura. The house is not equipped with water or electricity.

Rosa Elena makes chicha de jora (a drink made of fermented corn). It is a traditional drink of Peru. She also sells corn flour and firewood. She has had her business for 5 years in her home. Throughout the years she has acquired a stable client base in her community. 

Rosa Elena has noticed that lately her clientele has been increasing. She doesn't want to miss the opportunity to sell her product in other communities. This is the reason why she requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She will purchase more ingredients, such as corn, to make flour and chicha drinks.

Rosa Elena is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very hard working who is eager to improve and to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make corn flour and chicha drinks.

loans.name: Eveling Carolina

texts.es: Eveling es una joven que ha logrado aprender con su negocio a salir adelante a la edad de 28 años ella decide iniciar a vender ciertos productos como lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, cremas y tratamientos la notar que a la buena administración de negocios y las ganancias que le generaba decide empezar su negocio. Con el dinero quiere comprar una gran variedad de mercadería, pues sus clientes en esta temporada le ha solicitado varios productos pues se acerca la celebración del día de las Madres y es donde más demanda tiene comprara shampoo, lápiz de labio, pintura de uñas, brillos, cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, body y polvos.
texts.en: Eveling is a young woman who has managed to learn to move forward with her business. At the age of 28 she decided to start selling certain products such as lipstick, nail polish, lip stains, skin lotions, and treatments. When she noticed the good business administration and profits earned by these businesses she decided to start her own business. With the funds she will purchase a wide variety of merchandise. During this season her clients have requested various products, especially for the Mother's Day celebrations. She will purchase shampoo, lipsticks, nail polish, skin lotions, deodorants, perfumes, body sprays, and compacts.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, lipsticks, nail polish, skin lotions, deodorants, perfumes, body sprays, and compacts for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre de familia de 34 años, vive con su esposo e hija en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y turismo.

Teresa se dedica  a la crianza de ganado vacuno y caprino desde hace unos años, su corral donde se encuentran sus animales están en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo los ofrece en el mercado de Lambayeque y Chiclayo,  con el dinero que va adquirir por la venta de sus animales, podrá atender las necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para  comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para sus animales  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de los mismos para seguir comercializandolo a sus clientes.  Teresa es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, en especial la de su hija.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 34-year-old mother living with her husband and daughter in her own house located in Mórrope District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  The zone is dedicated to agriculture, raising livestock, crafts and tourism.

Teresa has been raising cattle and goats for several years now.  The corral her animals are located in is in her back yard.  She feeds them balanced feed like natural grasses and once they reach optimal size and weight she sells them at the Lambayeque and Chiclayo markets.  Income from the animal sales will be used to meet daily household needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan through its Capital Seed program to buy more animals and their respective feed assuring their good growth and development to continue selling to her customers.  Teresa is known in the zone for being a hard working woman who very much wants to improve her family’s quality of life through her work, especially her daughter’s.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Naumi has a shop that sells coconuts for copra (coconut meat used in oil production). She has had this business for three years. Her husband provides motorcycle services. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of coconuts.

Naumi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of coconuts.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 30 años, vive soL. en su casa que posee en el campo. A lo largo D. su vida aprendió todo lo fundamental para desempeñarse como una buena agricultora, desD. su niñez sus padres forjaron en elL.  los conocimientos y habilidades que hoy le sirven y que son su sustento económico. Es así que cultiva papa, maíz y alfalfa, cuyos productos una vez cosechados son llevados para su venta. Asume los riesgos que significa dedicarse a L. agricultura ya que en varias oportunidades las condiciones climáticas afectaron seriamente sus cultivos ocasionándole  pérdidas, por lo tanto se dedica también al engorD. D. animales que le ayuda a sostenerse económicamente. Se entero D. MFP, por medio D. su vecino que L. invitó a formar parte D. un grupo y fue D. su interés ya que necesitaba en ese entonces liquidez para invertir en su siembra, desD. entonces ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. En esta ocasión el dinero le servirá para sembrar maíz para lo cual comprará sacos D. abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Rita is 30 years old.  She lives alone in a house she has in the countrysiD..  Throughout her life she’s learned all the basics to be a good farmer.  Since childhood her parents instilled knowledge and skills in her that today serve as her means of support.  She grows potatoes, corn and alfalfa which, once harvested, she sells.  She accepts risks inherent in farming since on several occasions weather conditions severely affected her crops causing losses sometimes.  Because of this, she also raises animals to help support herself economically.

She found out about MFP through a neighbor who invited her to form part of a group.  This interested here because she was in need of cash liquidity to invest in her planting.  Since then, she’s been punctual with her repayments.  On this occasion, the money will be used for her corn crops; she will buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Mr. Keo is 57 years old, married and devoted to his six children. Four of the children are single and the other two are married. He has been planting fruits trees on his own land to earn an income. His wife assists him in the same business. From this, they can make an average profit of $1.87 each day. Mr. Keo would like to request a loan to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to plant

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Martín  es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable el  cual   día  con día  lucha  para  sacar adelante  a  su  familia  ya que  es lo mas importante  en su  vida, con  esfuerzo  y  dedicación  a  ido  pagando  su   casa   y  su  mayor   sueño  es   acondicionarla   para   así  brindar a   su  familia  una excelente  calidad  de  vida,   en este  momento  el requiere  realizar  la construcción de  un cuarto en su   domicilio para   que su   familia  tenga  mayor  comodidad,  ve  en  el  crédito   la posibilidad  de  realizar  su proyecto.
texts.en: Mr. Martín is a hard-working, responsible person who struggles daily so his family can get ahead.  With much effort and dedication he has paid for his house, and his greatest goal is to improve it for the family to have an excellent quality of life.  Currently he wants to add another room to the house so his family can be more comfortable.  The loan will allow him to carry out his project.

loans.use: To carry out home improvement.

loans.name: Maritza Bernarda

texts.es: Maritza Bernarda tiene 47 años.  Ella posee una pulpería, es muy reconocida en el lugar pues las personas siempre encuentran lo que necesitan además tiene muy buenas referencias es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy amable siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro. Maritza tiene muchas metas y quiere cumplirlos por eso trabaja con mucha dedicación el éxito. Su crédito será para la compra granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y enlatados así podrá mantener el negocio y lograra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Maritza Bernarda is 47 years old and manages a general store. She is well-known in the area because her customers can always find what they need. Maritza has very good references and is a hardworking, honest, and friendly woman who always welcomes her customers with a smile on her face. She has many goals and wants to accomplish them successfully through hard work and dedication.

Her loan will be used to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents, and canned goods so that she can maintain her business and provide her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents, and canned goods.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). 

Florence has a business selling eggs.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Florence sells her products in a shop, wholesale. Florence has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more trays of eggs. She also generates additional income through a small retail shop.

The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to open up another shop selling eggs. Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more trays of eggs.

loans.name: Julieta Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Julieta y su esposo trabajan como costureros en el taller de vestidos de su hermana patricia. Viven en la zona de Pampahasi bajo que esta ubicado a veinte minutos al este de la ciudad de La Paz. Tienen dos hijos en edad escolar. Trabajan ambos como costureros pero laS Sra. Julieta compra los vestidos del taller de su hermana y los vende en las ferias de las mañaneras y también en la ciudad de Oruro, donde viaja los días de feria. Actualmente viven en un departamento en anticrético pero uno de sus mayores anhelos es comprar una casita propia. Ella es cliente antigua de Emprender y en todo el tiempo siempre ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual con sus pagos. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo de dinero para el aumento de mercadería de vestidos de gasa y sacos para niñas de tela polar por época de frío, ya que le hicieron ya pedidos y tiene que llevar a entregar en la ciudad de Oruro.
texts.en:
Julieta and her husband work as tailors in her sister Patricia's dressmaking shop. They live in the zone of Lower Pampahasi which is 20 minutes to the east of the city of La Paz. They have two school-aged children. They both work as tailors but Julieta buys dresses from her sister's workshop and sells them in the morning markets and also in the city of Oruro where she travels on market days. 

Currently they live in an apartment through a loan system known as anticretico, but one of her greatest wishes is to buy her own house. She is an old client of Emprender  and has always proven herself responsible and punctual in her payments. On this occasion she requests a loan to increase her stock of chiffon dresses and girls' polar fleece jackets for winter, since she has already had orders placed and needs to deliver them in Oruro.

loans.use: to buy chiffon dresses.

loans.name: Amba D Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Amba D group. Patrick and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Patrick takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Patrick will save for the future and invest in raising livestock.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In 2012, the members of Amba D group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is from the village Kumisi. She is 40 years old and lives with her family: husband Paata and 15 years old son who goes to school. 

Mzia and Paata own five milk cows and sell milk and yogurt in Tbilisi.  Their average monthly income is 1000 Laris. 

Mzia requests a loan to buy a computer for her son as well as household goods that will make their house more comfortable and improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a PC for son and household goods for the family.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
On, pictured in the photo, and her husband, Bunthoeun, are farmers. When she is not at the farm, she also buys nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks and resells them in her village. 

The couple has been married for almost ten years, and has four children; three sons and one daughter. Three are in school, and the other one is still young. They live in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
