On hopes to continue her business, so she decided to apply for another loan in the mount of $1,000 to buy addition nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks for sale.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es: Ana siempre ha tenido como aspiración el poder finalizar su carrera universitaria, espera poder ejercer su profesión en el área penal y contribuir a la administración de la justicia en Nicaragua. Siempre se empeña en conseguir lo que quiere, es muy positiva ante las circunstancias de la vida. Su madre le inspira a lograr sus metas, que ella le ha ayudado a llegar hasta donde está actualmente.
texts.en:
Ana has always had the ambition of completing her university degree.  She hopes to practice her profession in the area of criminology, and contribute to the administration of justice in Nicaragua. 

She has always been determined to get what she wants, and has been very positive faced with her life circumstances. Her mother inspires her to achieve her goals, and has helped her get to where she is today.

loans.use: To pay for the completion of her university studies.

loans.name: Tafuta Upate Group

texts.en: Anathaus, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been a tailor since 2004. She works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be her third motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania given in the middle of the main loan that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loans to buy materials and managed to make a lot of bedsheets and tablecloths, and has paid back her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more stock of materials, kanga and vitenge (different types of traditional African cloth). Her dream is to one day be able to own a grocery. She will share this loan with her loan group "Tafuta Upate," which has a total of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of materials, kanga and vitenge (different types of traditional African cloth).

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en: Samandar is 31 years old, and is married with three children. He is the father of three lovely daughters. He is a market vendor and sells food items in his shop in Agsu. Samandar has 5 years of experience in this business. This is the only source of income for the young family. That is why Samandar would like to expand it. His monthly profit is around 250 AZN. Now he has applied for 600 AZN to purchase more food for his store.

loans.use: to purchase more food for his store

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba pero actualmente ella vive en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo, ella tiene 55 años y está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Dominga desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la venta D. salchipapas, tiene una tienda D. videos juegos, a la agricultura, a la crianza D. animales menores y a la venta D. cerveza. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Dominga requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo insumos como papas, salchicha y otras cosas más. 

Dominga se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Dominga pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. Choquekillca” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad D. Urubamba.
texts.en:
Dominga was born in Urubamba but currently lives in Ollantaytambo. She is 55 years old, married with three children.  

She lives and works in the city of Ollantaytambo. She sells chips and sausages, owns a videogame shop, works in agriculture, raises small animals and sells beer. She has been in business for many years and does well due to her determination.  

Dominga is asking for this loan to purchase products such as potatoes, sausages and others.  

Dominga is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this option and promises to repay on time, according to schedule. She belongs to “Señor D. Choquekillca” Communal Bank from Asociación Arariwa in Urubamba city.

loans.use: to purchase products and supplies such as potatoes, sausages and others

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with four children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year Mary has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality in her business is her major challenge.

Mary decided to join Yehu to access loans so as to boost her business. With her 10,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika S & C Co-Operative Society Group A

texts.en:
A resolute purposefulness is what has seen 53-year-old Sarah's retail business ride high on success. An all out effort aimed at firmly obtaining a strong footing for her enterprise has been paying dividends the last two years she has been in operation. The happily married mother of ten has registered some minimal successes but is hopeful more are on the horizon for the new year, 2012.

Sarah says she was inspired by her close friend to take root (in her business). Prior to taking root, she was deriving her sustenance from the selling of poultry.

Sarah says her monthly sales returns are to the tune of UGX 200,000.

She says she intends to use her loan to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, soap, salt, beans, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, soap, salt, beans, rice, etc to resell.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin, 47, is a rice farmer who has been living in Prey Chor district. She has nine children, most of whom are single and living together with her in a house. She has just finished collecting her rice fruit recently, and she found that it won’t be enough for the whole year. It’s really a good time now if she can buy rice from other villagers to store in her barn. So now she is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a stock of rice to keep for daily food. This is her first loan that will secure her family out of hunger. She is very pleased and thankful to our lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice to keep for daily food.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is married with three children. He is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Marlon's business is successful. He used his previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Now, he has requested a new loan which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Positively, he hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny está casado, tiene un hijo y vive en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un auto para transportar pasajeros con el cual genera sus ingresos de forma diaria y puede mantener a su familia, 

Jhonny solicita el crédito para efectuar el mantenimiento de su vehículo y ponerlo en buen estado de funcionamiento ya que es su única fuente de ingresos con la cual se mantiene y mantiene a su familia.

El sueño de Jhonny es poder tener su empresa de radio taxi y tener su casa propia ya que actualmente vive en alquiler.
texts.en:
Jhonny is married, has a son, and lives in the San Martin neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  He has a car to transport passengers that he uses to generate a daily income and support his family.

Jhonny is asking for a loan to perform maintenance on his car and get it in good working condition as it is his only source of income to support himself and his family.

Jhonny's dream is to have his own radio taxi business and his own home, as he currently rents.

loans.use: to pay for general maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Elavagnon Group

texts.fr: ELAVAGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Juliette Cica (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Benoît. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Juliette Cica vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Juliette Cica assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis cinq ans, Juliette Cica vend des tissus et des liqueurs à son domicile ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Juliette Cica s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la cinquième fois que Juliette Cica et les autres membres du groupe ELAVAGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des liqueurs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Mrs. Essi A. was born in 1962 in Tsévié. She is married and a mother of four (04) children. Once a public officer, her husband is now a teacher and is able to provide very little to the household. Having only completed primary education courses, she started selling "Kom" (a local food) very early in her life, in a local school but now also has a business of selling dried fish in Tsévié and in neighbouring markets.

Dynamic and honest, she loaned and reimbursed credits four times without any problems. She is now asking for a credit of $850 to build her dried fish commerce. Thanks to this income, she will be able to provide for her family and improve their living condition.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Essi est née en 1962 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son époux enseignant retraité de la fonction publique investi très peu dans les dépenses domestiques. Ayant seulement fait le cours primaire, elle a commencé par vendre très tôt du « Kom » dans un établissement scolaire de la place mais aussi, elle fait le commerce des poissons séchés à Tsévié et dans les marchés voisins. Dynamique et honnête, elle a bénéficié quatre fois de suite de crédits qui sont tous remboursés sans difficulté. Pour renforcer, son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui sera consacré uniquement à la vente des poissons séchés. Grâce aux revenus elle pourra faire face aux nombreuses dépenses de la famille en vue d'une amélioration de leur condition de vie.

loans.use: Restocking dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase New  uncut materials

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is a single mother who sells cosmetics. She travels around the local community from the morning into the evening offering family, friends and acquaintances her products. This work provides the main source of income for her and her family. She has three daughters, two of whom go to school. When she goes out in the afternoon to sell, she must leave her younger kids in the care of her older daughter, which is worrisome for her. She has already borrowed from Mifex before. She uses the loans so she can buy her products wholesale for better prices. Her goal is to become a large-scale distributor of the cosmetics and open a store in her home.

loans.use: Purchase her goods at wholesale prices

loans.name: Rosa Consuelo

texts.es:
Rosa Consuelo learned the seamstress's office when she was 37 years old. She was able to support her four children with this work. At present they all are independent. Rosa has kept making clothes to people who know her and who have qualified her as an excellent seamstress. She is 57 years old and she will use the loan to buy wholesale fabrics, sewing notions, accessories and spare parts for her sewing machine. Rosa is part of the group called “Delicias 4” together with Mrs Beatriz Marisol Jiménez Bermúdez, they sell footwear through a cataloge and she will also invest her loan in buying more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Consuelo a los 37 años de edad aprendió el oficio de costurera, con este trabajo pudo sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos que actualmente son independientes. Rosa sigue confeccionando ropa a personas que la conocen y que han calificado su trabajo como excelente costurera. Ella tiene 57 años y su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de tela al por mayor, mercería, accesorios y refacciones para su maquina de cocer, otros. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Delicias 4 junto con doña Beatriz Marisol Jiménez Bermúdez se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo y que invertirá su préstamo en el surtido de calzado.

loans.use: Buy wholesale fabrics, sewing notions, accessories and spare parts for sewing machine.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea Y., aged 41, sells clothes in a market in the nearby town. She earns around $2.40 per day in profit.  Her husband is a farmer who makes about $1.60 per day by selling his vegetables.  They have six children, five who are students and one who works in a garment factory making about $2.30 per day.  She is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase more fashionable clothes to meet her customers’ demands and use the remaining funds to repair the family home.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothing to sell for profit to repair her house.

loans.name: Tashbubu

texts.en:
Tashbubu successfully completed the full cycle of her first loan from KIVA. Tashbubu continues her activity of producing handmade carpets and selling these.

Both her daughter and daughter-in-law help her in Tashbubu's business. Now, she wishes to increase the quantity of raw materials and thus, asks for a new loan.

loans.use: To increase quantity of raw materials

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
We find Mrs. Julia in her humble home, eagerly blending the immense variety of wool that she keeps in her house for the tailoring of her beautiful and colorful “chompas” (Peruvian wool sweaters). She is a mother who is a fighter and very innovative, she has three children; for some years she has been knitting “chompas” manually, but as she obtained better economic income bit by bit she acquired sewing machines that perfected her beautiful garments. Nowadays, with her adolescent children whom she diligently takes care of in her free time, she has strengthened her business, converting her workshop into one of the biggest and most renowned that she dedicates herself to the exportation of “chompas”, with the economic profits that she obtains thanks to her management of this activity, she has bettered her home and she has provided studies for her dear children. In this opportunity Julia applies for a loan that she has thought to invest in the purchase of a better quantity and variety of raw material to continue making her elegant “chompas.” Julia is thankful for the opportunity you provide her to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Julia, en su humilde hogar, matizando afanosamente la inmensa variedad de lanas que guarda en casa para la confección de sus hermosas y coloridas chompas. Ella es una madre muy luchadora y emprendedora, tiene tres hijos; hace algunos años atrás tejía chompas manualmente, pero conforme obtenía mayores ingresos económicos poco a poco fue adquiriendo máquinas de tejer que le fueron aliviando y perfeccionando sus bellas prendas. Actualmente, ya con sus hijos adolescentes, quienes le apoyan diligentemente en sus horas libres, ha fortalecido su negocio, convirtiendo su taller en uno de los más grandes y reconocidos que se dedican a la exportación de chompas, con las ganancias económicas que obtiene gracias a su desenvolvimiento en esta actividad ha mejorado su vivienda y les ha brindado estudios a sus queridos hijos.En esta oportunidad Julia, hace la solicitud de un préstamo que tiene pensado invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de materia prima para seguir confeccionando sus elegantes chompas.Julia agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para acrecentar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a better quantity and variety of raw material.

loans.name: Ketifallawo B(2060) A Group

texts.en:
Joweria is 35 years old and married with five children. She offers tailoring services for a living, and she wants to use the extra business profit to buy a new sewing machine. Anita is a poultry farmer and intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets for the new poultry house. Grace owns a clinic and drug shop and wants to purchase more medical drugs for sale. Sarah sells raw foods in the market and intends to expand business with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in tailoring business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria has more than 25 years of experience in sales, and she dedicates herself to selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, as well as to running a small general store in the Sabana Grande region, which is where she is from. These activities have allowed her to get her children ahead and to support her husband, who works as a bricklayer, with the household expenses. The business has been growing through the years; she began by selling cosmetics on the street and with financial assistance she managed to establish a small business in her home. Currently, she relies on a wide variety of products to satisfy her customers, who are individuals with a strong ability to pay for her products, which she offers on credit. She and works every day of the week. Maria indicated that the greatest source of income in her home is this business, which is why she decided to request a loan with the goal of investing in purchasing new goods that bring in greater profitability. By doing this, she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria tiene más de 25 años de experiencia en ventas, se dedica a vender ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y tambien tiene una pulpería en la comarca de Sabana Grande de donde es originaria, esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, quien se desempeña como albañil. El negocio ha ido creciendo a medida que pasan los años, inició vendiendo de manera ambulante cosméticos y con un financiamiento logró establecer el pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación. Actualmente, cuenta con una diversidad de productos que satisface a sus clientes, quienes son personas de buen pago, ofrece sus productos al crédito y atiende todos los días de la semana. La señora señala que la mayor fuente de ingresos del hogar es el negocio, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un préstamo con el fin de invertir en compras de nuevos productos que le generan una mayor rentabilidad a su negocio y de esta forma pueda mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase shoes, perfume, and clothing for both ladies and gentlemen

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna has belonged to the Wiñarisun Communal Bank ("We Grow" in Quechua) for 10 years. She is a 47-year-old single mother of two boys. She sells clothes at the Sunday market in her neighborhood. She also has a store where she has sold groceries, fruits and vegetables for three years.

Reyna is requesting a loan of 2000 soles ($725), which she will use to purchase rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk. Her earnings will go toward building a home and caring for her youngest son.

Reyna's dreams are to build a home, enlarge her business and that her children are better off than she is.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa “Crezcamos” en quechua hace 10 años.

Reyna es madre soltera, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos varones, vive en el distrito de Quinua, Reyna vende ropa en la feria dominical de su distrito. Además Reyna tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza hace 3 años.

Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, leche.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la construcción de su casa y para los gastos de su hijo menor. Los sueños de Reyna son construir su casa, que sus hijos sean mejores que ella y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk / Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, leche.

loans.name: Sauda's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Sauda is 31 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 8 and 4 years old. Sauda owns a small grocery, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Tatu and Godliver, who have salon and grocery businesses.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Julia Juana

texts.es:
Julia is a member of the Community Bank Gracias Morenita.

Julia is married: she is 53 years old, and has 5 children. Julia is a native of the community of Cacamarca, in the district of Ocros. Julia sells groceries and coca leaves at her community fair, and buys cereal grains in her village to sell later in the markets of Ayacucho. Additionally, Julia cultivates various different grains herself.

Julia needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of maize and wheat.

The dreams of Julia are to have a car in order to transport her products, to construct a second floor on her house and to see her son a University graduate.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.

Julia es casada, tiene 53 años y 5 hijos, Julia es natural D. L. comunidad D. Cacamarca, distrito D. Ocros, Julia venD. abarrotes, hojas D. coca en L. feria D. su comunidad, y compra cereales en su pueblo que posteriormente venD. en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Julia se dedica a L. agricultura D. diferentes cereales.

Julia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. maíz y trigo.

Los sueños D. Julia son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, construir L. segunda planta D. su casa y que su hijo se titule.

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of maize and wheat.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
This simple woman, a married mother of five, sells millet porridge, or “fondé” in the national language, Wolof. With this business, she manages to support her husband and meet her own needs. She would like to buy more millet and corn to meet customer demand and increase her income.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Cette brave dame, mariée et mére de 05 enfants, vend de la bouillie de mil ou "fondé" en langue nationale Wolof. Avec cette activité, elle arrive à soutenir son époux et à subvenir à ses besoins personnelles. Elle voudrait renforcer son stock de mil et de mais pour faire face à la demande mais aussi pour augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: Porridge sales

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
This current committee was formed by some members of an older committee that dissolved quite awhile ago that got together again to form a new committee called 12 D. Junio, which currently is in it's first cycle of the program with a total of 19 women.

- Isabel Zunilda G. will invest in the purchase of candies, lollipops, cookies, alfajores, meat, bread products, discs for making empanadas, napkins.

- Justa R. M. will invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, oil, bread products, discs to make empanadas, napkins, sodas.

- Maria Susana S. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shirts, and shorts.

- María Mercedes Y. will invest in the purchase of cloths, threads and scissors.

- María Ines M. will invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, oil, bread products, discs to make empanadas, napkins, soda, and beer.

- Gladis María D. will invest in the purchase of cloths, threads, and scissors.

- Gervacia G. O. will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

- Eva Concepcion G. will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

- Carmiña D. R. G. will invest in the purchase of clothing and sweets.

- María Ester G. will invest in the purchase of cloths, threads, and scissors.

- Vilma G. D. B. will invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, oil, bread products, discs to make empanadas, napkins and soda.

- Anunciación R. L. will invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, oil, bread products, discs to make empanadas, napkins, soda and beer.

- Birina B. D. A. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shirts, and shorts.

- Fidencia M. F. will invest in the purchase of candies and honey.

- Basilisa E. D. O. will invest in the purchase of jewelry.

- Dionicia A. D. V. will invest in the purchase of cloths, threads, and scissors.

- Pabla G. G. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shirts and shorts.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El presente comité se formó mediante que algunas integrantes D. un comité antiguo que se disolvió hace ya un tiempo, se reunió nuevamente para formar un nuevo comité llamado 12 D. Junio, el cual actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo D. programa con un total D. 19 señoras.

- Isabel Zunilda G. invertirá en la compra D. caramelos, chupetines, galletitas, alfajores, carnes, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas.

- Justa R. M. invertirá en la compra D. carnes, verduras, aceite, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, gaseosas.

- Maria Susana S. invertirá en la compra D. pantalones, remeras, blusas, camisas, short.

- María Mercedes Y. invertirá en la compra D. telas, hilos, tijera.

- María Ines M. invertirá en la compra D. carnes, verduras, aceite, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, gaseosas, cervesas.

- Gladis María D. invertirá en la compra D. telas, hilos, tijera.

- Gervacia G. O. invertirá en la compra D. carbón.

- Eva Concepcion G. invertirá en la compra D. carbón.

- Carmiña D. R. G. invertirá en la compra D. ropa y dulces.

- María Ester G. invertirá en la compra D. telas, hilos, tijera.

- Edita G. D. G. invertirá en la compra D. bijouterie.

- María A. D. invertirá en la compra D. telas, hilos, tijera.

- Vilma G. D. B. invertirá en la compra D. carnes, verduras, aceite, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, gaseosas.

- Anunciación R. L. invertirá en la compra D. carnes, verduras, aceite, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, gaseosas, cervesas.

- Birina B. D. A. invertirá en la compra D. pantalones, remeras, blusas, camisas, short.

- Fidencia M. F. invertirá en la compra D. dulces y miel.

- Basilisa E. D. O. invertirá en la compra D. bijouterie.

- Dionicia A. D. V. invertirá en la compra D. telas, hilos, tijera.

- Pabla G. G. invertirá en la compra D. pantalones, remeras, blusas, camisas, short.

loans.use: Purchase of candies, lollipops, cookies, alfajores, meat, vegetables, oil, discs to make empanadas, napkins, soda, beer, pants, T-shirts, blouses, shirts, shorts, cloths, thread, scissors, charcoal, sweets, honey, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Wana

texts.fr:
Madame Wana B.  a 39 ans, mére de 1 garçon et de 2 filles  et  vit avec son époux dans une famille monogame à Koko, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo (une préfecture de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Pour des raisons socio économique ( issue d’une famille nomade d’éléveurs “Maure”) elle n’a pas fréquentée l’école, mais très tôt s’est interessée à l’activité familliale à savoir le colportage (des produits du sud vers le nord et inversement) qu’elle a apprise et maitrisée auprès de sa mère. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la  vente de tubercules ,des condiments alimentaires,des poissons(fumé et séché) des tapis etc il y’a de cela 7 ans.   
 Pour obtenir des réssources financières complémentaires elle décida de travailler avec le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant  trois ans . Elle est à son premier prêt individuel après avoir bouclé 3 prêts solidaires au sein d’une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Fotémogoban de Kadiolo ville)
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter au marché de Medine à Sikasso ville  900kg de pomme de terre et 60 sacs de choux pommés pour aller les vendre à Gao ( 7eme région administrative située au septentrion de la république du Mali) et de retour achèter 2 tapis (moyen  et grand format), 3 sacs de poissons( dont 2 fumé et 1 sèché) pour les revendre à Kadiolo à domicile et au marché.  Sa clientèle est généralement constituée de femmes
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA, qui la permettra de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wana B., 39 years old, is the mother of 1 boy and 2 girls, and lives with her husband in a monogamous household in Koko, one of the districts of the city of Kadiolo (a prefecture of the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). For socio-economic reasons (having come from a nomadic "Maure" family of cattle-rearers), she did not go to school, but became interested very early on in the family business of colportage (the transfer of goods from the south to the north and vice versa), which she learned and mastered with her mother. She has specialized in the sale of tubers, food condiments, fish (smoked and dried), carpets, etc. for 7 years now. To obtain supplementary financial resources, she has been working with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso for three years now. She is on her first individual loan after having completed 3 group loans as part of an association of women from her area (Association Fotémogoban of Kadiolo). With this loan, she plans to buy 900kg of potatoes and 60 bags of round cabbage from the Medine market in Sikasso to go and sell in Gao (the 7th administrative region of the Republic of Mali, situated in the northern region), and in return buy 2 carpets (medium and large size), 3 bags of fish (2 smoked and 1 dried) to re-sell in Kadiolo at home and at the market. Her clientele generally consists of women. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will allow her to settle her family's expenses, pay off the loan, and invest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cabbage

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
L. señora Juliana Z. D. L. C. tiene cincuentaiseis años, vive en L. avenida Primavera 116 en el distrito D. Mache, provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. L. Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa, pero no pudo continuar estudiando, debido a una grave enfermedad que le atacó a L. retina, una fuerte infección que le hizo perder parte D. L. visión.
Se casó D. treintaicinco años con Federico Sedano C., con quien tienen un hijo D. ocho años que aun está estudiando.
Trabajó desD. los catorce años, así que gozaba D. un buen capital, que lo perdió por las múltiples enfermedades que le atacaron, elL. agradece mucho a ManueL. Ramos, porque gracias a sus créditos a podido recuperar su negocio.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo D. ManueL. Ramos, hace cinco años fue D. 300 soles con ello comenzó a comprar animales menores para prepararlos y venderlos en las ferias del lugar. Fue devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2600 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará abarrotes para su bodega y con lo que le queD. comprará animales pequeños para prepararlos y venderlos en comida, que es L. mejor forma D. obtener mayores ganancias, manifiesta.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular Sol D. María y es fiscal del Banco Comunal Progresistas, lo admirable D. esta mujer es que a pesar D. su enfermedad es muy proactiva.
Su sueño es recuperar completamente L. vista para continuar trabajando y sobre todo para trabajar por su distrito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliana Zavalets D. L. C. is 56 years old, lives at Primavera 116 avenue in Mache district, Otuzco province, L. Libertad state in Peru. She completed primary education, but couldn’t continue studying due to a serious infirmity that attacked her retina. A strong infection maD. her lose part of her vision. She married at 35 years old to Federica Sedano C., with whom she has an 8 year old son who is still in school. She has worked since she was 14 years old, so she has enjoyed earning money, but she lost her earnings because of the multiple illnesses that attacked her. She thanks ManueL. Ramos because thanks to its loans she has been able to recover her business. The firs tloan that she obtained from ManueL. Ramos, 5 years ago, was for 300 soles and with it she began to buy small animals to prepare and sell them in the city’s markets. The loan was repaid in 4 months. With this loan for S/.2600 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy groceries for her store and with any remaining she will buy small animals to prepare and sell as food, which is the best way of generating the greatest profits. She belongs to the communal kitchen Sol D. María and is member of the Communal Bank Progresistas. What is admirable about this woman is that in spite of her illness she is very proactive. Her dream is to completely recover her vision in order to continue working and above all to work for her district.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of groceries and small meat animals.

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es: La señora Argentina habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 46 años de edad, se encuentra soltera, solamente vive con sus hijos de 20 y 25 años quienes trabajan. Actualmente la señora Argentina tiene un carretón de caballos donde realizar acarreos,  donde dio inicio a esta actividad hace 6 años con un préstamo que hizo y así pudo comprar su primer caballo para ponerlo a trabajar, por tanto solicita nuevamente otro crédito de C$ 7,000 aun plazo de 7 meses para adquirir otro caballo y tener dos carretones trabajando, ya que de esta forma le permitirá obtener mas ingresos y poder en un futuro comprar una camioneta para hacer acarreos mas largos y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Argentina V. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, located in the capital city of Managua. She is 46 years old and single. She lives with her children, who are 20 and 25 years old and who work. Ms. Argentina currently has a horse-drawn cart with which she transports goods. She started her business 6 years ago with a loan that she took out, which was how she was able to purchase her first horse to put it to work. Hence, she is once again requesting a loan of C$ 7,000.00 Nicaraguan córdobas, to be repaid in 7 monthly installments, so that she can purchase another horse and have two horse-drawn carts working. Thus, she can obtain more income and in the future be able to purchase a truck to make longer trips so that she can keep supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a horse

loans.name: Neun

texts.en:
Mr. Neun T., 44, is a local fisherman who always depends on fishing in Tunle Sap Lake, which has a lot of fish. His wife, Mrs. Seap Ly, 44, is a rice farmer and they live with their four children, two of whom are working as construction workers to help in reducing the family’s daily expenses.

Neun is applying for 500,000 riel ($125) to purchase more fishing tools, including nets, traps and cast nets. The loan will help to increase his income, to buy food and to pay his kids' school fees. They all live in Chroloung Commune, Kompong Tom Province. (Mr. Neun's wife is pictured, because Mr. Neun was not available that time).

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Greetings from J.Pierre  R. in Kigali, Rwanda! 

J.Pierre is 31 years old, married with one child.

He owns a small shop in his local area. He sells domestic materials like soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, beans, Colgate, paraffin and biscuits. From all his business activities, he earns about $150 per month. He employs two people to help him running this business.

J.Pierre is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwf, which will help him to expand his business. This loan will be repaid in eight months.

loans.use: Expand his Business

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen B. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children – four males and three females. She says five of her children are out of school and are working. Currently, her last two children are in junior high school.

Ellen’s husband is an artist, a carver by profession. He carves artifacts such as dolls and sells them, mostly to foreigners who normally show interest.

Ellen is a food vendor. She lives with her children in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She cooks rice and ‘banku’. Banku is a local food prepared from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She buys bags of rice and maize from Kumasi.

Ellen has been in business for over twenty years. She wants to buy bags of rice and maize on a large scale so that she can cut down on cost, and on frequent trips to procure goods.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and maize

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Cette jeune ziguinchoroise gére une téléboutique. Elle offre des services variés : fax, éléphone, vente de carte de crédit pour téléphone mobile etc
Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités et augmenter ses revenus. Avec son activiét, elle soutient sa mére qui est veuve dans le populaire quartier de Grand Dakar au sud de Ziguinchor.
texts.en:
This young woman comes from Ziguinchor and manages a tele-boutique. She offers varied services: fax, telephone, sale of rechargeable cell phone cards, etc. She is requesting this loan to bolster her little business and increase her income. The revenue from this business allows her to support her mother who is a widow and lives in the working class neighborhood of Grand Dakar in the south of Ziguinchor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering her little business

loans.name: Uonn

texts.en: K., an innocent female, age 30, is a crop planter living in the Siem Reap Province. She has been growing various kinds of crops such as potatoes, cucumbers, gourds, etc. To sustain the family income, K. also works as a local construction worker when she's not laboring on her plantation. From this, she has earned a better income for her family's savings. Her husband’s name is Moung, 27, and he also works as a local construction worker. K. has one child who is still young and attends school. Nowadays, K. is facing a problem with the family transportation. She has to both work and take her child to school. Anyway, she is tired of taking the motor-taxi. So, K. is requesting a loan of $300 to buy a motor for herself and her family transportation. The loan will help the family achieve a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy a motor for herself and her family transportation

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir M. is 46 years old and married with four children. His business has been the purchase and sale of livestock, which he offers once a week in the livestock market where he takes his animals. Sabir grew up in the countryside and being close to nature is very gratifying for him.

The difficulty arises in transporting his livestock, but Sabir isn't discouraged by this and works very hard to fulfill his dreams. He wants financial stability so he can educate all his children. With this loan he hopes to acquire more heads of cattle to help generate additional income. With that income, he would like to start another business; he is still analyzing and deciding exactly what business that will be. Sabir is a trusted client of KIVA and Aqroinvest; he has a successful loan history and paid back an earlier KIVA loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Juntos de la Mano (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank. She is 51 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are now adults. Four of her five children are married and have children of their own, while her youngest daughter is still single.

Victoria runs a butcher shop in a rented space in Anta, a town about forty minutes outside of the city of Cusco. She works seven days a week, from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. She usually works alone, though sometimes her daughters help out. Victoria has sold meat for the past twenty years. She sells about 1500 soles (US$476) worth of meat each day, of which 80-100 soles (US$25-$32) is profit.

Victoria needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy beef, lamb, pork and alpaca meat. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full. Her goal for the future is to build a small barn in which to raise pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.use: Buy beef, lamb, pork and alpaca meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 36 years old, divorced and the mother of two children. She divorced when she realized the husband was giving himself too much to alcohol and neglecting his family responsibilities. Currently, both her children are in school through the help of free compulsory education and a school feeding program. 

For three years, Mary has been selling grocery products on a table in her neighborhood to support her family. She says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products like tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products and skimmed milk to increase her inventory. Mary believes the loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Nkwagyedom’ which literally means "savior of the multitude".

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tin fish, tin tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Anisie

texts.en:
Anasie D. has been an agricultural entrepreneur for more than 10 years.  Agriculture is the work that he created for himself and this is only one activity that brings bread into his home.  Because he is the dad of three children he has to care about them and to maintain them.

Last spring Ion built two greenhouses in which he increases his supply of vegetables. These vegetables are sold by Ion at a wholesale market at a lower price. This year he believes that he will have a better harvest in comparison with the previous year because rain during this spring was rich and frosts have not touched plants.

loans.use: Increase the stock of goods

loans.name: Ifuho

texts.en:
Ifuho S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to open up a charcoal store as a strategic location for sale. She is 30 years old and a mother of three children who all go to school. She is married to a professional primary teacher who teaches in Buluk "A" primary school. With the future profits from her loan, she intends to pay school fees for her children. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

 BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: opening up a charcoal store

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina O. is a widow and has 4 children. She has received schooling through Junior High School. Dina sells fish and onions at New Takoradi. She has been in this business since 1999. Dina will use the loan to buy more fish and onions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dina plans to reinvest to increase her capital and profit to enable her pay her children’s school fees and her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more fish and onions for resale.

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Атахонов Бахтиер проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Бахтиер со своей семьей, более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Он покупает, откармливает и продает мелко рогатый скот. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bahtier A. lives in the Rumy district. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Bahtier and his family have been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He buys, feeds and sells small livestock. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick O. is 55, married and has 5 children. He is a commercial bus driver. He hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase a second-hand bus.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand bus

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 55-year-old married woman with four children between 10 and 27 years old.  Three of her children are in school. The eldest child is working. She resides in and owns a one-room house where she is staying with six people. Margaret doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area where she owns a stall selling bananas in Kalerwe market.  She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work.  Margaret sells to an average of 25 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.  She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Margaret has been with MCDT for eight years and is servicing her 16th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clusters of bananas. Margaret aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent home. 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more banana clusters

loans.name: Miguel Filiberto

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Filiberto J. ha tenido ya seis créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente.
Don Miguel tiene ya siete años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes esté negocio y su emplea, son la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que tiene cuatro hijos y les quiere dar la mejor educación para su futuro.
Actual mente al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía que sus clientes le están solicitando que venda para la comodidad de ellos. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y crecimiento del negocio, y no se quiere arriesgar el ingreso del negocio ya que es la mayor parte del ingreso familiar. Es por eso que decidió solicitar un préstamo para la inversión y así estar mas seguro. 
El planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que percibe de su trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Filiberto J. has had six loans with FVP which he has paid back punctually. For the last seven years, Miguel has had his business selling groceries and his job is the main source of income for his family. He has four children for whom he wants to provide a good education for their future. Currently his business lacks the variety of products that his customers are asking for since it would be convenient. Right now he does not have the necessary capital to invest in the growth of his business, especially since he doesn't want to risk the funds that form such a major part of his family's income. It was for this reason that he decided to ask for a loan to invest as a safer option. His pan is to pay the loan back with the salary he earns from working as a security guard at a company.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia O. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 49 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mariée, mère de 5 enfants, Madame Awa C. a 45 ans et vit  avec son époux et ses enfants  dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  
N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer les études, Madame Awa n’a pas pris du temps à s’accrocher aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman depuis son jeune âge et l’exerce pour elle-même il y a 20 ans de cela. Son activité principale est la vente des  chaussures et autres articles divers. En plus du commerce, elle fait de la prestation de services, car elle est coiffeuse également, une activité qui lui est très rentable, elle est très bien sollicitée par  bon nombres de  femmes de la ville de Koutiala. 
En vu d’augmenter son fonds de commerce  et satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité, elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter,  40 paires de chaussures  et 10 sacs. Elle s’approvisionne à  Bamako  et effectue sa vente en ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée  de jeunes filles et de femmes mariées,  au comptant ou a crédit.  
Avec l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire , elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire ses besoins, entretenir ses enfants  et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de chaussures et sacs.

loans.name: Moussa Aboul

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des ruminants et des volailles, en vendant des moutons et des poules. Il a démarré cette activité dans le marché de Gbossimé à Lomé en 1999. Il dispose de longues années expériences dans le domaine et maîtrise parfaitement tous les rouages de cette activité. Il réalise de bonnes affaires pendant les fêtes de fin d’année ou lors d’autres périodes de réjouissances. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 02 enfants. Pour acheter d’autres ruminants et volailles, il sollicite urgemment avant les fêtes de fin d’année un crédit de WAGES ; ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 moutons ou béliers et 50 poules.

loans.use: Achat de moutons et de volailles

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Isoken is 43 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and drinks and has been in the business for the past four years. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a civil servant. She hopes for the loan of N50000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks you for the support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Souadou

texts.fr: Souadou B. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO depuis 07 ans et demi. Son prêt lui permet de développer une activité de vente de poissons séchés. Elle soutien sa famille à partir des bénéfices qu'elle réalise.
texts.en:
Souadou B. is a 51-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO for 7½ years. Her loan enables her to develop a business selling dried fish. She supports her family with the profits she makes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her business selling fish

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia MARUJA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de frazadas que son traídos de la ciudad de Marangani de la provincia de Sicuani. Nuestra socia por las mañanas trabaja de secretaria en la UGEL de Urubamba y por las tardes alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de frazadas. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como frazadas así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARUJA, 44, is a member of the "Vilcanota" communal bank. She is married and has two children. She and her children live in Urubamba province, which is located north of the city of Cusco. She has a small shop where she sells blankets that come from the city of Marangani, Sicuani province. During the mornings she is employed at Urubamba's UGEL (Local Peruvian public shool) and during afternoons she alternates her household chores with blanket sales. She has been in this line of work for several years now and has done very well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising mother that wants to see her children get ahead. She requires financing to buy merchandise like blankets to increase her stock inventory so that her earnings will be increased and thus provide a better quality of life for her children. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, like blankets, to increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Siempre Amigas" esta representada por la señora Maria Kelly y conformada por 14 miembros que ya van ingresando a un segundo ciclo demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos así como capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados. Cada una de las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de comida, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, arroz, joyas y al servicio de peluquería, carpintería y lavandería. Las socias están concientes que lo que realmente hace la diferenta entre un negocio y otro es el trato que se brinda a los clientes para que se hagan fieles a los productos ofrecidos por las socias es por esto que no tienen mucha competencia en su mercado laboral. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas que les ayude a generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a su experiencia las socias tropezaron con algunas malas socias en el grupo anterior pero supieron salir adelante y cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos trabajando en equipo y de forma unida.
texts.en:
The "Siempre Amigas" ("Always Friends") group is represented by Maria Kelly and consists of 14 members who are entering their second loan cycle demonstrating honesty and responsibility with their payments as well as the ability to administer the funds. Each one of the members makes a living in different commercial activities, such as selling food, cosmetics, groceries at neighborhood stores, rice, jewelry, as well as offering hair-cutting, carpentry and laundry services. The members are aware that what really separates one business from another is its treatment of its customers, and it's for this reason they don't have too much competition. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise, ingredients and tools that will help the members generate more income to be able to give their families a better quality of life. In regards to their loan experience, the group ran into some bad members in a previous group, but they have kept moving forward and have been timely with their payments working together as a team.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes G. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Managua desde hace 9 años, donde desempeña el cargo de Conserje. 

Ella es casada con una persona a su cargo. Ella vive en la Villa Roma en Managua la capital de Nicaragua, desde hace 24 años.

Es el segundo crédito que solicita en CEPRODEL, los que utiliza para hacer mejoras en su vivienda. La cual ha ido mejorando para poder tener una vivienda digna, donde no le da vergüenza abrir la puerta según nos expresa ella.

Se siente agradecida con CEPRODEL por brindarle este apoyo, ya que le permite mejorar también la calidad de vida de su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes G. works for the Mayoralty of Managua for 9 years, where she works as a concierge.

She is married with one person under her care. She lives in Villa Roma in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, for some 24 years.

This is her second loan that she gets with CEPRODEL that will be used to make repairs to her home. She has been improving her house to have a dignified home, where she will not be ashamed of opening her door, so she tells us.

She is grateful to CEPRODEL for bringing her the support that will permit her to improve the quality of life of her small family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her home:  buy material like blocks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Basilio

texts.es: Pedro Basilio tiene 57 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de pan. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, el tiene que salir los fines de semana para ofrecer sus productos ya que además de dedicarse a esto también labora como guardia de seguridad en un empresa, ya que los ingresos que obtiene son muy pocos, el siempre busca la manera de salir adelante con su humilde medio de vida, el tiene ciertos clientes que le compran sus productos, a él le gusta mucho interactuar con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pan que es su materia prima necesaria. El sueño de Pedro es seguir con esta actividad que le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro Basilia is 57 years old and sells bread in order to make a living. He has been in this business for more than five years. Pedro sells his products on the weekends because he also works at a company as a security guard, but his wages are very low. He is always looking for ways to get ahead in life since he is of modest means. Pedro has a few customers who buy his products and enjoys interacting with them.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy bread. His dream is to continue this business since it helps to improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married to Elizabeth Waithera, and they have four children, two employed and two still going to school.  He has been running a butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be his second loan after paying off the first loan well.  He plans to buy more goats which he will raise and slaughter, providing him with a cheap means of getting meat to sell.

His future dream is to expand his shop and open other outlets within Naivasha town.  This will increase his income and also enable him create employment for other people in the town.

loans.use: Buy more goats

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Virgilio O. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. He is 50 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Virgilio owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Virgilio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Virgilio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Aita

texts.fr: Madame Aita S. habite a Yoff dans le quartier de Ndeugagne.Elle est agee de 55 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis novembre 2009. Elle est mariée, sans enfants mais a en  charge 3 filles. Elle est éducatrice  en arabe dans une école  franco-arabe du quartier. Elle a choisi cette profession sous l’influence de son père qui lui a inculque cette éducation. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans sa profession c’est le fait de transmettre le savoir. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs pour assurer le transport  et les frais lies au pèlerinage de ses enfants et sœurs à l’ occasion du Maouloud. Son objectif est d’améliorer  la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aita S. lives in the Ndeugagne neighborhood of Yoff. She is 55 years old, and has been a member of the Yoff branch of U-IMCEC since November 2008. She is married without children of her own, but has three other children under her care. She is an Arabic teacher in a neighborhood Franco-Arabian school. She chose this profession influenced by her father who instilled this learning in her. What attracts her most in her profession is the transmission of knowledge to others. She is requesting a loan for 75,000 Francs, to deal with transportation and other costs her children and sisters will incur during a pilgrimage linked to festivities celebrating Maouloud (birth of the prophet Mohammed). Her objective is to improve her family’s social situation.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Social need

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamin tiene 62 años, es un hombre muy entusiasta, casado con Rosalía de 65 años, y juntos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos, en su casa propia, hecho de material rustico. Desde hace 18 años que se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, papa y todas clase de  verduras que producen es esta zona y con la ayuda eventual de su esposa, quien se encarga la mayor parte del tiempo a su hogar. Él manifiesta no quejarse de lo sacrificado que es su labor, pero si le molesta tener que trasladar sus pesados sacos, llenos de productos hacia el mercado de su ciudad, y aún más cuando se eleva el precio de fertilizantes, elementos que le ayuda para mejorar la producción de sus siembras. Como siempre, Benjamin piensa en el bienestar de su familia, como se muestra en la foto, en donde esta cavando la instalación de desagüe para su casa y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida, asimismo con el tiempo, busca convertirse en criador de cuyes y en el cebado de toros, por la demanda que tiene en el mercado. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que espera cumplir con sus propósitos, asimismo desea continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal, por estar integrado por personas responsables. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes, además de una bolsa de semilla de alverja.
texts.en:
Benjamín, 62, is an enthusiastic man, married to Rosalía, 65. They have 4 children, of whom only one still lives with them, in their own home, which is made of rudimentary materials. He has been a farmer for the last 18 years growing corn, potatoes and all kinds of vegetables that grow in this area with occasional help from his wife who, for the most part, is in charge of her household. He does not complain about the hard work but he is bothered by having to lug the heavy sacks full of his products to market in the city even more so when prices of fertilizer, which he needs to improve crop yields, rise As always, Benjamín is concerned with his family’s wellbeing as is shown in the photo where he is digging a drainage ditch for his house thereby improving his quality of life. I time, he’d like to become good at raising guinea pigs and cattle because they are in high demand in the market. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he hopes to meet his goals; he also wants to continue to work with his communal group because it’s composed of responsible persons. He will use the 2500 new soles requested to buy several sacks of organic manure and fertilizers as well as a sack of pea seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Filipe Bernardo

texts.pt:
Filipe Bernardo Marrengula nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 32 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 13 e 02 anos de idade, os mais velhos vai a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou porque tem problemas de visão. Vive na casa cedida pela instituição onde trabalha com a sua família e de vez enquanto sustenta seus pais enviando alguns bens de consumo.
Saiu da matola para Boane quando começou a constituir a sua família. Ė Funcionário do Ministério da Educação a título de contrato há 2 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, tem um salário mensal de 7.400.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de mobilizações. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, ferro, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.800.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 30.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para poder concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Filipe Bernardo was born in town of Matola, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. He is 32 years old, married and the father of two children who are 13 and 2 years old. The oldest is in school. He finished 10th grade but didn't continue due to problems in his sight. He lives with his family in a house loaned by the institution that employs him. Occasionally, he helps his parents by sending them a few goods. He left Matola to go to Boane when he started his family. He has been working for the Ministry of Education as a contractor for two years. He does not have any employees. His monthly salary is 7.400.00mt, which goes to household expenses. He also manages to put some money into a savings account. He has never requested loans from other banks. He came to know Hluvuku through campaigns. This loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt is his fourth. He intends to buy building materials (cement, logs, iron, zinc screens and others) in order to continue to build his home. The previous loans were for 5.800.00mt, 6.000.00mt and 30.000.00mt and were all applied towards the same activity. He is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, he would like to request more loans to finish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (cement, logs, iron, zinc screens and others)

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, cette femme vit dans le quartier Lomnava à baguida qui est une ville à 15 km de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de produits génériques, en ce moment elle fait face à une dimunition de son stock de marchandises, étant une vieille cliente de WAGES, elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES 5 prêts qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un 6ème prêt pour l’achat de divers produits génériques.
texts.en:
This lady is married with four children and lives in the Lomnava neighborhood of Baguida, a town 15 km from Lomé [Togo's capital]. To earn her living she sells a variety of merchandise at retail. Currently her innventory is low. As a longtime client of WAGES she has had five loans, all repaid timely, and is now seeking a sixth loan to build up her inventory.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products for resale at retail
